Admittedly, I was concerned  that the hotel is in the middle of renovations.  They were very up front about the work, and noise it would cause.  There were even notes about when and where the renovations were taking place, and complimentary ear plugs haha!

Our newly renovated room had two comfortable beds, a bench AND a sofa!   The onsite gym was very clean and had commentary towels and water.  They even have a laundry room with a free washer and dryer.

Great location! This hotel is right in the heart of downtown.  It's two blocks from the Epicenter and close to plenty of restaurants and entertainment.

This will be my new go-to for my Charlotte visits!

The lobby is on the third floor, with parking underneath.  Upper floors are being renovated.  It was pretty noisy throughout the night with various sounds.  They make a point of letting customers know about the renovations, but they also assure you that your room won't be near it either.  We were placed an an incorrect room at first, but they made it right the next morning.  We were relocated to one of the newly renovated rooms.  It doesn't seem like they were quite ready yet, but the rooms are definitely an improvement. 

The price is not bad for what you get.  There is no pool, but there is a small workout room and business center.  I think the hotel is by far not the best I have ever stayed in, but definitely not the worse.  Hoping for great improvements once the repair/renovation is complete.

The location is great.  Very near to anything you might want to do or see.  Time Warner Cable Arena is a couple of blocks, as is the EpiCentre.  This is reason enough for me to return here.

This review is not only about this location but also the Old Statesville Rd, Huntersville and Clanton Rd.  Yesterday my car was struck at 3:40 pm, and I was informed by my insurance to give Enterprise a call.  I called the S. Tryon St location and no answer after 20 rings. So I called 9th Street, with a similar outcome, but was put on hold for more than a half hour and called the 800 #. After speaking to a woman she said the Clanton St location had cars.  I said "OK have them pick me up", but that location would not (It was too close to closing time).  I wasn't going to walk to that location, this goes against their motto that they will pick you up.  They must have banker hours, because if you actually get through at 5:30 they won't pick you up.  I decided to call the 800 # again and make a reservation for the next day.  I get the confirmation email and I thought everything was set for 11:30 the next day.  11:45 rolls by, so I call and It was the wrong location, as I thought I told the CSR the day before and Old Statesville transfers my "Reservation" to Huntersville.  I call Huntersville and they have no cars, I call back Old Statesville and they have no cars. So I call the 800 # again and the CSR tells me my nearest  location is the Airport! I do not live close to the airport at all, and the CSR would not listen to me.  I call the "Help Desk," and they weren't any help, I inferred "Bend over and bite this stick." This Company is the a great example of The Seinfeld episode They Can take reservations, but they can't keep reservations. Did they not know the DNC was in town and to prepare themselves? I guess not!  I will avoid this company and their false motto. Thanks for wasting 17 hrs of my life!

I stayed here for 2 nights while in Charlotte for business.  It's a very nice hotel.  The front desk clerk was very personable, friendly and accomodating.  My room was really nice and spacious.  I had a view of the city which was nice but I didn't get to really enjoy since I was not in the room much.  The bed... Heavenly.  The Westin is known for their Heavenly beds and it definitely was.  High thread count sheets and fluffy pillows... the best night sleep I've ever had while on vacation.  I thought about working out at the nice gym but the bed... couldn't get out of it.  Room service was good, but expensive.  $12 for pastries and fruit?!  Well it is room service and when is that ever cheap?  Had a nice stay and will probably stay here again if I have to come back to visit.

It's a Westin, you pretty much know the deal if you stay at them often- but they do vary a bit in terms of overall quality, though Charlotte leans a bit toward the low end for a Westin, I'm afraid. It is a sleek, newish building with the cool, polished feel that most Westin's throw down. The Ember Grille was nearly empty at dinnertime, and the environment was cold and stark. You would think something with "ember" in its name would emit a bit of warmth in its ambiance. The menu seemed a little limited, and we were starving and I was getting cranky so we actually opted for the bar for appetizers while we decided what to do. I highly recommend the "10" sampler, which included small bites of rare ahi, goat cheese quesadilla, buffalo wings, hummus and smoked salmon. Great deal for $14. J got a delicious Kobe burger and we relaxed in the spacious bar, and soaked in the cocktail hour jazz piano. Room service was just okay. The staff was all very pleasant with the exception of the disinterested waiter in the bar; strangest service I may have ever encountered. I think maybe he was trying to pull off some sort of NYC attitude schtick in Charlotte. It was amusing at least. Nice stay, nice location. No MSNBC, this and the waiter cost them a star.

Typically great Westin experience. I was able to get a room here for less than a Hampton around the corner, so I was stoked. I ended up getting to the room at 1am and was out by 7am, but it was a "heavenly" sleep!

Was here for the Manufacturers South Convention back in the spring this year.  Stayed 2 nights.  The biggest reason for selecting the hotel was the fact it is directly beside the convention center.  And upon arrival, it was clear this was the typical Westin experience.  

This is a really fine hotel.

Upon arrival, the head bellman was actually better than some bellmen at other Westins I have stayed in, and the staff professionalism continued to the check-in staff.  So that was a little surprise. The Westins near ORD, SFO, and DFW are not quite as polished in my opinion (but still good).

Had a room with a view of the city center.  Which was good, because this hotel sits just on the edge of downtown and just across the interstate in the other direction are strip clubs (so the quality of community drops of pretty quick).  But toward the city it is fairly close to good dining and nightlife.  No need to bother with a car unless you're headed out to get in a round of golf.

Parking fee was a bit steep, $25 per day for valet.  I think I recall $18 for self parking.  I actually ended up getting billed for both, but called and they took care of it.

Very nice in hotel dining and bar, as would be expected.  The bar is quite open to the lobby lounge with high ceiling.  And the bar staff are very easy on the eyes.  Additionally, the property is fairly new, so art and architecture feel very modern.  Rooms are nicely appointed and exceptionally comfortable.

I'm quite sure that when back in Charlotte I will stay here again.

I love this hotel. For some, it might seem too 'far' from downtown (3 blocks), but for me it's in great location. Walk to everything, including the Stadium, Convention Center, Downtown, and the Epicenter. 

Service is great - I would expect it! It's the Westin! From the time you get out of a scorching hot taxi (even with air conditioning on) up until the time you leave at 6 in the morning 3 days later. I haven't experience a single hiccup (except a spider in my bathtub that scared the hell out of me one night). 

Amenities are great:

Room - 4 stars. Last time I was here, I got a room with a great walking shower bathroom. This time, it was the regular small bathroom. Last time, my friend managed to get a room with a treadmill (yes, they exist!), this time they were all sold out. I got stuck on the 6th floor, she got stuck on the fourth floor. This was an upgrade for me, as last time I was on the 4th floor as well. Ok, enough bitching. The rooms are great. Beds are called heavenly for a reason and all the condiments and towels and sheets are so fresh you feel energized be mere being in the room. Air Conditioning is a bit loud so either turn if off for the night or bring ear plugs.

Gym - 5 stars. From the variety of the workout options to the gym facilities - everything screams class. Perfectomundo! Individual TV screens for every machine (bike, elliptical, treadmill) help time pass by while working out and watching "True Blood" on HBO. Hmmm. Plenty of channels to choose from, though. Sauna, showers, and the locker room are squeaky clean with plenty of extra shampoo, lotion and mouth wash.

Pool - 3 stars. Even though this is a great big lap pool, it's too shallow - only 3  1/2 feet deep. I understand that they don't want kids to drown there if unattended, but come on, waist-deep pool is not very appealing to me.

Ember Grill - 4 stars. I have only been here for breakfast - I can't complain, except for the prices. $18 for breakfast is a little steep. However, you can eat all you want from 6 a.m. to 10 a.m. and nobody will kick you out (not that I have done that, I swear!).

Business Center - 1 star. Ok, what they call a business center is actually a 50 square foot room with 3 workstations, a printer and a fax machine. Internet is pay-per-minute, except to check in on your airline's website and print the boarding pass (which was actually all I needed from the Business Center). However, for travelers who actually need a business center - better bring the laptop and stay in your room with $12.95/day internet service.

Airport Transportation - 5 stars. Checking out at 4 a.m.? Take advantage of the flat rate towncar that will take you directly to the airport. Air-conditioned bliss!

Ok, let's summarize: I would give this hotel a solid 4 stars and would definitely stay here again. Not because I have to, but because I loved it twice!

They must have read my review. Since my last visit, they remodeled the hotel bar and improved the seating capacity. The hotel restaurant menu was revamped and now offer an all-you-can-eat cold or hot breakfast with over 20 items to choose from. Much much better!

Also, several towncars and SUVs waiting outside to take you to the airport for a similar flat rate as a cab but far more roomy and stylish.

Don't waste your time staying here if you are a business traveler. The Internet is awful and they don't support iPhone or iPad 

So many better options around

I had a tremendously positive experience at this Westin (the 12th-ish or so I've stayed at this year).  

- Beautiful, very new-seeming property
- Great location pretty close to anything you'll need
- Reasonable prices on self-parking
- Excellent service
- Extremely clean, well-kept and comfy space (I was on the 22nd floor...so I suppose I can only speak for it)
- Upgraded to a corner suite that was amazing---very well appointed, functional and comfortable

Again, this is my 12th or so Westin stay this year---and it has been the best of all of those.

I stayed three nights at the Westin with a group for a conference. The staff was courteous in all of my interactions with them, which were few.  The room was tiny for the amount of money that we were paying, but it was clean. 

I was a bit upset that their website advertised in-room refrigerators, but the only fridge was the mini-bar which required a hotel staffer to open (and which was labelled as being 'not for guest items'). Having specific dietary requirements, I had planned on using the fridge to purchase small items that i could snack on during the conference that I was attending.  

I was also extremely upset at the cost of the dining options at the Westin, as well as the charges for *every* service that they offered.  This hotel was a bit of a splurge for me, even sharing it with some friends.  Two cups of coffee per room per day, extras can be purchased.  Internet (slow!) only available in the lobby, in-room you have to pay for it.  Ridiculous charges for room service, and the cost of the food itself was astronomical!  NINE DOLLARS for a bowl of oatmeal in the morning, or $20 if you wanted the breakfast buffet.  I would have been happy to pay $10-$15 for the breakfast bar, but $20 is way too much even for a 'resort' hotel.  

Next time a conference I'm attending is in Charlotte, I'll be looking at other properties in close proximity to the conference center or staying further out and riding the train in.

Stayed here while working the NASCAR race at the nearby Charlotte Motor Speedway. I'm glad the room was paid for by the company, as I don't feel like it was really a $170/night room. There wasn't anything wrong, particularly, but it wasn't "all that" either. The gym and pool looked decent. The bed was very, very comfy. Food (including room service) was WAY over-priced. 

The location right downtown, near the convention center is great. I would suggest taking a walk over to Brevard Court, near Church street to hit the little alley of bars and restaurants. They've got great atmosphere and reasonable prices (The Belfast and Valhalla in particular).
Heavenly Bed.  Nuff said

Spent 3 days at event. Room was comfortable. Bed was restful. 
Staff was very professional! Very helpful and ready to solve any issue. Oh, ask for Pattie in lobby bar. What a hoot! Loads of fun!
In short, good experience, great food at Embers Restaurant and nice room.

The Westin is your standard business traveler hotel in your standard business traveler city, (which is about as warm and fuzzy as I can get about the stepford city of Charlotte).  It has some really great aspects to it, and some less great aspects:

Good.  Great.  Grand, even.
1.  The fitness facility has a "club" feel with its low light, and has a good variety of equipment, ample mats, weighted balls, and stability balls.  What it's missing is a good machine for lats, but other than that, it's better than most hotel gyms.
2.  That darn bed is so comfortable I can't even stand it.
3.  Catering services from the hotel and their meeting space is well-supported, and well-done.  

Not so good.  Troubling.  Odd.
1.  There's a phenomenon out there called "sensory branding," and one of the ways to engage a customer's senses to get them to remember your brand is via smell, so the hallways are piped with smell.  A horrible, putrid, over-the-top, overpowering lavender-y spell is that so perfurme-y and strong that I literally coughed all the way down the hall to my room.  Having this be your welcome to your room?  I think not.  I held my breath the rest of the week.  
2.  The service in the lounge of the hotel is virtually nonexistent.  You'll see your cocktail server every 30 to 40 minutes.  This has been consistent through three different visits to the hotel and its lounge.
3.  The person who checked me in assured me of a great view.  The roof of the convention center is not/was not/will never be that.

(WiFi is free for Starwood Preferred Guest members, paid for others)

I'm giving this 3 stars because of the nice modern decor, and because of the fact that they always called us by our names when we called the front desk (I'm a sucker for that kind of thing).

We were in town for a comic book convention, so we got a rate of $119 per night. This still seems expensive, but it was a popular weekend so we didn't shop around much more.

The wait for the elevators was ridiculous! I guess that there's not much that can be done about such a thing, but waiting for 10 minutes at a time because every elevator that stops is FULL TO THE BRIM with people was annoying. At once point, my husband took the stairs back to our room WHICH WAS ON THE ELEVENTH FLOOR after visiting the Starbucks in the lobby. Oh, and it's not a full Starbucks so they didn't even have iced coffee...???

The room was nice- we were on the end of a hallway, which I had heard was good because of the views and tons of windows. There were a ton of windows, but they overlooked construction and highways. Meh. The shower/bathtub situation was pretty awesome, also with tons of windows (there were shades, if you wished to pull them down!). There seemed to be no fan in the bathroom, though, which surprised me. 

Also, there was a burnt out bulb in the bathroom, right near the magnifying mirror; when we called down to the front desk to have it replaced they said it would take them a while...and it did. Also, this is a small thing, but they put lotion in the shower instead of shampoo (next to the conditioner). So I washed my hair with lotion. Yeah.

We visited the bar on Saturday night between 10 and 11 and it was insane. It took us 40 minutes to get a drink, which we expected, but people behind us were being served first! I guess that's our fault for not being savvy enough to know how to get served in bars? Also, one bartender with red curly hair was making drinks kind of ridiculously- packing more ice in when she ran out of something and choosing things at random to pour in the glasses. We were glad the the person who finally served us (our overpriced cocktails) seemed to be measuring a little more carefully.

A few more details: Parking is $18 and they bill it to your room; pretty standard for a downtown Charlotte hotel, but not exactly a welcome charge on your bill. The pool is inside. Someone on Yelp said that there is a rooftop bar at the Westin, but they must have gotten rid of it because we were told there was no such thing when we asked.

In conclusion, I think I prefer the Courtyard Marriot a few blocks over, on Tryon. The location is a little better, the rooms a little cheaper, and the pool is outdoors (on a rooftop!).

There is a lot to like about this place. The amenities are very good. Starbucks in the bedroom, flat screen TV, a bed that's probably more comfortable than your own, clean bathrooms with toiletries you want to stuff into your bag each night, etc.

The only downside is this sneaking feeling that almost everything costs just a little bit extra. It seems ridiculous. You could go to a cheaper, less good hotel, and all the amenities and perks are complimentary. But here, at the Westin, it seems, if they don't get you in the wash, then they'll get you in the rinse. So far the only thing "complimentary" here seems to be the workout center.

So drop the cash and enjoy the comfort, just don't think about dropping the cash until after your stay.

Hubby and I like to hang out in Charlotte on the weekends, and this is definately a great hotel. If you want to relax - it is suitable, but if you want to people watch and have a great drink - the lounge works too! 

The rooms are always the same -  clean, cool and with a descent view of the Queen City! I have called ahead, and booked through the reservations line - and this is the only complaint I have. 

One time I visited, they did not have my reservation on file. The front desk obviously does not share the information that the main booking line has. They had actually reserved a room in Columbia, SC in error - then charged us for not showing up !? 

Everything was resolved a week later so we got over it! 

Also, if you stop in the bar on the way out, or just chill down there to enjoy the view -- you just might run into a celebrity. I refuse to name drop, but we have spotted a couple of celebrities there, and they are usually pretty friendly !

There are much better choices in uptown Charlotte!  Let me start with the good...the front desk staff. The three people who assisted me at the front desk were extremely friendly and helpful. Great customer service!

Now the bad...stains. There is no other way to describe everything in my room. Multiple stains on the carpeting and the comforter. The bathrobe hanging on the back of the bathroom door had a huge brown stain on the sleeve that I kept telling myself was makeup from the last occupant. Every, yes every, bath towel had a stain (either black or yellow). There was stained grout behind the toilet like it had leaked sometime in the past. Even the shower curtain was stained. Then there was the hair dryer. It was sooooo sticky that I didn't even want to touch it. It appeared to be covered in about 15 years worth of cheap hairspray. 

I can appreciate that the hotel is getting older and may need a renovation soon, but come on people!  How about you splurge and replace your bath towels and hair dryers now!  

Let me be clear that I think the cleaning staff is doing the best they can with what they have been given. They just need a better starting product!
Westins have the best bed linens...my room was a little too hot for me...air set to 64 and was still a bit warm.  Otherwise, very nice place.

Really enjoyed this place during a conference at the hotel for 600+ people.  Nice upscale appearance, very accommodating staff, and great breakfast and lunches for a big crowd all were reasons for my satisfaction.  Lastly, I requested and received a room with a "roll-in" shower to assist me with a chronic back problem.  That plus the comfortable bed minimized my back discomfort during the meeting.  BTW, special group parking rates and room rates were a great value added factor!  Great place for a meeting.  
Just one more thing, you can get takeout from the restaurant if you want to get around the in room fees for dining.

A beautiful hotel with accommodating staff and good amenities. The catering is splendid. The food is fresh and REALLY good! I don't need to say anymore than what has been said about the beds. Just the best there is. Bathrooms are modern and clean. Charlotte's beauty can be seen out my window. Stay here!

***The Westin Charlotte has a great location in Downtown Charlotte (within walking distance to so many key Charlotte attractions) and the hotel is contemporary and comfortable***

While I mostly stay at Marriott hotels, Westin hotels (of Starwood) are nice and typically more contemporary than Marriotts.  Westin hotels are also known for their comfortable beds though I personally do not notice much of a difference compared to Marriotts.  The Westin in Downtown Charlotte definitely delivered on Westin's contemporary image and comfortable rooms.

The rooms are not incredibly modern, but they are contemporary and have a simple and good neutral color scheme.  The design is definitely a notch above a lot of Marriotts that often feature an unappealing color scheme and ugly carpets.  The bed at this Westin was comfortable--excellent linen too and a comfortable room temperature.  The bathroom had a great look and featured a rainfall showerhead.  While I do not have status with Starwood, I did like the nice touch of two complimentary bottles of water with each night (it seems every Starwood member, even non-elite members, enjoy this benefit).

This Westin also has a great location.  It is right on College, which leads to several Downtown Charlotte restaurants and even some of Charlotte's nightlife like a dance club and a dueling piano bar.  This Westin is also within walking distance to several key Charlotte attractions including a minor league baseball stadium, the Carolina Panthers (NFL) stadium, the Charlotte Bobcats (NBA) arena, and the NASCAR Hall of Fame.

The fitness center was big and had several machines.

The lobby was nice too.  It was spacious and there were several sitting areas if you are waiting for someone.

I tried a little bit of their catering for a nightly event in their restaurant as well as in one of their banquet rooms for breakfast.  The food was definitely subpar for a Westin.  A lot of it was due to poor preparation and the effects of having buffet style food as the scrambled eggs were not that fluffy, the waffles were very soft and the flatbread was limp (it had definitely been sitting around for too long).

Service throughout the hotel was friendly though I felt that housekeeping was a tad slow to service my room on some days.

Prices are high, but the hotel is nice and the location is very convenient.

For travelers looking to explore Downtown Charlotte, this Westin is a great option.  The rooms are nice and the location is near perfect.  Downtown Charlotte is not my favorite downtown city.  It is a tad sleepy though not as quiet as Phoenix or as small as San Jose.  However, if you need to be in Downtown Charlotte, this Westin is a good hotel for a short or long stay.

Pay valet and self parking are both offered by this Westin.  It is easy finding a spot with self parking.

I can only speak from the experience of staying here for a recent convention. Several conferees and I had issues with the staff during the event over displays and services. Due to the nature of the event (romance novelists and readers) I got the impression they hovered close in case we decided to cause trouble. I did not find the venue pleasant.

While my room was clean, I think the bed aggravated my back pain. I also understand a number of conferees who drank the water experienced discomfort and sore throats.

I stayed at The Westin last week and I have to say it's not nearly as pleasant as it was a few years ago. 

Within 24 hours of my arrival my sinuses were freaking out. I thought maybe it was the climate change or the dry hotel air. But by day 2 my nose was bleeding and the person sharing my room was also not feeling great. It was then I noticed small mold spots in the shower. (there was no ventilation fan in the bathroom) I was there for a convention so I had to spend a great deal of time inside and by the time I checked out five days later I was miserable and so happy to get out of that hotel. 

The AC in the room also did not seem to operate properly. I'd wake up in the middle of the night hot despite the room temp being set on 64. No way it got near 64 or I would have been freezing. 

I fully believe the lack of ventilation and poor AC quality led to my roommate and I both ending up sick. But imagine my surprise when I get back home and complaints start popping up like crazy from dozens of the convention goers who also came home sick. I can't say for sure what the cause was, but I am comfortably saying The Westin in downtown Charlotte is not a healthy hotel. It needs some major work.
Beds are great and fitness/pool area is good, people are fantastic. The location was excellent, close to the baseball park, nascar hall of fame.

This has to be the worst "luxury" hotel I've ever stayed at. First off, I was staying here for a conference and had requested a higher floor room, but was given a 4th floor room - which is the lowest floor for rooms. I had also requested a King size bed since my wife was travelling with me, but we were given two double beds. In addition to not being able to sleep with my wife during the stay, I couldn't even fit comfortably on the bed (I'm 6' 4" so I always get a King bed). But I usually don't make a fuss about these kind of things when I'm at conference because I'm not paying for it anyway. The room itself was just okay - nothing wrong with it, but perhaps the most underwhelming room I've ever had at a supposedly luxury hotel. The only positive is that the bed itself was comfortable - would have been nice to have that King bed though, of course. 

Many of the hotel staff seemed rude and inappropriate in situations - including the onsite Hertz staff. Obviously management is not training well for customer service at this location. Plus I had went to the front desk to get my key card "keyed" for use in the parking garage because I had rented a car there, but they couldn't even manage to get this right. I never could get the key card to work in the parking garage. 

Conference rooms were poorly set-up, freezing cold, and loud! The walls were paper thin and it was at times very difficult to hear the presentations because sound from the other presentations next door would drift through - this was especially a problem in the back of the conference rooms. Attendees often were left standing at the back of the room because not enough chairs were set up.

Perhaps for Charlotte this is a nice property, but for those of us who have traveled around a bit, this place falls very far short on the luxury scale. If you are in Charlotte for travel and have an option to choose where to stay, I'd recommend the much nicer looking Hilton down the street - that's a nice looking property and Hilton is always good. 

Not recommended.

This is the one hotel in uptown Charlotte that I don't mind coming back to, since it meets my expectations nearly every time. Since arriving here for the first time for a convention in 08', followed b subsequent conventions and business meetings, the Westin Charlotte has been a welcoming accommodation that continues to leave an impression after each visit.

The first impression easily was the Heavenly beds. I've never slept in a better bed in a hotel prior to this visit, nor since. This bed set the benchmark so high with me that I purchased a comparable model a couple of years later at a pretty penny. The rooms within the Westin Charlotte are standard Westin: a littler smaller than expected, with the bed dominating a good portion of the space. The standard amenities of the pool area, gym and so forth met expectations. The front desk staff is very, very good, in addition to the banquet staff when it comes to accommodating colleagues that are in for a convention. 

The bar area across the floor from the front desk is one of my favorite places to network with professionals as much as I do drink. Known as "The Lobby Bar", the area is set up strictly as one to rendezvous with business associates and friends during events primarily after 5 PM. The menu is moderately reasonable for beer drafts, yet a little pricier for hors d' oeuvres and cocktails. If you can get your company to approve drinks and appetizers under T&E, it is highly advised. 

Parking is so-so. While the convenience to park within the underground lot is appreciated, I really think that it should be marked better with regard to where the elevator is in relation to the section of where your car is. It took me nearly 20 minutes to find my car at one point!

Altogether, the Westin Charlotte can be a place to really enjoy. A little pricey, yet worth it if you prefer a downtown (they call it uptown in Charlotte) location while either traveling or on business.

Couldn't me happier with my stay in the Westin!

I proposed to my girlfriend now fiancé and the staff here made it all the better. They helped me set up, sent champagne and nibbles and even gave me an upgrade so I could show my fiancé the best time of her life. Her staycation, our engagement, the whole experience was fantastic and I look forward to staying there again soon!

AVOID THE VALET AT ALL COSTS!

The valet curbed 3 of my 4 rims on my new BMW and refused to pay for the damages.

I checked in thursday morning which was great because I just got in from a redeye flight and it was 10:30 in the morning and they had a room available. Which I took full advantage of and took a nap before my sales conference started.  The room was very nice. I ordered Carolina pulled pork sandwich from their after hours menu. The person who brought the food up to my room said it was the best in Charlotte. Description said grain mustard Cole slaw and pickles. The coleslaw was a couple pieces of lettuce with some carrots. There were no pickles or grain mustard. Then the next night I ordered a turkey club and it is exactly what it said on the menu. The customer service is awesome but they need to  follow what their menu says. Other than that I had a great time. The channels are very scarce and it takes multiple seconds for the channel to change. Either the batteries are almost dead or its just terrible. We live in a time where tv is very simple. Their tv service reminds me of watching TV in the early 90's.

I aboslutely loved this hotel! My co-worker and multiple people I spoke to even mentioned how good it smelt- that's how you know it's a great hotel! haha no lingering smell of mildew or mold, it was so fresh and clean.

The beds were so extremely comfortable, i never wanted to get out of bed! They have a great service where if you'd like to skip your room cleaning for the day they'd give you a $5 gift card for going green.

This hotel also features a deal I've never heard of before and sadly didn't take advantage of.. You can rent workout gear for $5. They will send New Balance shoes and clothing to your room! for $5! Such a steal if you dont' have room in your carry on for extra items.

Amazing hospitality shown to our company FASTSIGNS, we were there for a Sales Summit for our FASTSIGNS store in Rochester, MN and the entire staff was incredible.  If I ever come to Charlotte, NC again this is where I will stay.  The rooms were clean, fabulous, and just overall a great experience.

It was a pretty nice place to stay. The first room I was given smelled strongly of smoke (it was a non-smoking room) and I asked for a new room. They gave me a new room and it was much better. Some of the rooms have this weird basin thing -- instead of giving you a sink in the bathroom, there's a sink outside the bathroom, with this weird tall basin that is hard to use. If you don't like the room with the weird basin, ask for a different one, because they don't all have them. 

There isn't a free breakfast, which is sort of weird, I think, and the room's supplies weren't as nice as some other Holiday Inns I've stayed at. The best thing about the room was that the clock-radio thing had a spot for your ipod, so you can listen to your music in the room (and it charges your ipod, too!). 

Amenities -- The pool on the roof is a uniform 3 1/2 feet in depth -- yeah, I know, exciting -- and not very big in terms of length and width, either. The fitness room features a few treadmills, a few bicycles, and a bowflex thingy -- not even any free weights! There is a "jogging track" on the roof, which is really just a path painted on the roof so you can run around in a circle on the hard concrete. It's really pretty up on the roof on a sunny day, but even the most hardcore runners in our group couldn't stand that running path. 

There wasn't anything wrong with the place. It was clean, comfortable, and centrally located, and the staff was very accommodating. I just sort of hoped for a tiny bit better, considering the price.

We had a great experience here:  helpful staff, clean room, comfy bed, free WIFI, and plenty of security.  My only complaint was that silly basin sink located at the entrance to the room.

This hotel is marvelously situated within walking distance to some of the best entertainment and dining in town.

GREAT LOCATION!  Very clean and very nice. Not the Ritz which is right around the corner, but for a Holiday Inn, the price was right and the property was flawless. Beds were comfortable and the area around the hotel is clean, and everything including great restaurants and entertainment in short walking distance.  Would have liked a couple of bottles of water, but there was a vending macing right down the hall.  We were greeted by a very nice valet, and when we entered the lobby, we were met by Adam!  Very cheerful, explained the area and had discount and freebie coupon's for almost everywhere in the vicinity.  Whatever we needed.....Adam took care of it.  Very cool and professional young man!  Definitely a place we will return.

I stayed at this motel for 2 nights (June 19th & 20th). The first morning I had 2 red spots on my right arm but just dismissed it. We stayed out all day & returned for the last night. I woke up Sunday morning with 15+ bites on me--mainly right arm & forehead. I called & talked to manger as soon as I saw the bites. She insisted that I was probably having an allergic reaction or I had picked up something outside!!!  The places were itching so bad. I checked the bed & saw a couple of reddish flecks on the bed skirt. When we checked out I spoke to manager & showed her my bites. She said they would shut room down(room 416) & have exterminators come in and let me know within 72 hours. On Monday I had 42 bites on me from my head down to my toes!!!!  I'm still waiting to find out what ate me up!!!!   No way would I EVER stay at this motel again.

JJ and the rest of the staff here are life savers! Missed my connecting flight because of previous delays and the airline set me up at the Holiday Inn Center City. 

After a $25 cab ride from the airport, I find out that the airline lost my reservation and I now have to pay full price for a room. I talk to JJ and the other desk staff and they get me set up with the original promised rate. Room was a dream (even though I was only there for ~5 hours) and I was greeted by name in the lobby the next morning. I'm not often in Charlotte, but I know I'll be back to see everybody here.

We went here after a meeting. Made reservations in advance.  We let them know we have a EMS dog due to my PTSD, they said no problem. Upon Check-in, we were told that they do not recognize PSTD as a disability, and our dog was not welcome. beware veterans, they do not acknowledge war.  No more.  PA...We have paperwork

It's a Residence Inn, so by and large you know what to expect- a living area with a sofa-sleeper and a bedroom.

The reason I typically stay at these when I travel with my family is that we have a three year old. That means I can count on a decent hotel with a door I can close so my kid can sleep and I can watch TV.

Not so much at Uptown Charlotte. The door not only didn't close, it didn't fit the frame.  As in, somebody with "Hoyt" stitched over his pocket would have needed half an hour with a plane to get the damn thing to close.  In addition to that little gem, the guy in the next room decided to conduct business with Bombay at 3am. We listened to mellifluous Hindi for damn near two hours.  I don't blame him, everybody's gotta earn a living, instead I fault the hotel. A guy should be able to make phone calls/watch TV/quietly murder someone next door without waking other guests.

I would probably have ranked the place higher had they decided to come through for us on customer service, however the manager, although a nice guy, only offered to move us to another room for the next night.  Um, we're checking out this morning, genius.  I'm really glad you are going to get right on the problems I pointed out to you, but kinda underwhelmed that your thanks for pointing out your inadequacies is all I get in return.

Good location. Terrible front desk staff & way over priced. The front desk staff was not interested in helping me checkin. She kept answering the phone even though others were there. We had an issue as when I booked via my phone it didn't say there was a $75 fee for a pet. We left. Made a one night stay $325. Ummm you are a Marriott not the Ritz

Great location and in the middle of the night life. The room was large and spacious. I'd recommend this for anyone who needs more than one night with better rates. Front desk was very helpful and friendly!

After reading reviews of previous guests, I was absolutely shocked and disgusted by my overall experience at this hotel.  First, the  rooms, at least the two I was in, were outdated and the cleaning was "hit or miss" at best.  Secondly, the food served at the bar (excluding the shrimp cocktail) was over cooked and overpriced.  Moreover, the pub dining is closed on Sundays, only room service is available (w/ a 20% gratuity added).  Since, I was working long hours, basically confined to my room, this was my life for nearly 2 weeks! Thirdly, after waking to a huge SPIDER in my bed, I was allowed to move to another room and the night manager apologized and "bought me dinner".  (I considered posting the pic of the spider in the bed, but decided against.  I can send it to Marriott if requested.) Lastly, to add insult to injury, during checkout, the same manager, along with a female staff member, gave me plenty of attitude while scrutinizing my final bill ensuring I am charged for the late checkout and parking despite me repeatedly telling them I paid for and used the Duke side.  This trip alone, I have stayed in 3 different Marriott properties for more than 30 days!  I am so disappointed with Marriott and I will never stay at this property again.

Stayed here on a saturday night and i loved it. It was only a 7 minute walk to all the bars and clubs. The room was very spacious and clean. The staff was really friendly and helpful. I would recommend this place if you are in the Charlotte area.

The location was not bad.  It took me about 20 minutes to walk to the more festive "epicenter" part of town.  Even though I passed a bus station, the city felt pretty safe.  

The bar in the hotel was tiny so don't expect a lot of guests to hang out there.  The pool looked really nice but I didn't test it out.

The bed and room were excellent... I slept like a baby at a hotwire price.

Beautiful hotel, lovely sunny room decor. Very comfy beds. Super clean! Nice amenities. Close to everything. Staff helpful. No free wifi, come on! Quiet. Great view from our high room. Great deal for my Johnson & Wales student. Loved our stay here!

Official Team Hotel of the Charlotte Hounds. Bill, Kim, Rachael and the rest of the staff are amazing. Rooms are super nice. Location is perfect. Take advantage of the Hounds friends/family rates ($89 Weekend, $119 Weekday) by clicking thru one of the Doubletree ads on www.charlottehounds.com.
This place is great for the price and location.  def recommend if you in the area

I attended a convention in Charlotte at the end of July 2013 and the hotels that were partnered with the conference were all booked. I chose this hotel as part of a package on Travelocity.

Located uptown right near the Johnson and Wales campus, this hotel fit the bill.

Roughly a mile from the center of Downtown and the Convention Center, the location is far enough to be out of the hustle and bustle but near enough to walk to the Convention Center and Downtown restaurants if you choose to do so.

The room on the second floor was smallish, but adequate. Safe in room, but other than that, no in room bling. Not a fan of the open shower at all. I like a nice shower with good water pressure. The shower in this room has a seat and a hand held shower head. It's not enclosed and there is no tub. To be fair, the shower head is on a mount that can be adjusted for height and direction, but the result is less than adequate water pressure. Any more and you would flood the bathroom.

Staff is very friendly and helpful. Check in was uneventful and you can check out via the phone in your room. Final bill is shoved under your room door on the morning of your check out.

Bar/Restaurant is typical. Overpriced, but you have other choices. Dining options immediately around the hotel are limited. Subway, The Great Wok, Cedar Street Tavern are within short walking distance and are fine if you don't want or need to go downtown for better dining.

There is a CVS and a Harris Teeter also within short walking distance.

Parking is $13 a day in a structure next to the hotel. In room internet is $9.95 for 24 hours. I understand a parking charge, but it seems a bit steep. I simply do not understand any hotel charging for Wi-Fi access in room when it's free in the lobby and other public spaces of the hotel.

Minor quibbles, but If I were attending a multi-day conference at the Convention Center, I'd look for a hotel closer. Price would be close to a wash and convenience would be better.

Everything you would expect from a Hilton Doubletree - clean, modern, aimed at the business travelers of the world. Of course, wifi is only free for Hilton Honors members, which is semi-annoying, but that's pretty standard for hotels aimed at business travelers. The staff was extremely accommodating and helpful, and beds were super comfy. 

There is self-park and valet - around $15 or 20 a night, if I remember correctly. Starbucks is right across the street, but aside from a Subway, other dining options within walking distance are pretty limited

One star. It's only because they won't let me give it zero stars. Read this carefully, if you book your room through a third party, such as Orbitz, they do not guarantee the room that you booked online. Traveled with my brother and booked a two double bed room and when we arrived all they had were rooms with a single king bed. Was told by the front desk I could get a roll away bed brought into the room at an extra charge of $10 a night if they had any available. Didn't matter whether they had any available or not because I had no intention of giving this place any more of my money. I travel often and I mean i travel a lot and this is the first time I have ever had this happen to me. I have stayed in nicer hotels at cheaper prices and haven't dealt with this kind of problem ever. Needless to say I have crossed all Hilton hotels off my traveling list. Also, room was tiny, small fridge, breakfast was not free where as in most places I stay it's complimentary. Bath tub floor was slick, tried to be careful didn't matter because I busted my you know what in the shower. Just an all around poor experience and I will not be back. One last thing, you hear everything that happens in the hallways no matter what's going on and that sucks when you are trying to sleep.

I stayed here one night while in town for a job interview.  The room was clean and the bed comfortable with different pillow selections (foam, feather, hard, soft).  I appreciate having the microwave and fridge in the room when I travel in case I don't feel like going out to eat again or I'm too tired to get out.  

Also, in the lobby there are pre-printed directions to local businesses.  I didn't take advantage but there is a bar in the lobby.  Internet access was free and there was a desk in the room.  Highway access is convenient and it is close enough to bars and restaurants.

The gym is adequate and the equipment is better than most hotels, including tv screen so bring ear plugs if you want to listen.  There were not weights though and the pool is too small for laps but there is an aquatic center just a few blocks away with both ($8 a visit for non-residents).  The treadmills are sufficient for running but Uptown is completely side-walked so if you prefer running outside its 'safe' from traffic at least.

They had a shuttle pick me up after the taxi dropped me off at the wrong Hilton.  Doh!  Super nice staff.  Their gym is really small and doesn't have much.  Pool is small too.  Nonetheless, a cozy place to stay.

Usually always stay here.  Great location, nice rooms, nice hotel and the location is perfect.  Within 6-8 blocks of everything you need for dining and entertainment.  Off the main beat so there is never any heavy traffic as if sitting downtown in the middle of the banking district.  Rates are always superior to anything in the area.  Rooms are over sized compared to Hilton and Marriott in the banking district.  I would highly recco this hotel for future guests of Charlotte.

Nice hotel. Good beds. Across from NASCAR Hall of Fame.  Did not notice street noise mentioned in other reviews. Self-parking. Decent breakfast.

Shares parking garage with Hampton Inn. Not a problem, except confusing car entrance.

Convenient. Friendly. Clean.

I liked this hotel. We checked in for the Beyonce concert and surprisingly were upgraded to the executive suite for free. I didn't request this so I was a caught a bit off guard and sadly, we had no view - I believe if the suite was on a higher floor, I would've been much more pleased because of the view. I also am glad there weren't more of us because we would've been SOL. 

Parking was limited, they said because of the amount of people going to the concert. I liked the people working there, but I think that's customary for NC. Everyone is so darn nice!!! I also had the brunch in the morning and it was worth the $10.95 if you want to eat and then just hit the road or lounge a little longer. Checkout at 12pm was also a plus. Also, the shuttle was VERY helpful. Location was also very good for what I needed. Not sure about the WI-FI we didn't need to use it but we did use the business center. Beware - you can't download, which I understand but we NEEDED our tickets!!! I had to find a shortcut way to do that. 

Torn between 3 and 4 went with 3 would like to do a 3.5.
Great staff. Average rooms. Very clean.

My wife and I stayed at this hotel from 5/21-5/28/14 for the NASCAR races.  The hotel was very clean and the staff was very good.  The room was made up clean every day much to our satisfaction.  We ate breakfast here most days and the staff in the restaurant area were very prompt and friendly.  We stayed here because of the location across the street from the Nascar Hall of Fame and it's proximity to the downtown area.  We were also right across from the Speed Street street fair, very nice.  The close proximity to the highways worked out well as we made it a point to visit South Carolina as well as other areas of North Carolina.  I recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Charlotte for business or pleasure.  The only ding, if I may, is the parking which is a little limited and there is a nominal daily fee.  There was one day that the hotel appeared to sell out and we had to park in the adjacent open lot.

My Charlotte experience would not be complete without the unforgettable stay in Hilton Garden Inn. Everything is just a short distance. Close to the Charlotte Transit Center, the hustle and bustle of Uptown Charlotte, and very close to Nascar Hall of Fame. What made it more pleasant to stay is the friendliness of the staff and the way they make sure your stay is nothing but very satisfactory! They also have a shuttle that can drive you to your destination and even request them to fetch you from where you are as long as its within three-miles. 

A laundry facility is also available in the third floor free of charge if you opt to do your own laundry. All you need to buy is the detergent they sell near the front desk (The Pavilion Pantry) for $1.50. In the Pavilion Pantry you can find snacks, cereals, key chains, magnets, and drinks. 

Overall, my first experience in Charlotte is unforgettable not only the breathtaking beauty of The Queen City but also to this place I call 'home away from home'.

Hilton Garden Inn Charlotte Uptown
traveling from Alabama

Visited Charlotte for an IICRC course and stayed 6 nights at the Hilton Garden Inn.
Was received at check in by valet that was extremely helpful not just upon our arrival but throughout our stay. Overall the staff was very tentative to any need or concern. Mathew who seemed to be an all-round staff member assisted me several times and went way and beyond on. On one occasion he took quite a bit of time to explain and tour the best route and shortcuts to get from my car to hotel elevators and what garage floors to park on. Way to go Mathew.  The front desk was always helpful. We had an issue with room noise one night at 10 PM and it was handled in the best possible way with no hesitation either Lynn or Carolyn (not sure who was on duty that night) fully addressed this concern  to our 100% satisfaction the next day. The shuttle is really great the driver saw us in the lobby looking around and asking directions to local restaurants and  JB stepped right in with a very enthusiastic attitude and offered to take us wherever we needed. That impressed me because usually the guys working a shuttle would rather avoid having to take anyone any where. JB even gave us his card and instructed us to call him when we where ready to be picked up. The breakfast is offered in the lobby and is not free but worth the price. I would advise to get a package so its included with the cost of your room rate with parking. It works out to be less that way. At the breakfast buffet the cooks will prepare you several items all of them are really nice an attentive. Nelly, Lupe and Laura where great and Lupe is a gem, thank you for having a box with breakfast to go for my wife every morning.  This hotel offers room service from 5-10 PM and the selection was good as well as the food. My wife had the pork almost every night , it was that good. Overall this hotel is very clean and centrally located to down town. The parking is good and the views as well, but the great staff was the best feature by far. It fit the bill for my business training as well as a get away for my wife and I. I would highly recommend.

Let me start by saying it's a bus station. Automatically means dim lighting, strange smells, and the dank air of dying souls. 
But that aside, I felt safe here. It's a small station, but the bathrooms are fairly clean, and although I got there as the bus was pulling in, they got me checked in and on my way. Because who wants to spend any more time there than absolutely necessary? 
But I do have a tip: if seats are at a premium (which they always are for late arrivers like me), always pick the black muslim guy with the kufi reading the Koran. They generally are the most courteous and least likely to try to feel you up if you fall asleep, which you must do when riding the Hound, for your own sanity.

a tip: if you need anything from this local charlotte station don't call.  they never -- as in never -- answer their phone.  you can't leave messages, you can't find a live person.  if you need a live body to talk to at the local station you have to go down to the station in person yourself.

Can't complain much about this station. I'm here for a 50 minute layover and the place seems clean, bearable lighting, plenty of vending machines and only about six gates. There is a restaurant here but I guess since it's 11pm right now, it's closed. Consider bringing food of your own if you have a layover here.

My wife and I stayed here one night because our air conditioner stopped working. The front desk was extremely helpful and friendly! The room was clean, comfortable, and they had a great complementary breakfast in the morning. Great location and a good price! I recommend you stay here if you're seeking a reasonably priced, clean, comfortable hotel!

Stayed here for a wedding with many other guests. The hotel is undergoing a renovation. From what I can tell we had a renovated room which was very nice and colorful with barn doors and a flat screen LG TV. The staff was friendly at check in. The valet is $20 and self is $15 expected in this area. Breakfast is free which is a plus but, really nothing special. It was packed. America . I would stay here again!!!

I stayed here for 4 nights while attending a conference at the convention center which is half a block away.  The hotel is within easy walking distance of many restaurants and shops.  They offer a free shuttle to anywhere in the city within 3 miles which was wonderful. They will drop you and then return and pick you up when you call.  I used it several times and they were prompt and convenient. This alone was a wonderful service.  Everyone at the front desk was warm, friendly, helpful and very welcoming.  They truly went above and beyond to make guests feel welcome.  The room was clean and comfortable and more than adequate.  Between the convenient location, the warmth of the staff, the convenience of the shuttle and the rooms I would highly recommend this location.

It was a nice hotel, and if you are member of Guest Select (which is free, by the by), you get free wi-fi and other goodies in your room.    The front desk was very helpful with printing out boarding passes and the exercise room had water for you to rehydrate.

I also had to take a cab to the airport at 4:30 in the morning, and they made sure that I wasn't waiting around for that.

My knocks on the place are few, but should be noted.  The AC was on 63 when I got there.  Completely jet lagged, I fell asleep with that running all night and was definitely feeling sick the next morning. blech.   Also, the shower took a tad bit of time to get warm.

I can't say I'm particularly impressed with the Omni.   Certainly the web site makes the location look quite luxurious, but the reality is that the interior design in this hotel is tragic.  The hallways look like some ugly 70s beige nightmare.    Worse, the room I had on the edge of the building was incredibly inconvenient:  tiny bathroom with door that wouldn't close due to floormat and in full view of guests at the aloft across the street.   I had a minibar but they never gave me the key so it didn't do me much good.    The choice of movies on demand is absolutely tragic and worst of all, no porn!  No, seriously...     I actually ordered room service the first evening I got in since I wasn't familiar with Charlotte or the surroundings.   I ordered a 3 cheese panini with french fries and a wedge salad.   The wedge salad was actually quite good but the 3 cheese panini was worse than a grilled cheese sandwich I could have made in my microwave at home with white bread and cheddar.   Ditto the fries.    Breakfast the next morning wasn't much better with the only saving grace being the scrambled eggs done easy, as I'd requested them.    I'm not sure why I got whole wheat toast instead of my english muffin, though.

All and all, I'd probably come back here mostly for the location near the office when I'm in Charlotte.   I certainly wouldn't recommend it if you're coming to Charlotte and plan to spend any considerable time in your hotel though.    There's gotta be much better than this.    I'm checking out the pool later today.   If it significantly changes my view positively or negatively, I'll update the rating accordingly.

I recently stayed here during a business trip, and it was so bad I had to cut my stay short and go to another hotel.

I've stayed at the LA Omni numerous times, and they have nice accommodations, great service and I like staying there.  I was hoping to have a similar experience and was thoroughly disappointed.

I stayed on the preferential floors, but even then the rooms were horrible.  Small, old furniture, old TV, dingy, musty, small bathroom, stains on the ceiling etc.  I was starting to get depressed just being there.  

Room service was mediocre, the complimentary drink service was not well presented, came too early, way before my requested time when I wasn't awake yet (they knocked at 5:30am).  

It's right in front of the Epicenter so on Thursdays when they have bands playing there at night time, I'm sure it's really really loud.

The pool is this round small pool, that I didn't even attempt to go into.

Will not stay there again until they have a major remodel of the entire inside of the hotel.

The good
Great location, good lobby, decent rooms.

The Bad
The TVs are from 1995, how do hotels not have flat screens by now?

The bed is probably the hardest, most uncomfortable thing I have ever slept on.

I'm staying here for a workshop. I regret not booking at the Hilton, Marriott or aLoft

As far as business hotels are concerned, this one isn't bad.  It doesn't have the breadth of offerings in as many locations as say.. a Marriott or Hilton, but does the job in a pinch.  I was forced to stay here by my corporate rate, but the value didn't seem worth it.  Granted, they provide a free morning beverage (OJ, water, etc..) delivered to your room and a complimentary shoe shine, but the rate is still steep.

The lobby is a bit strange as the parking elevators do not bring you to the check-in desk.  Otherwise, the location of hotel is well situated in the middle of downtown and very close to everything you need.

4 stars for a decent attempt at being a service oriented hotel, but it falls shy in the luxury department.

The Omni Charlotte is an immaculate luxury hotel that totally provides the Omni standard of service. I have stayed at this hotel on three separate occasions now, and each time I have been impressed. On my most recent stay, I arrived in Charlotte much earlier than expected; the wonderful front desk agent checked me into my room at 7:00 a.m.! 

The rooms are somewhat dated but still nicely appointed. As a Select Guest member, my Wifi internet connection was free (the hotel otherwise charges $9.95) and the connection was decent. I ordered room service - it arrived promptly and the food was great. 

Working out/hitting the gym while I travel is very important to me. At this hotel, you have two options: you can use the hotel's gym at no charge or you can go to the Charlotte Athletic Club, located in the same building, via a guest pass issued by the front desk. The pass costs $15. The hotel's gym is not what I have been accustomed to in four and five star hotels. It has a couple cardio machines and some free weights - if you want a full workout, you won't get it there. The Charlotte Athletic Club is a wonderful gym and is just as easily accessed as the hotel's own. It bothered me that I had to pay $15, however, to use the gym. The hotel should either provide its guests with a gym comparable to other hotels of its class OR using the Charlotte Athletic Club should be complimentary. 

Other than my frustration with the fitness aspect, the hotel is great, the staff are helpful and polite, and the location is superb.

This place was a bit worn, yet was ultimately an A-OK experience.

The Superb:  The Valet.  At both drop-off and pick-up, these young men were superb.  Well done.  Also, the man just inside from the valet who helped me with last minute HAND WRITTEN directions to the airport?  You kick ass.

The Average:  The room was nothing out of the ordinary.  The bed was fine, everything was clean, and there were no odd smells.  The $10 fee for the internet was frustrating, but accepted.

The Poor:  The lobby.  It was not well marked, and was rather barren.  The people working at the lobby when I arrived were clearly not happy with their jobs.  The best part? I heard two people just out of sight behind the counter talking some serious smack about the hotel and other employees.  It would have been more entertaining on check-out, than on check-in.

Long story short - Hardly the "luxury" hotel experience I am used to, but for the price, whatever.

Perfectly happy with my brief stay at the Charlotte Omni.  Located uptown, with lots of good restaurants and attractions in the immediate surrounding area.  I came for business and had several good nights.  

The staff is extremely nice, helpful and responsive.

Comments below about pay wifi and tv's:  I was in two rooms and both TV's were flat screens so it seems that issue has been resolved.  As for Wi-Fi, if you're paying for it, you're not too smart.  The hotel has a great rewards program and as long you sign up (it's free to do so) you receive complimentary Wi-Fi AND complimentary beverage service brought to your door every AM.  It's a really nice touch that I really like.  And their Select Guest program has some other great perks, which has made me a very loyal customer over the years.  

One other helpful hint:  look on Expedia or other travel sites for rates before going to the hotel to book.  Very often you can find the room at a greatly discounted price online and the hotel can't match it.  My room for this stay was $95 online and the hotel was charging $219 to book through them.  So do a little shopping first.

For the price this is a 2 star.  For location this place is a 4 star.  The rooms are small and they even gave me a corner room that said was bigger.  I would hate to see what a normal room looks like.  The corner room has 2 full size beds and is like a triangle.  You do have space but very little and the bathrooms well the toilet and the shower are like touching each other.  You can barely close the bathroom door if you want to do business in private!  The corner rooms also that face 4th street just expect a night of loud music as that side faces several rooftop bars and they play music loud late into the night.  Only saving grace is putting in the AC fan but that is loud as well.  Either music or white noise.  The signature lounge...again...small.  Overall the lobby is nice, nice restaurant and attached to BofA and the center of town with everything in walking distance.  As I said....for location unbeatable.  For a luxury hotel for the price NOPE.

This Omni is in a superb location for a stay whe you want to sample some of the best of Uptown Charlotte.  Right in the hub of things on Trade St. in between Tryon and College, across from the Epicenter, short couple of blocks to TWC arena.  Plenty of good restaurants easily within walking distance as well.  We generally stay here when attending a concert at TWC so we don't have to worry about driving, parking, drinking and driving, etc.  Had a real treat this past Tuesday night when we were put up in a huge triangle shaped suite on the 14th floor with windows running the full length of the longest two sides of the triangle.  Offered some great views of Uptown Charlotte!

If the rooms were a bit less dated and the service at the bar was a bit better/friendlier, I'd be inclined to go 4 Stars but, that said, I have no qualms about staying here given the location and the prices you can find.

Stayed here a few months ago and still remember the great service I received. One night, there was a knock on my door asking if I wanted turndown service. I said no thank you but I would like one of the chocolates they put on pillows. The employee said he didn't have any and said good night. Ten minutes later, there's another knock on the door and room service produced a plate of chocolate covered pretzels free of charge. How's that for service? I don't normally stay at Omnis but this one went above and beyond bringing this weary traveler chocolate after a quick comment about how much I love chocolate. Will definitely stay here again if I return to Charlotte.

Great location but not the best value.  Tiny bathrooms - could barely close the door with the rug.  Noisy guests had a party - we could hear the door slam as our beds were positioned on the wall of the hall.  Poor design.  Security finally broke the party up at 1:30 am.  Lots of other hotel choices in the area.

Looks fine, seems fine, but it's not fine. The walls and doors are paper thin. We could hear people whispering down the hall (no exaggeration) and those enjoying their rooms in a more or less romantic way were known to all.... completely. This is a hotel with zero privacy- from the loud clubs outside heard throughout the night as if our hingeless window could open and was open, to the screams of ecstasy from the rooms behind us and across the hall. 

If you join the select guest free membership be sure to ask the front desk what you get. There are perks but none were mentioned until we received the checkout bill in the morning under our door. I personally would have enjoyed free juice in the morning, or at least would have appreciated knowing it was an option. We will not be staying here again. Truly unfortunate as my partner is moving to this area and the Omni is in a wonderful location. 

Staff was friendly, can't tell you about the food or beverages since we never had any (though the completely and perpetually empty restaurant looked beautiful), parking was simple enough (garage is $15/day with in and out privileges or $22/day valet). 

We wanted desperately to like this hotel, just didn't happen for us. Best of luck to those that go for it ;)
Front desk staff was really helpful. Valet guys are great.

Decent hotel downtown but has noise problem.

Everything was more or less ok except for the noise.  Entertainment district across the way had throbbing disco beat that  wouldn't let us sleep.  .  Had to change rooms with my 3 kids at 02:30 a.m and we were flying back to Germany the next morning.

Ask for room on side not facing entertainment district or simply book elsewhere.  Otherwise you will NOT get a good night's sleep.  It is simply inexcusable to book a nice downtown Hotel in a supposedly "World" city and feel like you're trying to sleep directly on the disco dance floor.  This Hotel is in need of sound-proofing renovations.

Extra note in case Omni reads this.  You should sue the pants off the entertainment district for the late night noise.

I'm of two minds about the Omni - on one hand, it's a decent hotel in a perfect location if you're doing business in Charlotte.  On the other hand, though, it's a bit dated and obviously wasn't built with the kind of sound insulation required now that the Epicenter is right across the street.

In fact, as I sit here right now, in my 7th floor room, I can almost clearly hear the music pumping out from the rooftop event just across the street.  Luckily, it's 7:30pm, but somehow from the presence of the earplugs provided in my bedside drawer, I'm not sure that the party's going to end by the time I need to call it a night.

The same goes for inside the hotel - a couple nights ago there were some folks in the hall, obviously having come back from a good night at the bars - and I could hear every. single. thing. that they said to each other.  It was all in good fun, I wasn't anywhere close to calling it a night - but that doesn't mean that others with their Privacy Please signs weren't.

Other than the noise pollution issue, though, the place is pretty nice.  Rooms are decent-sized, and provide the expected amenities - including flat-screen TVs (which shouldn't be a surprise in this day and age, but somehow can be).  Their Wi-Fi is charged at $10-$15 per night, based on bandwidth, unless you subscribe to their frequent guest program, which means they'll take it off at the end of your stay.

The lobby connects directly to the Epicenter or the BB&T building by walkways, and also opens up directly to the Bank of America Center, which makes it pretty much an awesome location for business travelers.  There's a Walgreens in the lower lobby, as well as a Starbucks, Chick-Fil-A, and several other quick-grub places.

Overall, it's a nice place to stay with some minor issues - the location as a whole could use an update, but I've stayed at plenty worse places in my time as a business traveler.

Stayed here thinking it would be a great place since I have stayed at Omnis before in several other locations. Made a reservation here and was also here for memorial day weekend and was very underwhelmed. The Omni hotels have always ben known to be a very nice place and this location was not up to that standard. It was not horrible but for the price some people pay I would expect better. 

When staying here I ordered room service several times and it was okay, but nothing special that I could not get anywhere else. I thought the food eas delicious though I just think that for the premium price they ask for you would get more. The portions were a nice size though and they always give you condiments which not a lot of places do. 

The hotel room in general was very BLAH. Nothing exciting, but nothing gross. Every think seemed out dated and very pale and boring. You think they would have spent more time and money in making it more up to date. The carpet as well was not gross, but just kinda looked like it had been there a while and needed to be replaced. 

As a whole, the hotel was a nice place. The weekend I was there I also saw there was an Indian wedding going on. I thought it would be a great place to hold a venue, but I would not want my guest to stay in the room I did if they are all pretty much similar. I also felt that the 3 stars is mainly due to the rooftop pool they had which was amazing on my long weekend. That alone could have made the hotel better. I think that if this location spent some more time and money they could live up to the standard that all the other locations do. Charlotte is a nice city and all the other hotels are more up to date. Omni would gain more business if they just did some minor changes

This was my first trip to Charlotte. I've looked up other hotels in the area and have decided upon the Omni. The Omni is very overrated. When we checked-in, they had a five day wedding celebration in progress. No bell captains available upon check-in. When we got up to the room, I was very surprised to see how outdated it was for the money. Ripped curtains, blown out light bulbs in bathroom. And most of the extra electrical outlets did not work. I had my cell phone charging, come to find out the outlet never worked. I switched it to another outlet, and, again, no charge. Upon my morning cup of coffee in the room, the mini creamers were sour. I called room service, and they never brought them up. Nor did they refresh the coffee station when they cleaned the room. No fresh creamers and two sugars for two days! I take my coffee serious. Lol. The second day in the morning starting at 7:00 AM, I was woken by a pounding sound of music coming from the courtyard. This was the ritual going on for the wedding. It continued for two hours. If the wedding was going to be honored on the lower floors, they should have put the other guests on the upper floor to avoid all the commotion. The garbage cans on site were overflowing with garbage for two days. No one took the responsibility of emptying them. We paid good money for a nice, clean, quite break. Only to have nothing but a out of date room, tons of noise, and a unclean looking surrounding. Guests should have been forewarned of the wedding festivities when booking. Although, the staff was very accommodating, they weren't on a mini vacation, we were. The only thing we were offered was free coffee or a breakfast beverage in the morning ! Also, be aware, if you don't join their rewards club, check your bill for a $9.95 a day charge for Internet. We were really disappointed in this hotel and will not be returning at all. See attached pictures.

Stayed here because I was in town for a wedding. Hadn't stayed here in years. It could use some updating but the rooms are still nice and comfy. But, the staff are what make this hotel awesome. Everyone was so nice. They know your name and take care of your every need. The location is also great. You can walk anywhere you need to go. I've always hated the entrance to the hotel but again, this is where the wonderful staff make this hotel with a strange entrance a great experience. 

Parking is $15 a day. Valet parking is $22 a day. 

Also know that it's location is great for eating and hanging out. The epicenter along with many other places are close by. One thing you must remember when staying here, it is uptown so it can be very noisy outside and you will hear it in your room.
The room was clean but very small. Looks like the rooms could use some updating. The staff was very courteous and accommodating. The workout area was extremely small and only has 4 cardio machines.

This review is long overdue.  Our trial team called the Omni Charlotte our home for a little over a month.  We were originally scheduled for 2 1/2 weeks but the freak snow storm in February kept us in through the first week of March.  Despite it being a very busy time in Charlotte, the hotel managed to get us an extended stay and made us feel very at home. The sales manager, and catering/conference coordinator were extremely helpful with anything we needed.  The entire hotel was very responsive (even with our late night/early morning requests).  The rooms were nicely kept and our war room was always in order.  True, this isn't one of the newer hotels, but it had a lot of great amenities (including a drugstore and various food court type places to eat) that made our particular stay a little more pleasant.  And kudos to Michelle M. and Hope F. for being so extremely accommodating and pleasant to work with (even when I knew our requests were tough to deal with.  What a great team!

Hotel is NICE but seems best suited for business people who will only be interested in spending LOTS of cash. Our room was 300 for 2 nights and the room had a mini fridge fit for only a few items, no microwave etc. there were many things that they left in the room like bottles of water & candy & it was all extra. You would think at 150 per night you would get a few amenities. Internet is extra.

This is hands down FOR SURE the most disgusting 4 star hotel I've ever been in. In fact I can only think of two grosser hotels I've ever stayed at in my entire life, and they were both Motel 6s I had to get during layovers. 


This place is soon SO gross. I have NO idea how they have a 4 star rating, I'm SURE the hyatt and Marriott are cleaner. 
When I walked into my room I was met with a strong stench of mildew. The carpet has clearly not been cleaned since it was installed. The curtains are ripped. That's SUCH an easy fix, it just shows they don't care. 
Fading on all the couch cushions. 
I was so disgusted by everything I put towels down on the floor so that my feet wouldn't have to touch the carpet. tiny bathrooms with the molding falling from the showers. 

Tiniest bathroom. 

The cable cuts in and out. Seriously. I asked to switch rooms (because of the mildew, not the cable) and in my second "upgraded" room, same smell and same cable issues. 

I don't know what's going on at this hotel......but omg. SO gross. I got this place on Princeline. Next time I am in Charlotte I will pay the extra face value for the Hilton or the Hyatt (which is 3 star) JUST to be sure I don't have to stay in this nasty place EVER again. 
Spare yourself, make SURE you get the Hilton if you do a 4 star, or just go for a 3 star.

Nice hotel. Clean rooms, comfortable beds and an assortment of complimentary toiletries and amenities in room. Room service is 24 hours, which was great because of our late arrival, while alcoholic beverages are not served by roomservice after midnight, we had gotten our order in with 15 min to spare. Besides, the room had a wet bar if necessary (it wasnt). One minor issue was that plug bank at the desk was not plugged in and working, but that was remedies by moving the dresser/tv stand Nd plugging it into the outlet behind the tv.

This place looks like it could be the setting for a 1984 rom com starring Val Kilmer and Elizabeth Shue. It seriously looks like it hasn't been updated in 30 years and the rooms smell musty enough to be from the Carter administration. The parking situation is weird so make sure you valet. Overall the staff was pretty nice, but the hotel is super outdated and the setup is rather odd. Also, don't waste your time with the wifi. I'm currently writing this review from a tethered iPhone connection because the normal wifi was too slow to load yelp. Between this and just about anywhere else... I vote anywhere else.

I already wrote a review on TripAdvisor. Here is the nitty gritty:

1. Talk to the front desk thorougly about what you shoud expect.  Make sure your name is correct. Make sure they ert staff your room is occupied lest you be accused of being a lazy housekeeper squatting in a room. [This happened. A 'supervisor' basically tried to burst in and almost got the nightlatch off. ] I'm an OMNI Select member and got none of my perks.

2. Call and ask housekeeping to clean your room daily or it won't happen. If you are lucky turn down service will happen.  It never did for us.

3. Check to see whether they charged your room in advance for your entire scheduled stay plus potential other charges.

I was really expecting an amazing experience.  Instead I felt really ripped off. The GM, whom I e-mailed, never has gotten back to me.  We departed a week ago.

I expected a lot better because it is ab OMNI.
