My two issues were the food menu was quite limited (although they do offer a happy hour which is nice, but only offer certain foods at certain times, which is frustrating), and my pedicure at the spa was below average.

This was our first visit to this resort and upon arrival, we were greeted by super friendly guys at valet (which is complimentary for the entire stay). We got a deal on travel zoo for a one night stay in a casita, two cocktails, a $25 food credit and and $50 spa credit. 
The resort grounds are truly beautiful. You almost forget you're in Phoenix; all the plants and flowers are so lush and green. The room was cozy with a large 4 poster bed. The room had a Kuerig machine which was nice to have, even though we didn't get a chance to use it. The shower was large and the room was really clean. 
The resort is a destination earth property and very Eco conscious which I liked. The resort also includes a daily resort fee so that way you don't feel obligated to tip at every turn.  All the staff were extremely polite. 
The only issues I had was with the spa and room service. The $50 spa credit could only be used on a 50 minute service. I really wanted a pedicure and we were gonna pay out of pocket for a second pedicure so we could do it like a couples treatment but it wasn't an option. Also, it was 40+ for breakfast for the equivalent of a Denny's grand slam breakfast and it didn't come with any juice or anything just water.
 The resort fee does allow you access to the fitness center, pool, hot tub and into the spa to use the showers and eucalyptus steam room which was so refreshing and relaxing.

Nice old Phoenix historical property. However : I checked In mid June day temps 108 degrees F. Rate was well below season rack rate at $90 bucks. But upon check in a $30.00 "resort fee" and a $15 buck parking fee not mentioned on my corporate travel portal.  Thus they are sneaky , especially in    mid June.  Rooms are great and the ambiance is fantastic. They just sock it to you for extra $$$$ at every turn. Beware. I will review the restaurant T cooks latter but what I have had so far a great roasted beer salad for $12 bucks was the size of a sampling at a restaurant week somewhere. Rip off.

Rooms are so beautiful and the grounds offer great romantic walks. The bed is so comfy. I wanted to take that bad boy home. Little benches and reading areas. 24/7 pool and hot tub 

Cons: 

Checkin slow waited over 10 minutes before someone even said hello. When I booked no mention of 30 a NIGHT resort fee.  Supervisor on sift could Cate less spoke with GM and she waved but ONLY after walking her through booking and proving wasn't mentioned. I would stay again on a special date but with such a high resort fee too high too stay a week for vacation.

The Royal Palms has spacious grounds, but I did not find them to be "breathtaking" as others did. Maybe I'm spoiled since I travel a bit and go to southern CA once a month. 

Hotel:

Pros: The valet/bus boys were SO friendly and accommodating-always smiling, upbeat and ready with a cold bottle of water as your left for your summer excursion in Phx. Jenna the customer service manager is over-the-top customer service oriented, she was SO helpful! The yoga teacher was friendly and after over a decade of doing yoga, I learned some "new" mudras that I found extremely helpful. Gratuity fee of $15 covers all tips so you don't have to always be reaching for your wallet. And "Royal Palmers" (ice cold Arnold Palmers) when you check in!

Cons: We reserved a Montevista Suite with a big bathtub and were "upgraded" to a casita, which sounds good, but was in reality a handicap room that lacked a certain charm that was situated along a walkway and had the world's shallowest one-person bathtub. When we asked to be moved to the room we actually reserved, we were told they were all taken (!!) for the night and we moved the next morning. The beds were not great and the one in the handicapped room was actually quite mushy and uncomfortable. The thermostats in the rooms can be set to lower than 72 degrees, but turn off at 72 degrees at night. Well 72 degrees sounds cool, but we needed to have a fan brought in to be cool enough to sleep (and we live in Tucson so heat is not new to us). Drinks at the pool are apparently $20 each according to our bill (!!). Yoga is outside in the mornings which during monsoon season means mosquito-central. 

Restaurant/Bar:

Pros: Chuck the bartender at the Mix Up bar was also top-notch as he chatted us up and explained the specialty drink of the day. Our waiter at T Cooks for dinner was friendly enough and the food there is great! Try the antelope or the tasting menu. 

Cons: Can't think of any. 

Warning: Not knowing any better, we bought the BOGO free deal which listed room rates as $450/night with one night free came out to $225/night. The thing is the rack rate on their website for those nights was $179 and $139. So we could have saved money by getting the rack rate which I found irritating. Luckily Jenna the customer relations manager lowered our rate to the rack rate, but we had to ask and the woman who checked us out was none too happy about me asking to make sure we'd gotten the rate everyone else paid. 

Overall, a mid-range "resort" which a decent pool area, pretty gardens/grounds and at times excellent customer service. Overall I'll rate it A-OK, 3 stars. Not great, but certainly good enough (at the reduced summer prices).
Everything was great, just not really impressed with the room/casita. It's a great place, my rating is only based on comparison with other hotels with equivalent pricing.

Guys. Seriously? This place is not living up to the hype. My husband and I went here for an overnight stay to celebrate the fact that it was our first time away from our kids, um ever in two years (no big deal) and it was a Father's Day gift. We had booked through hotels.com and relayed the importance of our visit in the reservation. I upgraded the room to a private casita and chose the option to pay at the time of the booking, as opposed to paying later. 
Imagine my surprise when, upon check-in, I am confronted immediately with,"we need a credit card for this reservation".  "I thought I paid ahead, but ok...."  The front desk attendant then informs us of the $30 resort fee and $15 overnight parking fee. Really? Y'all can't even spring for free parking for your patrons? At a so-called 4.5 star resort? Please. 
The valet gave us a tour of the grounds and he was great. Informative, funny and honest. When we tipped him he made sure we knew that a tip was already included and wasn't necessary. We knew but he deserved the tip anyway, it was just nice of him to be honest.

The stay was nice, the room was fine and dinner was good-but for a $250 check for two people I was expecting more. But what was really great happened next. Once we got home a few days passed and I spoke to my mom. She said she was surprised she didn't hear from me for a big thank you. I asked why? Well it turned out my parents paid for our stay as a nice gesture since we never get out. Odd, I thought, considering the first thing the front desk attendant did was ask for a credit card when my parents sent their info in and wanted to pay for any other incidentals above and beyond the room. I called and talked to the front desk attendant and told her the deal. She didn't sympathize, she didn't apologize, she just transferred me to the accounting department to leave a message. The following day, Eric from accounting called me back. We figured out that my card wasn't charged but there was a $300 hold on my debit that would "disappear in a week or so". Now, I don't have a lot of money, so for $300 to be tied up for a week was kind of a bummer. He keep repeating the same info about booking through hotels.com and how sometimes people who pay for rooms want to remain anonymous (I was asking why I wasn't told the room was paid for, why was I even asked to present a card when that part was handled?). He was droning on and I said, "I don't care about that, what I care about is..." I couldn't finish my sentence because Eric from accounting interrupted me and said that if I didn't care what he was saying he couldn't help me any further. Then he HUNG UP ON ME! I mean come on! Where's the hospitality? I was furious. I wanted to be done with the shitty ordeal but my friend persuaded me to call again and let management know what happened. So I did. I told her that I didn't want anything from them, that I simply would never come back. She assured me that she would take this higher and have it corrected. With all the awesome deals in the valley during the summer why throw it away on this place? Spend your hard earned money some place else.

Amazing.  I did not stay at the hotel , but I did visit the Alvadora spa.  This spa was very warm and inviting.  I liked the fact that it was indoor and outdoor, with plenty of natural sunlight.  I used the eucalyptus steam room, and private outdoor jacuzzi prior to my treatments.  I enjoyed that these facilities were separated from the men's facilities.  The treatment room was lovely, with floor to ceiling plantation shutters that offered just enough light.  Sometimes I feel like I am in a cave when getting a massage, so this was a welcome change.  The therapist, Jennifer, was an absolute delight.  Knowledgable, professional, and a great conversation.  She did both my massage and facial.  She gave me wonderful tips on skincare, and even taught me an exercise to stretch my back after a long day at work.  The rest of the staff was very pleasant and accommodating as well.  The products used were animal, and environmentally friendly.  I will be back for sure!

My wife and I went here for a weekend getaway . Very nice rooms . Great restaurant and bar .Excellent service . Very accomindating . It's small in relation to the Fairmont Princess but much more intamate.Would go back in a second.

So we picked this hotel as a romantic get away through Hotwire. When we arrived there was some mix up  with the room that Hotwire didn't know about but the hotel did. We apparently had the room cancelled, yet nobody told us. This was after 9.30pm at night. Long story short the manager was able to put us in the main suite for one night and we moved rooms for the next night. 

The pool was great, and we hired a cabana for a hundred dollars which was nice as the service was stepped up a level and it also had a fan.

The food at the bar and music entertainment was good with an intimate feel.

This hotel is perfect for couples wanting an romantic get away.
Absolutely wonderful no words can describe the tranquility I am feeling. Great staff, immaculate, and will receive serious pampering.  You deserve it. Go

I loved this spa. I really like their private line of grooming products. My massage was great and very relaxing. I truly like their adjustable massage tables. I did not care for how small the lockers area was but likely not an issue on a slow day. Pool area was nice but didnt like that they added service charge on my drink ticket as I almost tipped twice. Overall I eould go back but Montelucia around the corner would get my $ first.

This review is a little late, but me and my girlfriend stayed at the Royal Palms for two nights over July 4th weekend.  Once you get on the grounds it is like you have left Phoenix.  The staff was exceptional.  We had a Valencia Casita which is so private and roomy.  I enjoyed the exercise room on second floor which offered a view.  The pool area is ok, but don't expect towels too early in the morning.  My girlfriend had a massage at the spa and was very happy.  The bar and restaurant are first rate.  Overall has become one of our favorite places.

Ideal small, intimate resort with stellar service!  They earned my repeat business.  If you're looking for a large, 5 start Ritz Carlton, go to the Ritz.  If you're looking for a gorgeous setting with a Tuscan vibe, gardens, fountains, nooks crannies and one-on-one service it's ideal.  It's not perfect, but as a frequent traveler it wins in my book!

Resort fee covers all tips - not a usual perk!  Employees still go above and beyond.  Michael S. In valet, Robert and Matt at pool all extraordinary.  We didn't want for anything.  Parking is $15 for one vehicle but only a one time fee and you can go in and out.  This is also a deal for resorts.

We had a travel zoo voucher and were on a tight budget so we used food credits in Mix up Bar.  Great wine, good food but very limited and neither Mix Up or TJ Cooks good for vegans.  TJ Cooks well known and smelled delicious and I'll eat there next time when not on budget travel.

Pool great, but smaller so reserve chairs early.  We never waited for service or water or towels!  These are the perks of smaller property!  Water was very cold but would be good in hotter weather.  Hot tub was too hot to use.

Since we were on a budget we didn't get to use our $40 spa credits because it was limited to massage or body work for 50min or more.  We did get to do free yoga class which was awesome!  Will be better outside when bugs aren't biting.  We also got to use steam room (even though we didn't get services - another perk of smaller property.)  Spa smaller but luxurious with amenities, steam room, showers, small private hot tub women only, and good lotions.

My only complaints were room service dishes all over property and not picked up despite employees out and about.  And better vegan food options.  That sent us off property to close restaurants.  Either way I'll be back.  Rooms were great, romantic, big beds, robes, big bathroom, dressing room, separate bag area and nice showers.  Check for tub if you want to take a bath.  Don't hesitate... great place!

I stopped in on one of my recent resort pool hops and might have found my new go to pool. The pool is small and crowded, but the large blue chair towels, poured water in a large container and service made up for it. I was greeted as I entered the pool area and treated kindly through out my stay. I ate a chicken quesadilla at the bar that was "to die for". Yum that was good! I ate the whole thing, even in my bikini. I ordered a long island iced tea, but was given a Mai tai, with an apology and "I'll make you a long island iced tea after you finish that, if you want" from the bar tender. 

I paid my bill and included a tip, but  it wasn't until after wards that I noticed the tip was already included. Nothing was said to me so I guess they figured I wanted to tip twice...hmmm.

An oasis in the desert. You are treated wonderfully from the minute you drive up. The staff totally caters to your needs to provide a comfortable stay. Sitting by the pool they brought ice water without being requested but they'll also bring other drinks. I love the mature landscape and all of the different places to sit and relax outside. The inside could use a little remodel. The beds are comfortable and the A/C is cold and quiet. We slept well and enjoyed our time there.

This place is outstanding! Spectacular service from beginning to the end. The people in T. Cooks remember you and what you like. They are very attentive and nice. Love their Sunday brunch! Cannot find anything like it here in the Phoenix area.

Great location, atmosphere, and ambience!  Great service by all staff members.  Rooms were comfortable; spa facilities were great; dinner at T. Cook's was delicious; valet service was super helpful and assisted us 5 ladies to our rooms.  We were here for a Girls Weekend Getaway.  We had a cabana by the pool area which was great to be in the shade (July) and it had a ceiling fan which kept us cool.  Pool staff were very attentive and worked diligently to keep us hydrated (water/cocktails) throughout the afternoon.  Definitely, we will return here again to take advantage of their summer special rates!!!

Wow, just wow!  What a property, we got a great summer rate through AAA and it was very worth the experience.  It is not a great property for kids so only bring the spouse if you want to get a recharge on such an awesome little place.  It only has one pool but the atmosphere is Spanish Colonial and the landscape is very mature with plants I have never seen in Phoenix.  The bar and restaurant are great little places and the service is second to none.  By far the best staycation we have taken in Phoenix so far.  There are several room styles and we picked up a suite and it was so nice inside and very comfortable.  I will stay here again before I die...hopefully sooner than later.

This resort is beautiful and has that romantic feel to it. The beautiful mountains, palm trees, nice lighting, and wonderful architecture on the grounds makes for a magical stay.

The rooms are nice and feel like a fancy house. You feel like you are in an expensive home rather than a resort room. Also when you walk out everything is so beautiful and doesn't have a typical resort feel. The vibes you feel here are very good and cozy.

The pool area is very nice, this is a place that doesn't cater to kids. It's very adult oriented which is a great thing since often resorts can be too wild with kids.

This is a beautiful place that you should check out if you want something different from a hotel or want a more intimate resort. They have that magic here!

Got there on a Sat morning at 11am, only 2 tables had customers( first clue). We wanted the breakfast buffet for $15 per person. Big dissapointment. They where already taking down the buffet items & it was only 11am (2nd clue). Went to the omlet bar and the cook looked grouchy and pissed to have to open back up. The sign said your choice of cheese but seems like the cook picks what type of cheese you want on your omlet. Even worse was the cold bacon, cold french toast, & yucky tasting cold dry pancakes. The self serve milk was room temperature. And to top it off they charged me 18% gratuity on parties of 6 or more. The whole tab was like $120.00 for the worst breakfast this summer. Only 2 things I liked about this restaurant, Samantha, our waitress and the fruit. Would definitaly NOT go back here. Theres a Mc Donalds down the street and you get the same quality of food for less than $20 for 6 people.

One word. Disgusting.  The room was dirty from top to bottom  from the filthy carpet to the cigarette smell that would not go away and to top it off on our second day they cut the water to the room with no explanation as to why.  Thankfully we had done what we set out to do in Phoenix and decided to check out after the water was cut.  If you like dirty motels that try to pass themselves off as a "hotel/ innsuite" this is the place for you.

First room (257) was a total dive, everything was so so so dirty!  So bad, my 8 year old boy and 9 ur old girl who both like to play and get filthy wouldn't even sit on or touch anything...lol, no BS.  On the plus side and why this place got 3 stars was upon notifying the front desk lady, she immediately moved us to a much better but still kinda dirty room that had been remodeled within the last decade, lol.  But she made it right with excellent care and even gave us a nice cold bottle of wine.  FYI she wasn't even a manager, so I commend the property owners for empowering their staff to make it right for the clients/customers.  Overall a below average property but great customer service here.  Would not stay at again, but would always tell the good part to others due to the employes.

When you walk in the room there would be little doubt that this IS a motel, but with better-than-average decor. The bed, bathroom and all other stuff are pretty modern but the room itself is small and feels cheap. 

Didn't like the air conditioning. It is very powerful but at the same time noisy as heck. If you don't own a pair of ear plugs, you'd better be a deep sleeper. 

The breakfast is amazing. Very delicious and a lot of variety to offer. Couldn't have enough of it. 

Too bad we missed social hour where free drinks are provided for everyone. 

Overall I'd recommended this place if you are traveling with a budget but still wanna a little spoil during your stay.

Stayed here twice and both times have been great. Room was clean, no issues, staff is nice. Excellent, hearty FREE breakfast, clean pool. Honestly, we stay here because of the beds (as is the criteria I base most my hotel reservations on: if we like the beds we stay there.) The Cloud 9 bed is Ahhhhh-mazing and never disappoints. (They actually have the info in the room as to where you can buy one and the bedding set. Good location, north phoenix, by Squaw Peak, close to freeway but no freeway noise. Our go to place in North Phx. =)

We were in need of a hotel to stay at for one night due to the almost nervous breakdown I had after finding a scorpion in my house. We were looking for something affordable and decent. I'm giving this location 5 stars for what it is, a motel. It is by far the nicest best western I have ever been to. Front desk staff was courteous. Room was clean and remodeled. The pool area is nice as well. There's is a free hot breakfast buffet that included cereal, Belgian waffles, eggs, biscuits and gravy, fruit, yogurt and a few other items. It was very good for what it is. Free. The bed was comfortable. My only gripe is that our room was by the pool and we have a baby so it was a little tough getting her to sleep with the noise. However, that's our fault and should have requested one not near the pool

Stayed with family of four for 6 days. Had to go run down to the front desk for towels all the time. Even after complaining for 3 times hotel staff would not put 4 towels in the bathroom. This is the first hotel I have seen in many years which is so ignorant about customer's needs.

This location is very close to our house.
Great customer service with James..super friendly and makes the whole process quick and easy.
If I had to complain there is no shade so when you pick up your car, the interiors are boiling hot in the summer (eek)!
Besides that...I can't complain. We've used this location at least 3 times this summer with no problems.
Great folks, nice tune & wax.  Been coming here for a few years.

These guys know their stuff. I stopped in to have some boot customization work done, and I was extremely relieved this crew was very knowledgeable and clearly knows their stuff. They're veteran ski racing tuners, so you can have full confidence your substantial gear investment is in good hands with Alpine. I've gotten really bad boot work done at some really famous slopeside shops, so I know good advice when I hear it -- and I appreciate it when the salesman convinces me NOT to spend more money than I need to. (Bonus points for spending so much time with my feet on a 90-degree day... patience of a saint.) Best of all, I was pretty surprised that my new boots required zero further adjustment after the initial fitting -- in comparison, my last ones required at least a dozen tweaks and still never felt right. So yeah, I'll go back.

So worth it. I was really scared after a major blow out and Chris was very understanding and nice. He followed me to discount tire and even helped me back my car out of a narrow alley. That's how shaky I was. I could not even deal with it. This is a great service to have.
Shivani treated me with respect and very professionally. I was given tour books and other materials to make a decision regarding an upcoming vacation. Excellent service.

I visited here for the first time to get my car title transfered into my Trust. They were very helped and made the process so easy. The woman who helped me even took the paper work out to the car so that my handicapped wife would not have to get out. Thank you for being s considerate. I will be back for other services.

Picked up a car out of state and was expecting to deal with the nightmare that is DMV. My insurance office suggested I try AAA( I am a member)..was in and out in 20 minutes!! Samantha Jourden made it all so easy.

So, have had AAA for 12 years and have never had to use them. Today I called. Our 2005 Ford F150 truck has a dead battery. Husband had chemotherapy this afternoon and is in no shape to change a battery. Battery is DEAD and needs to be replaced. Guess what, they don't have a battery to replace this one. Not that they don't have one on their truck, they don't have one in stock. The girl I spoke to on the phone, offered to tow our truck. Tow it where? It's at home in our garage! Does this make any sense at all? Her only offer  " let us tow you" we couldn't get it thru her head we did not need a tow, we need a battery. Canceling this worthless $200.00( ish) a year service. Service for what?

So, have had AAA for 12 years and have never had to use them. Today I called. Our 2005 Ford F150 truck has a dead battery. Husband had chemotherapy this afternoon and is in no shape to change a battery. Battery is DEAD and needs to be replaced. Guess what, they don't have a battery to replace this one. Not that they don't have one on their truck, they don't have one in stock. The girl I spoke to on the phone, offered to tow our truck. Tow it where? It's at home in our garage! Does thus make any sense at all? Her only offer was " let us tow you" we couldn't get it they her head we did not need a tow, we need a battery. Canceling this worthless $200.00( ish) a year service. Service for what? 

I would like to update this review in all fairness. I received a phone call from AAA a few days later as I also wrote to them describing the above incident. Krista left 2 messages and apologized for what happened and went above and beyond in compensation. I can only assume the rep we spoke with initially was not familiar with what batteries fit which commonly USA made trucks!  Nevertheless, I feel AAA handled the complaint fairly and wanted all to know this must have been a blip that won't occur again. I change my ***** rating:)

We recently bought a log home up in Northern AZ, along with an ATV (toy for my husband). We had family coming to stay at the cabin over the weekend and were in a hurry to get the ATV licensed so that we could use it. My husband suggested I take the title to AAA, and they would be able to help me. Who knew? After a very short wait, a representative was able to help transfer the title, and provide a new plate and decals for it. I was in and out in about 15 minutes. The only reason I didn't rate AAA 5 stars is the gal who helped me wasn't very friendly. She did her job, but without a smile. Attitude makes all the difference, perhaps it was because it was the end of the day. All in all, a good experience.

When I am planning a very important vacation, there is only one person I go see, Annette Prewitt. She has been everywhere and she knows all the best spots to see and the places to avoid. It's always a pleasure spending time with her.
The menu didn't look interesting online but the food was perfect once there.  Huge, beautiful rooms.  Lovely walking paths near a creek and ponds.  Staff genuinely cared.
Went back, still perfect service and staff, still great food, still huge rooms for a fair price.  Love the walking trails.  Going back again!
Wow!  I enjoyed staying here!  Huge rooms!  We had three adults and two children and everyone had plenty of room!  Highly recommended!

Returned and was told the manager and head chef had changed.  The staff is not nearly as friendly.  The food is less consistent.  Service is spottier.  Carpets are less clean and show signs of wear.  Still a good hotel, but...

This is a pretty nice hotel, but it doesn't look like a normal Embassy Suites. I actually liked it better because the balconies are outside and some have a nice view of the Golf Course and the setting sun. The suites are a decent size, not huge and the TV's are HD and have the NFL network which is pretty rare. The evening reception has free beer and wine, but all they have is snack mix and chips for appetizer - would one hot dish kill ya? Free breakfast is pretty average, except for make your own omlette, which is the best part. Coffee creamer curdled, fruit selection was watermelon, but somebody forgot to cut off the white rinds before serving it to the public. Eggs in the pan are runny, but potatoes are decent, even though its cubed and probably frozen and tossed with some spice mix from a jar. If you book online and in advance, you will get best rate - I scored an $85 room for about $69 during the week. WiFi only free for Diamond members and food is about a 1/2 mile walk if you have no car.
    Oh and the address won't come up on your GPS, so you will need to type in the cross-streets instead.

This place was amazing!!! Glen the man at the front check in desk was extremely helpful and friendly! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone! The room was  spacious, clean and peaceful!  The very was very nice and serene.  The location was great.  There was a variety of stores and restaurants down the street!! 
There are some pics I added on my profile if they are of any help

Came here to meet family for a graduation.  Did not actually stay here but had drinks and used their pool.  The staff was exceptional.  They all were so friendly.  The location is not bad, pretty close to the freeway and stores including Paradise Valley mall right there.  The grounds where very nice and clean.  When I inquired about the rooms and setup my family all loved the amenities, free breakfast, happy hours and clean spacious rooms.  I would definitely recommend this Embassy Suites to others.

Good stay overall.  We were given a corner room with a great golf course view.  The kids enjoyed the pool at night.  The highlight --big breakfast spread with made to order omelets/pancakes.  Needless to say, we had seconds and thirds.

A special thanks to Martha for making us feel at home during our 2-night stay.

I stayed at this Embassy Suites during a writer/reader conference, and I have to say that it has been one of the best hotel stays I have ever had! Everyone on staff was extremely attentive and friendly, they were always available for the strangest requests! The food was amazing-- I felt incredibly spoiled at breakfast! The rooms are huge, we had four adults sharing my room and we weren't packed in like sardines. Quite the opposite, actually! I am looking forward to next year's conference when we come back again!

We came here for a weekend trip and to celebrate my fiancés birthday. Aaron checked us in and he had the best customer service! He was able to get us into an early check in and gave us an up-grade, because of my fiancés birthday. 

The room was great, it was very quiet, clean and spacious, I believe every room comes with an outside patio which was very nice. The black out curtains in the room were awesome, they actually blacked out everything and kept it nice and dark. 

We took advantage of the managers reception, they had multiple TV's in the reception area which was great for watching the basketball game. I wish they had board games though, we have been to a property that provide basic board games like chess, and checkers during the manager reception and I liked that a lot more that watching TV. 

The pool was also very nice we went in the evening when everything was a little quieter, it seemed to be very popular in the afternoon.

We also got to meet Robert at the front desk and he was very professional and courteous during our stay.

I would definitely recommend this hotel because of its customer service, location and amenities!

My husband and I just left after staying here for 2 nights. This was by far an amazing experience! The staff gave the best service day and night! We didn't leave the hotel the whole time as we felt like we were at a resort! A big thanks to Aaron and Amelia at the front desk! They truly made our checking in easy and were very friendly and knowledgable! We will definitely be back! :)
Not a resort but it sure offered resort style treatment. Free happy hour with finger foods rooms are clean and nice. The pool is great and the free full on breakfast tops it off. Super nice

I love embassy suites.  This location is great.  Staff very friendly.   Rooms clean and roomy.   Breakfast is good too.

Would stay again.

I was shocked to say the least. Very clean!! HUGE free breakfast in restaurant with made to order omelets amongst a variety of fruits, pastries and other yummy things. Complimentary Happy Hour for two hours every evening with free beer and wine and appetizers. The staff was just amazing such stellar hospitality!!! I booked this room for my parents when they visited and spent time there every day!!! Great hotel!
Great hotel, great value, free happy hour, beautiful pool. Very comfortable bed and a great selection at the restaurant for breakfast and dinner.

Never again. Customer service is nonexistent. We were awoken before 6 am by the golf course loudspeaker. We complained and were finally moved further away from the loudspeaker. No assistance with luggage at all. Finally found a cart to take our luggage to our room. I asked for a couple of waters at the front desk as I was checking out. They were sitting in plain sight behind the counter. The clerk went to the back room and came back to say we couldn't have water because we were checking out. We were not offered water when checking in. Whoever is managing the training needs to be replaced. Even though the rooms are okay the service is so bad we won't be back.

Love it here! awesome breakfast, super cool happy hour (free drinks and snacks for guests) great views out back and a really nice pool and jacuzzi! the rooms are spacious and it's nice to have two sinks and a refrigerator. I've stayed here 3 times and never once regretted it. super nice staff that is happy to assist in anyway possible.

My 3 children and I had the pleasure of taking this tour with Tim and a great Aussie family.
This otherwise long 4 hour ride was fun and entertaining. Tim kept us interested by providing us with tons of facts about AZ and joking with us the whole way.  We stopped for lunch at the Indian Reservation and did some light shopping.  The Grand Canyon was spectacular and Tim was so accommodating taking our pictures along the way.  
Tim was the highlight of the trip.  He provided the visiting Australian family with tips on visiting Sedona and showed us some great things along the way.  He had a supply of water he kept encouraging us to drink. My daughter left our camera in the car and he graciously returned it that very night.  Thanks Tim and SouthWest for providing us with a great experience.

We couldn't have asked for more. There were four of us on this trip and we wanted a tour to the Grand Canyon that didn't involve a huge crowd. We were picked up at our resort  in Scotttsdale at 7:30 am in a van that had  6 other passengers -- so we spent the day with this nice group. The minute we got in the van, the tour began. Princely, our guide, is a walking encyclopedia! He knows everything and is willing to share it all. As we traveled through the Sonoran Desert we learned about the desert, the different types of plants and cacti  and why they survive... We traveled through desert, mountains and farmlands... Princely knew the ins and outs and avoided traffic with his shortcuts...  We stopped in Sedona and had the opportunity to take in a couple of different vistas while there. Princely was great at making sure we had family photos -- always offering to snap shots at each stop we made. I felt like we were the only people at the Canyon upon arrival. We came in through the "back door" as it were -- avoiding huge crowds that enter through the main entrance. It was wonderful. Driving along the rim we saw elk feeding and Princely "banged a u-ie" and went back to the spot so we could take pictures. It was great! We made several stops at the Canyon to take in the beauty and views and snap lots of photos. I highly recommend Southwest Tours... We could have never done so much on our own -- it was nice to kick back, relax, listen and look! Thanks for making our day a great one! (By the way -- we were dropped off at 9:00 pm!)

Close to the airport, airport shuttle, clean, comfortable but WAIT!!! What? No free wi-fi? Ethernet Cable????  $9.95 per day for internet assess?

Here's the secret. The lounge offers free wi-fi and they have several big screen televisions for the daily news, sports, etc.

Hey- for the price and the convenience. I'd stay there again.

I'm so split on this place, because I kinda don't want to like it, but as a Hilton HHonors Diamond member, I get the perks that make it pretty awesome.

For example, like most other Hiltons, there isn't a complimentary breakfast.  What a dick move for an upscale hotel, right?  Well... wait wait wait HHonors member, you get exclusive access to the Executive Lounge on the 4th Floor for a lovely complimentary breakfast with eggs, potatoes, maybe some other hot foods, muffins, bagels, doughnuts, fresh coffee, juice, yogurt, and a staff member there just for you!

Oh, and don't forget that we have a lovely, HHonors member only evening reception with libations on the cheap and some lovely finger foods - sandwiches and such.  Relax after your long day, and partake in some CNBC or other hi-def programming on one of our HDTVs

Back in your room, $9.95 for a day of Internet access?  Not so, HHonors guest!  Type in your information and we provide you 24 hours of Internet access completely gratis.  (And surprisingly, for non-free Internet access, it's not particularly fast.  I was only hitting 0.5Mb/s down)

I get giving your best customers special perks, the evening reception for one, but some of these really should be perks for all guests.  I will give the Hilton Phoenix Airport a lot of credit otherwise.  The staff is incredibly friendly.  They have a complimentary shuttle that will take you to several nearby locations.  I've made a few trips to Chase Field when the shuttle drops me off and picks me back up from the 44th and Washington Valley Metro Station.

The rooms are fantastic.  Clean, well appointed (I'm sure it's those fine, European linens, Serta mattresses, and Crabtree & Evelyn soaps), HDTV in every room.  One big criticism is as of my latest trip in August 2011, they've disabled the TVs from switching to a secondary input - alas, no plugging my PlayStation 3 into an HDMI input for some gaming/movies/Netflix.  A second criticism, no mini fridge or microwave in the room.

There is an amazing fitness center.  Plenty of room, full rack of dumbbells, benches, treadmills, ellipticals, weight machine... Needless to say, it's well equipped.  The pool is also pretty big - long enough to get a few good laps in without crashing into kids.

The price on this place is always reasonable, especially compared to other hotels of its caliber in the area.  I still prefer the Doubletree up the road, but for the price, this is a decent choice if you have an HHonors membership.  Otherwise, I'd suggest trying someplace else.
Only stayed one day but was great. Lemon water in the lobby a plus in this phx heat.

The corporate rate we have in the summer cannot be beat and the concierge lounge for diamond members is stellar!  The rooms have been updated and are comparable to updated Hiltons.  I love its' proximity to the airport and location for me to get to work.
The only reason why I don't give this place a 5th star, is for location.  There isn't a running path from its door and I haven't been able to find a restaurant that suits my fancy in the nearby vicinity (though I haven't tried the restaurant in the hotel either).  This location and quality cannot compare with the hotels on Camelback.
I will stay here again in the future, but in the meantime, I am going to try out some other Phoenix hotels..
Pretty decent hotel. The lobby looks clean with a good decoration. The room was pretty nice. But WIFI is a bit hard to find here!!

Only 3 1/2 stars for this hilton location:  I so wanted this to be a stellar review for our once much loved hilton brand, but it's highly mixed.  Typically we enjoy our stays at various hilton properties - for they have earned our appreciation and ratings through the years of corporate stays as working professionals.  

Sadly this location fell short of the high standards the hilton brand has set.

We stopped of in Phoenix for a day on our way home from a Sedona retreat.

Tired and hungry, we were picked up at the airport by the shuttle driver promptly and quick deposited at the hilton airport Phoenix location.
(Good driver and prompt transport, which we both appreciated ).

The reception staff were prompt and courteous, w rapid checkin and bottled water to ease our parched throats due to the outdoor 106 degree temperature.

The Hilton hotel staffs across the board have been exemplary in Arizona - but this location has a very dated, tired decor and is need of a facelift.  The carpet leading to our room was faded and worn in places.

Once we arrive in our room, we learned our lovely balcony view overlooked the noisy freeway and parking lot and we could barely stand on it - though we wouldn't want to, given the view.  No help for that since this is a location at the airport, which we both understood.

There was also an odd, unpleasant smell in the room which dissipated eventually (though it was more resigning ourselves to the odor since we were just too tired to repack and move).

We left our bags and went down for a meal, only to learn the main restaurant was closed on Sunday afternoon at 5 pm and we could only eat in the loud and noisy sports grill, so we did.

Liz our server was wonderful and would do well in a 5 star restaurant w impeccable service.  The food had good points as well as poor.  My bacon grilled chicken wrap was excellent, the steak fries accompanying it were large and underdone while my husbands steak tacos were so- so.

We turned in early due to our exhaustion and woke incredibly early, so had room service. (Very unusual for us since we are out and about early).  Rick our waiter was prompt,  bringing fresh toast due to a mishap in the kitchen, and soy milk for the coffee.

Unfortunately the coffee was lukewarm (barely) and the toast, despite dressing it up w real butter and strawberry preserves, barely warm despite being brought promptly to us.

The bed was decent, but not the lovely comfort bed we expected from the Hilton brand.  The temperature was off in the room despite being set at its coolest setting, it was still quite warm, almost uncomfortably so.

This is definitely a mixed review - fantastic service and mentioned staff worthy of a 5 star resort while downgraded drastically w the decor of a dated decades past.  Food also a mixed bag, I don't think we will return to this location.

I consider myself a fair individual and I have since been contacted by the manager of the hotel and the food and beverage manager and am more than satisfied on how they solved my concerns. I am staying here the next time I come to Phoenix and will post after my stay there to let you know how it goes! Right now, feeling good!

I usually like Hilton chain hotels which is why I'm a devoted Hilton honors program member. But I was not too impressed with this location. I was in for business and although the front desk was nice enough, the room smelled like cigarettes (it was non smoking) and the need was uncomfortable (lumpy). I asked to move to another room and it still smelled like cigarettes :( When I brought it up to the concierge, she replied that there was nothing she can do although the staff agreed it smelled like cigarettes in the room. The room was clean in appearance however. There were no signs of bed bugs (you should always check no matter where you stay) and the sheets had been changed. Unfortunately, other patrons have abused the no smoking policy and ruined it for us non smokers. But the, "I'm sorry there is nothing I can do although I can smell it" reply really disappointed me. Free parking however. WiFi is not free but there is a business office with slow Internet.

I'm going to have to agree with Lauren on this one.
This place is a little beat up and completely off the beaten path of any semblance of a night life. You'll need to jump a cab or bribe a shuttle driver to get you to Mill Street or anywhere for that matter. The service was friendly from room service, the restaurant and the front desk but the venue itself was dated. I will say that the pool area was nice and both the pool and the hot tub seemed clean. My room was fairly clean but their wall outlets were limited, the bathroom was cramped and my room and the hallways on the first floor smelled like cigarettes. My bed was pretty comfy thankfully but for some reason it seemed that people were slamming their doors throughout the night all four nights I stayed here. They did have some construction going on early morning but that's a non-issue. Lastly, the in hotel Rimrock restaurant left a lot to be desired so you may want to have a dining plan ready when you hit the tarmac in PHX. The only restaurant in walking distance is a Denny's.

This is a very clean and professional hotel. The location is perfect for layover at the airport. Shuttle service is fast and efficient. Front lobby is awesome the rooms are once again very clean most have balconies. I did not eat at any of the restaurants, but the guest I spoke with said the food was excellent.

JF

Stuck in Phoenix because of US Airways but got a room here at the Hilton!

Lovely staff. The nicest people. 

Quick shuttle service between the airport and hotel. 

Room was clean, spacious, quiet. No complaints from this happy guest!

I have to say every staff member I encountered was very friendly and always helpful. Rooms were very clean. Bed was comfortable. Complementary breakfast was great. Rooms have balconies. Sliding door that opens ...yeahhh 
Most hotels sliding doors or window don't open so this was amazing to have a balcony. 
Plenty parking and it's free. 
We rented a car from hertz. 
And noticed in the parking area of the hotel there are stalls for Hertz rental cars. I asked front desk if they have Hertz representatives inside this hotel he said no. But if we would like to drop off the car we just park it in the designated area and leave the car keys with the front desk agent they will return the car for us. That was awesome and convenient!!!

The bad!!!
The walls are very very thin:( 
You can hear the people talk next door. I could hear their TV. I could hear them open their balcony door. I could hear them flush toilet & take a shower. 
Very disappointing!!
Since I am a light sleeper this really bothered me and I didn't get good sleep.
I was looking forward to use the jacuzzi. 
Jacuzzi didn't work properly:(((

We tried to change our reservation length from 8 nights to 2 and we're told our room was not available for the change. If we booked the room for 8 nights and are still staying the beginning portion of that same reservation HOW is it possible that our room is now magically unavailable?? Customer service was very unaccomodating and kept restating their position of the room being no longer available like that was changing the laws of basic logic. O K - I get that you don't want to help me. Just let me cancel the whole thing and I'll gladly take my money elsewhere - 15 minutes of my life I shall never get back!!!

The Courtyard Phoenix Airport is a really nice hotel. It has modern furnishings and decorations throughout. The hotel itself is very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful.  We stayed here after missing a connecting flight and had a very pleasant stay.

Sweet pool and pretty nice fitness center although it's small. They also have a lot of other quality food and drinks but at a pretty high price however. Nice staff and very clean and well maintained rooms. They have free wifi or you can pay extra for high speed internet. Nice flat screens in the rooms and desk to do work. Also the rooms have balconies with chairs to lounge.

Nice airport hotel (offers shuttle to/from PHX) with nice, clean rooms and friendly service. The pool was also the perfect temperature, the area around the pool gets VERY slippery and the pool floor is very grainy (at times it felt like sandpaper on toes :( ). The lobby is nice, they offer cucumber water in the lobby and have plenty of tables with seating to eat or hang out

602-200-2000 put this number in your cell. It's smart to have for all the little situations you may find yourself in. Out too late, car acting up, ride to the airport. :D

I don't know which cab company y'all use, but this one has always gotten the job done for me.

If you like cabs that unapologetically show up 30-45 minutes late to take you to the airport, cabs that are driven by some creepy 64 year old dude who likes to talk about the stripper "wh0re" he picked up and how she wanted him blah blah blah..., cabs that may smell like a hobo who shat himself (before dying 13 days ago in a dumpster) (in the summer), cabs that start the meter at $7 in Old Town because the driver thinks you're drunk and he can get away with it, then you've found a winner--Discount Cabs!

5 out of 7 times we've used them, DC has been phenomenally unprofessional and awful.

Screw discount cab.  I've had two experiences with them and both were miserable.  I called for a cab to head to a bar on a friday night, and the dispatcher insisted I tell him my apartment number.  I live in a big apartment building - unless your driver intends on pulling up the stairs, you should be just fine with the building number.  But no, he kept insisting I give him my apartment number, which I just wasn't comfortable with - there is absolutely no need for you to have it, unless you're looking to rob me while I'm out.  Needless to say the cab never came.

I also happened on a Discount Cab late one night on my way home from the airport.  No clearly posted rates or anything.  The driver bitched the whole way to my place that all his fares that day were short ones from the airport to central phoenix, he hadn't had a long fare to North Scottsdale all day.  Bad news.  Once he pulled up to my building, he added a $1.50 phantom charge to my already somehow $18 fare, saying it was an "airport fee" - bullshit.  Since I did feel a little bad he had short fares, I was going to tip him on top of that, after all I did have some heavy luggage.  But all I had was a $20 and a $5.  I handed him the money and asked for change, he jumped back in his cab and took off.  I'd report his ass, but he didn't have his name or badge number displayed!

Never again! I wish I had gotten the name of our driver, but it really doesn't matter, they all try to pull the same stunts! Suddenly acting confused finding the shortest, most direct route to your destination, letting up on the accelerator, breaking unnecessarily, slowing down long before the traffic signal is about to change, so that they HAVE to stop (thereby letting the meter run) driving under the speed limit, taking their good, old, sweet time proceeding ahead once the light turns green, purposely squeaking every last dime they can out of the fare, and then pretending to have forgotten to stop the meter when you've arrived. Nevermind the stifling heat in the back seat because the driver was comfortable enough. What a colossal ripoff!

I've never really had many issues with Discount cab. I usually use them when I am going to and from the airport. The drivers are usually very courteous and friendly and prompt at arriving. There's nothing worse than an awkward conversation in a cab and I've never encountered that with Discount. I have with plenty of other cab companies and am now pretty picky about who takes me to the airport. 

I do think they need better people answering the phones to take reservations though. There have been one or two times I've called and schedule a pickup the night before a morning flight only to call in the morning to check status and find out it was never entered into their system. I shouldn't have to play babysitter.

Living in Old Town, taking a cab is a regular occurrence.  I can eliminate the requirement for a DD and don't have to leave my car in the parking garage.   I have used Discount Cab more times than I can count.   They are reliable and on time. The call in system is very convenient, since it ties you address to the phone number, so it typically takes less than 10 seconds to order a cab.   They accept credit cards and have GPS in all their cars which is some of the reason's they are on the top of my list for taxi's, not to mention they are typically a little cheaper than the other taxis.  So take my advice, start looking for the green car!
My dealing with discount cab have always been top notch. Their cabs are alwys clean and professionally driven, unlike may other cab companies. I give them my highest recommendation

I needed a cab to take me to Sky Harbor. This is the first time I have ever used a cab. I saw Discount Cab cars all over Scottsdale and decieded  to call them. I called  and requested a 9:45 am pickup. Literally three min. after the call ( I called at 8:20) I got a call from the driver that he was at my apt. Informed him that he was too early & he politely said he would be back. At 9:40 I exited my apt. to wait and the cab was already there. My driver was named Anne and she couldn't have been nicer. Good conversationlist, excellent driver. She drove very carefully and I felt very much at ease.She told me that Discount Cab can take you to Sky Harbor, but can't pick-up. Does anyone know why? I had to take (no choice) Yellow Cab. Yellow Cab was OK. Driver from another country and I told him how to go. He never muttered a word. Drove fine and got me home just fine.

Well, I had a great experience this weekend with this company. I met a friend at the farmer's market downtown with my Lab. We were originally only going to take a jaunt around the market and go to a new coffeeshop right down in Roosevelt Row. However, the coffeeshop ended up being closed.

My friend attempted to find another place to go, and we decided to walk. We mixed up the directions (we're both new-ish to Phoenix) and ended up walking 16 blocks east. We then realized the place we were trying to go would be another ~50 blocks north. That obviously wasn't happening. My poor dog was not doing well. She laid down in some shade by a fried chicken joint and was panting heavily. I never would have brought her along had I known our walk was going to be so far. It was 109 degrees out. I was very concerned and didn't think she would be able to make it the 16 blocks back without getting serious heatstroke.

I called Discount cab. The dispatcher told me dogs are allowed in the cabs and it would be a 5 to 20 minute wait. The cab came in less than 5 minutes and the driver was great. He was very friendly and good-natured about my Lab hopping in the backseat. He said he got dogs all the time, but would just need to take the cab to a carwash afterwards. He brought us back downtown and the entire ride, with tip, ended up being approx $8.50. Well worth it. My dog is fine, btw. ;)

I definitely would NOT recommend Discount. Especially if you're going to the airport. I made a reservation for a cab 11 hours before a 9 am pickup. Called again 1 hour before pickup time to confirm. I was assured all was good. 9 am, no cab. 9:15 no cab. 9:30 no cab. 

They have ONE job to do and they can't do it right. Never again.

I have taken a Discount Cab about 10 times now.

Always arrive in the time frame they give.  They know there way around & have GPS if they don't.  They accept credit/debit cards..payable IN the cab.

Which is where my 10th time turns sour.  The driver over charged me by $300.  And I live paycheck to paycheck..so this was no good for me.  Cause it took a week to get my money back.

It had been a long, tiring day. I headed to the airport at 8 am to hop a plane at 10 am to fly from Las Vegas to Mesa to pick up my cousin's van that was supposedly ready to go from the shop. Took a shuttle from the airport to the nasty garage (see review for Gila Muffler), then spent several hours trying to get answers on the cluster f*** that became my situation. 

By 5 pm, I was hungry, tired, HOT (the garage had no AC), stinky (they were all chain smokers and allergic to cleaning), and stranded. I called the nearest Best Western for a room, and they recommended Discount Cab.

Talk about a day saver! When the little green cab pulled up, I almost cried tears of joy. The driver, Laura, sprang into action and loaded my bags into the trunk. I gave her the hotel's address and we were off.

She was really sweet, and we chit-chatted. Not being one to hide my emotions, she found out about how my day had gone. She asked if I'd like to stop at a store for some grub. Would I!

Not only did she pull through KFC so I could order half the menu, but she dropped me off in front of Safeway so I could grab a bottle of wine (yes, it was THAT kind of day) and some provisions. We swooped back to KFC just in time to grab the food, and were off to the hotel.

Then, AFTER I paid her, she waited in front of the hotel to find out where my room was so she could drive me around to the door. It gets better. She then parked and helped me carry my bags up the stairs to my room.

Laura is a gem, and I am grateful that I was referred to such a great service. Highly recommend!

I ordered a cab to the airport at 5am this morning.   Cab didn't show up so I called dispatch, who said the cab 'would be there in 2 min'.   10 min later when the cab didn't show up, I called again and they told me that the cab was showing it had already picked me up and was on the way to the airport.   Ended up jumping in my car and barely making the flight.   Parking will cost me $150 this week - I'll never trust Discount Cab again.
This place sucks! I placed an order for a cab @ 12:45. Made the call at 11:15. Been calling the dispatch for about a half an hour and she won't pick-up. Never using this company again. Avoid th

I usually use this company but I have a big complaint that has gone unresolved.  I'm hoping this yelp review will bring attention to the matter.  I was charged twice from a cabbie and I have called and left message several times, in addition to an online message, with no response.  Has anyone ever had an issue where you think or unsure the charge card was read?  That's what happened to me.  There is one charge for fare only, no tip.  Then charge number two with fare and tip.  This event happened almost three months ago with no success of reaching a human to talk to regarding this matter.  Very poor

From what I am reading below, reviews are consistent.  If you are needing a cab with out time restrictions, this would be a good company.  However, if you DO have time constriction DO NOT USE THEM! 
I ordered a cab the night before for our guests to get to the airport.  The lady assured me they would be on time and have 2 (two) booster seats, for the drive to Mesa Gateway.  The taxi was to arrive at 5:30 AM when I called to check the eta, I was informed, AT THAT TIME, it was a shift change and the call had not been "picked up" yet, also, while airport reservations take priority, there is no guarantee.  I was not told this the night before when I made the reservation. Asked me to give them 4 minutes.  So I did.  I call back 4 minutes later, still no cab.  She informs me again there is not guarantee and that the call had not been picked up. 

I had to call my neighbor at 5:50 to come watch my sleeping kids so I could take our guests to the airport.  My car would not have accommodated all of us. 

I called back on our way to the airport, the service had still not been picked up at that point! I also asked to speak with a manager, she was not "available". I was told she would call me back, I asked the dispatch to repeat my phone number so there would be no confusion or reason for not calling....... I'm still waiting. it's 7:49

 A few suggestions for Discount:
** Don't tote that airport fares take precedence when in fact they do not.
** Get on board with training.  Your dispatch LAST NIGHT should have informed me that there was no guarantee for pick up time.  I would have changed the time of the reservation or made other arrangements all together.  THE NIGHT BEFORE. Instead of being rushed, panicked and angry by what could have been avoided with a little communication.

Jenni M.

What kind of cab service hires drivers that the 1st words coming from their mouth is griping @ their fares? Really, I ask cuz the Last time I called 4 1 (& I do mean LAST), the driver was bitching @ me that my friend's residence didn't have #s on the house. Wow, really?? So having it on their mail drop & on both sides of their driveway made him strain a partial brain cell he was workin' w/ or somethin'? 

   I don't expect rainbows & roses but how do u plan 2 make any decent tips w/ that crappy attitude (even tho I tipped him way 2 Generous 4 the short distance & his icky demeanor figuring he was having a bad day) but really why should I have 2pay 4 that anyway? 

   And not once did he offer any help getting either bag or large box I was carrying 4 my friend's kid's B~day party I was heading 2. That's pretty Lame Dude ~ esp after seeing how generous I was upon drop~off. Yeah never~mind I got it,  a woman can juggle it just fine as b4. Wouldn't want him 2 bust a jugular lifting anything out 4 me or even worse breaking/spilling everything. Probably knew he'd look pitiful but still... NO excuse!!

   Glad it was a short trip cuz not sure I'd b able 2 handle much more, defin8ly a limited dose typa dude 2 have 2 contend w/. If it feels like I'm babysitting b~n made 2 feel I gotta change his diaper, give him some cookies, & he's STILL crying, shouldn't I b the 1 getting paid? Btw, don't c why he was complaining as r'nt they supposed 2 have GPS? 

   All I know is better outfits like Lyft, Uber & others like them r coming out 4 less cost, don't know how a company like this expects 2 survive much less compete, especially if they have drivers like him w/ attitudes a~la~$h*t! Guess I should feel lucky he showed up on time or @ all 4 that matter. Got a Lyft back home when party was Done & so am I now w/ this company after about 7 decent Xs using them previously b4 this experience sealed it 4 me...

These guys are terrible. 

We prebooked an appointment online for a ride to the airport to our wedding in the Bahamas on 6/16. They were to pick us up on 6/18 and 4:15am. We called on 6/17 to make sure their Prius could hold our 6 suitcases and were assured that yes, they could. In the meantime, we moved our pick up time to 4am, just in case.

4am. 4:15am no one is there. We call. Per the dispatcher, he can't find us, but will be there soon (maybe he should call US???). In the meantime I call Yellow Cab. They promise us a cab by 4:30am.

4:25am, still no Discount Cab driver and no call from him. We call them back and ask WTF? We are told the driver couldn't find us so left for another fare. Dumbest thing we've ever heard...since when do the drivers not call when they can't find you? 

Every time we've taken them in the past, they've been borderline late AND all the drivers act like they just moved to Phoenix...no one knows where anything is or how to get there.
Useful cab service. Ubers apparently illegal.

This company does not have very good customer service. I had to call multiple times and each person gave me a different answer. I had a group of 14 to be taken to the airport. I called the day before to do a price estimate. I also wanted to see if they had vans (because the number of my group). I was ensured they would have vans and I could call 20 min in advance to have to pick us up. I called the next day, 40 min before pickup time, to be told that I needed to call 2 hours before in order to secure a van. So I then had to get cars. I was told a car would hold 4 people, however the cab was a Prius and could only hold 3 with luggage. So I had to call for extra cabs last minute. (Not ideal when going to an airport) when the cab did arrive they didn't help us load our luggage. Our driver just sat in the backseat and watched us pack our luggage and close the trunk. Very unprofessional. 

Not to mention NO ONE I talked to on the phone was friendly. 

Overall not impressed.

I had an exceptional experience over the weekend riding wiht Discount Cab. I called and scheduled a trip on Friday evening. They showed up 15 minutes early so I went out to let the driver know I would not be ready yet and he said that's okay. I pride myself on being early and patient for my customers. He then waited politely and gave us a ride. There are more good experiences than bad, so if you have a good one, I would suggest asking for their card.

So I work at a bars in downtown phoenix and in Tempe and every time i call for a cab to pick me up after 9pm they never come! i have to continue to call check my status and every time my ride gets canceled. I know i live in south phoenix but i would expect a notable company to be arrive still yet. 

The customer service reps are terrible and tend to have an attitude about me calling in to check where my cab is. Not only that on Friday after work at like 3am I of course took a cab home. For some reason the credit card machine in the vehicle I was in didn't work luckily I had cash inside my house. 

granted this is my fault that I left my iPhone in the car, but when I call the customer service immediately  to get the cab to come back they said it was unattainable request.  I have been calling in everyday since then to check lost and found and I always have to call in for another rep. it seems my first rep i  come into contact with are never willing to help and have attitude. No empathy is shown and I always get a different estimate of when or how long the driver has until they can turn in a item. I have heard 3days -7days! so always check to make sure you don't leave anything behind. 

since all of my unfortunate events with Discount cab. I do not feel like anyone should be treated with the little respect and costumer service this company has to offer.
Discount cab is the BOMB!!! They drove us all around Tempe! Very friendly and quick!

Really terrible experience this past weekend.  We made a reservation at 3:30 p.m. for a pick-up at 5:30 p.m.  At 4:00 p.m. TWO drivers showed up to our hotel.  My friend explained that they were an hour and a half early and the driver sounded exasperated.

We assumed our reservation was cancelled so we did what we really should have done and had the hotel make us a reservation.  

When we went outside to meet the cab, we discovered both Discount Cab drivers had come back for us.  The driver we interacted with was rude and we opted to go with the hotel-booked cab (which, I think was a private driver and it was a lovely experience).  

Coming back from Jobing.com, the only taxi stand available is Discount Cab so we waited, waited and waited while we hoped the drunk people could corral themselves in some type of responsible line.  For all of the money they must make post-show, you'd think they could have a person out there organizing things.  

Our cab driver did not speak one word to us.. not even to acknowledge that he heard our destination.  Upon arrival at the hotel, he proceeded to not take the necessary left to drop us off at the bell stand but he went straight.  And that wouldn't have been a problem except the road ended and he literally drove up over the curb and into the grass.  He turned around, smiled and said "Oops."  It was bizarre.  

I don't have many occasions to take a taxi but I think I'll try Uber next time.  It has to be better than this.
WARNING - Do not get into a cab with a driver named Eric, cab #1614 and license plate 4ZW-276. He is a thug, thief and vandal. He will scam you and take or damage your property.
With UberX around we are no longer held hostage by rude dispatchers, sketchy drivers, expensive taxi rides in cigarette-stinking cars that Discount Cab provides.

They used to be okay.  I'd call, and within 10 minutes, I was heading where I needed.  If you find a cabbie you like, get their number and just use them.  

What brought my experience down... My girlfriend, her one year old son, and I were at Tempe Marketplace.  We had a few things to get home.  We called them, and waited over an hour.  No cab, no call.....We got home by other means, but that was what turned me away.  I do use them, since I am happy with the service of one driver.  I have his cell and ask if he's available.  I even have scheduled future pick ups through him.  Otherwise, I am looking into other companies.

The free ride back is a scam! They give you a card that says you get a free ride back to your car in the morning after they drive you home from the bar, then they still charge you full price... even when you tell them ahead of time both on the phone and when you get in the cab, they don't bother to mention that it's not free... how is that ok?

After out having fun in Old Town Scottsdale I seemed to have lost my friends by the end of the night. Lost and unsure of what to do next a cab driver from Discount Cab flagged me down. I got in and gave him the address for my hotel. Well, at first it was the wrong address. Fine, I understand that's my fault. I corrected myself about a mile later. However, then the ride seemed to drag on and on. My hotel was only a mile away from Old Town. Surely, there must have been a faster way to get there that wouldn't have taken nearly 40 minutes. My cab ride also included a stop at Circle K because my driver was hungry and wanted a hot dog... What?? Who does that?? I'm trying to freaking get home and he stops because he's hungry, not to mention on my dime. Anyways, I reached out to Discount Cab to voice my dissatisfaction. No follow up from them. They don't even care. Save yourself the trouble and just get an Uber or Lyft.

An absolute joke. I know for a fact I left my car keys in one of their cabs on the front seat. $225 to replace. Couldn't miss them with a giant purple leather case connected to them. They are expensive too, and shady. Uber from now on!!!! Big mistake......

It was my first time using Taxi. Phone operator sounded like she doesn't want to talk to me like one of those people who hates their job and act like that too. BUT taxi driver was very nice gentleman. They quoted 5 to 20 minutes to get picked up but I got a ride about less than 10 minutes.

I was attending a doctors visit with my wheelchair bound 87 year old mother a 10250 N 92nd st on July 22, 2015. The handicapped transfer arrived to pick her up and parked in a handicapped space in front of the building. The van has a side entrance so the driver parked to the left side of the space allowing the door and ramp to open in the balance of the space. 
At 2:40 pm as we were approaching the space to put mom in the van, Discount Cab #5778, license number AZ 4ZT-589, a middle aged caucasian driver with long stringy gray hair sticking out from under his baseball cap, pulled into the space left for loading the wheelchair, the same space the transfer van was parked in. As the Discount Cab driver emerged from his car, the transfer van driver asked him to move and showed him that he had actually parked in her space where the ramp needed to unfold. He simply looked at her and said he too was here to pick up a handicapped person and proceed to walk into the office building. I was outraged. It was mid afternoon searing heat. My mother was stuck in a wheel chair in the parking lot and could not gain entrance into the van because of this brain-dead idiot. I yelled, "Turn around and move your car". He stopped and told me to "chill out" and not to get huffy with him. He then spent the next 2 minutes arguing why he was entitled to park in the space. NOTE: THERE WAS AN EMPTY HANDICAPPED SPACE, TWO SPACES OVER. He did not attempt to move his car until I pulled my phone out and called 911. After moving his car, he shouted insults at us on his way into the office building. I called Scottsdale Police Department and filed an incident report. I also called Discount Cab at 602-200-2000, the number on his car and was told a supervisor would call back. They have not called. IF THIS IMBECILE IS NOT TERMINATED EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY I WOULD ASK THAT EVERYONE READING THIS THAT HAS A MOTHER THEY CARE ABOUT, BOYCOTT DISCOUNT CAB. There are a lot complaints about this company but this was the most EGREGIOUS OFFENSE I can imagine.

Never use this taxi. I have been nearly crashed into at top speed by these morons changing lanes on the freeways; without looking, without signaling, and without stopping their move as I slam on the brakes to avoid them crashing into me. If you value your lives and others on the freeway, do anything you can to keep these idiots off the road and run THEM into bankruptcy.
Failed to show up for transport to airport. Cost me a bucket of dollars. Make sure you have a good backup plan and plenty of time. I had a confirmed reservation. No one answers the phone either!
Corina and Cutter Aviation are wonderful! She gave my 3 yr old the full airport & airplane tour. He loved it. Thank you Corina!

WORST AIRLINE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED. 
WOULD NOT LET ME ON THE FLIGHT BECAUSE THEY OVERBOOKED IT, AND THEN REFUSED TO REFUND ME AND MY FAMILY....EVEN THOUGH I HAD A REFUNDABLE TICKET. 
Bought flight tickets in January for a trip down the Grand Canyon that left the following morning at 6am. They canceled our flight in March and rescheduled us for a later flight. Then 3 days prior to our flight they told us they overbooked our flight and could only take 9 out of the 11 people they booked. After more than 15 calls to them including the corporate headquarters they said they absolutely would not compensate us for having to drive to our destination now, there was no way they could guarantee our flight unless arrived onsite 24 hours in advance (no more no less), and that they had no idea if or how they could refund our flight. Despite us having to miss our entire trip that cost thousands of dollars by telling us 3 days prior to our departure that they are unable to take us to our destination. They are also unfortunately the only airline that flys into this site. We arrived 3 hours before the plane took off, but they would not let us on the plane, and refused to refund our tickets. We lost all of the money, were stranded in page, and had to spend 400$ on a one way rental care to page. I would rather drive anywhere than deal with this airline ever again. Worst customer service. I can't imagine a less reliable company....in any part of the world.

One word -- NIGHTMARE!!!!!!

Of all of the businesses I have ever dealt with this business was by far the worst experience I have ever had -- and I am a business owner myself!!!

Let's start from the top:

1. We (my wife and I) book our fight in January of 2014 to fly from Phoenix, AZ to Page, AZ to go white water rafting down the Grand Canyon with my father in law. For those of you who aren't familiar, those rafting trips have to be booked a year in advance, for private trips often multiple years in advance with a lottery for who can raft it (population caps on the trips).

2. Four Days before the flight Great Lakes tells us that it is now FIRST COME FIRST SERVE ON THE FLIGHT!!!! Wait what? First come first serve seating? NO FIRST COME FIRST SERVE BOARDING!!! If we don't get there before the other passenger's we're screwed, and if we do get there before them they are screwed. 

3. We had already booked flights with Southwest so we knew we would only arrive an hour before the other passengers.  Needless to say we did not get there in time to get a seat on the plane. 

NEXT you would expect Great Lakes to say "oh sorry we couldn't get you a seat, let's get you a refund -- and some compensation for the $400 and 7 hour car ride you are now going to have to spend on a rental. Did we get that? OF COURSE NOT! 

Did we even get a refund? NOPE! 

Luckily we were able to get our credit card company to reverse the charges otherwise I would have likely called their phone number once a day to tell them to quit their jobs.

Like I said -- NIGHTMARE!!!!!

Im going to have to agree Whole heartedly. And i informed the manager of it as well. I picked this one because it was close to the Airport and the Light Rail. The noise from the Airport wasnt to bad. But it was the Train Horns all NIGHT LONG and ALL MORNING when your trying to sleep. I wouldnt pick this one, the neighborhood wasnt bad despite what people say. But the Train noise is just unbearable. I got it for the Click 6 rate which was reasonable. Stay Elsewhere. I should of picked one further down that was right off the light rail.

I've asked for a smoking room and gave me a non smoking room.
Besides the noise of the planes, trains and automobiles lol it was decent on the inside. Just noisy
Basically you get what you pay for .....

I only live about 15 minutes from the airport, so typically a cab is the easiest way to get home without hassling someone to pick me up.   I got into the cab and saw a credit card machine which was good because I only had $24 on me.   I told this to the cab driver and he got onto the freeway informed me that the machine doesn't always work, but  if it doesn't I'll take you to the closest ATM.... As a girl, it's not the most comfortable situation, getting cash while a cab driver is waiting in the car... with your belongings!  Unfortunately the cab fare was $28 and the machine wasn't working... so there I was at the ATM.  It ended up not being the most convenient options since it added about 15 minutes onto my trip and the $2.50 ATM fee.   The driver was nice, the cab was clean, but don't advertise that you take CC and not have the machine work!

Triple A is a convenient name because they triple charged my credit card when the credit card machine wasn't working, which the drivers and other yelpers say is a really common problem. I disputed two of the three charges and they insist that there was no third payment. I'm looking at my account right now and, yup, there's the charge with no refund from a month ago. So they've had my money all this time and they're arguing with me because... ??? Stay away from Triple A unless you're ok with paying multiple times for one cab ride and/or enjoy spending A LOT of time disputing charges.

That cab driver was nice though. I took the cab home from the airport and we spent an extra 10 or so minutes trying to get the credit card machine to work which was frustrating at the end of a long day of travelling. The CC machine was looking like it wasn't working and was saying that the transaction didn't go through. So I don't blame the driver. But wow, if a business triple charges me and then fights me on whether I should get refunded for 2/3 charges, that is an enormous problem.

Update: they ended up refunding the two extra charges. Phew! But save yourself the headache and only go with Triple A if you have cash. At the Phoenix Airport, I have just asked the cab coordinator to get me a different cab company if I didn't have cash and this has worked out just fine.

My family and I were heading out on vacation for a couple of weeks and scheduled a Yellow Cab to pick us up from our house to take us to the airport.  I reserved a mini-van as we had considerable luggage and two small kids.  Everything was set for a 6:30 AM pick-up.  Needless to say these guys are horrible.  Here's a summary of events:
