I travel a lot for work. I happen to be traveling for pleasure today & have had nothing but the most horrible service I've ever experienced here at this airport. I transferred to this Airport from Farmington NM, on my way to Oakland.  Needing a little assistance because I flew in on a very small airline & needed info about my new gate, baggage, etc..  Every person I spoke with was rude, short & condescending. 
Dear Phoenix Airport Employees, You have a job, just like the rest of us. Get off your high horse & treat people how you'd like to be treated.  Its not that hard.  If you have ANY other options, don't fly into this airport.

PHX is a nice airport. In the last few years, I've only been in terminal 4. I haven't been to terminal 2 since the early 2000's and terminal 3 for about 4 years. The food selection in terminal 4 is varied, and they charge what the price is outside the airport... No markups. If you have a long layover, it's easy to walk between the A-D gates to find good to your liking. However, if you have limited time, you may be stuck with what's in your area. I was sad to learn that there is no Admiral's Club: the high B gates. There is one in the low B gate section.

If you need to change terminals, you have to leave security.

My first time here, and very disappointed to find out Phoenix Airport is not very modern as they have minimal charging locations!  Currently sitting on the floor next to an outlet trying to charge my iPhone and Kindle.  They are back in the previous century!!!  Will do my best to avoid connecting through here in the future.  On this trip alone, have traveled through Tampa, Charlotte, Eugene and Portland...all with numerous charging locations.  Phoenix, time to get modern!!!

Sky Harbor is one of the biggest pain in the butts to drop people off and to pick them up. They don't have adequate signage and traffic is usually a mess. They are always changing things and there is usually some form of construction going on.

This airport I love this airport. If I have to have a layover I will try to pass thru here. They have some great restaurants the only thing if your flying international and you have a layover the terminal is really far. They don't have enough of the cart guys to get you there sometimes.

So-called "America's Friendliest Airport", needs a name change. We arrived a security check, but could not find the TSA Precheck so we stood in the regular long line where we encountered Gestapo Jane screaming at the passengers, "Remove your shoes!! Pull out your laptop!! Remove all liquids and place in a zip bag!! What's wrong with you people?? Don't you read the instructions before you come to the airport??!!" I decided to speak up, "Ma'am, we DID follow the instructions. It says TSA Precheck leave on your shoes, leave liquids in your bags, leave laptops in your bags"  Her response, " That's only for TSA Precheck!!! " "Exuse me, Ma'am, but we ARE TSA Precheck." Her response? " Well that's just too bad!! TSA Precheck is closed!!! What's wrong with you people?? Don't you read the instructions before you come to the airport? " The I began to think she was robo. She made no sense but screamed at us at the top of her lungs. Go figure. As we walked away, everyone was laughing and making jokes about her rude and bizarre behavior. From there we went to the air terminal store to pick up some items. The sign said it opened at 5. It was 5:10 and they were not open but people we lined up. A women opened the door to tell us the were "Opening late". All right then. Way to go Sky Harbor.

It's an airport.  For the most part, you don't have much choice in whether you use this one or not.  But out of all the airports I fly in and out of, this is one of the nicest all around.  There are reasonable food and drink choices all over, and everything is clean and well maintained.  Bathrooms are always clean and don't stink, unlike many other airports.
It's little too hectic. Terminals are pretty confusing  especially when picking up people. I would put extra 15 - 20 minutes for buffer in case you get lost when using this airport

Have to say that the two biggest downfalls for this airport is that the WIFI sucks and that there aren't more chargimg stations or plug availability like other airports have on their seating. Of the many times that I have been to this airport, the WIFI is spotty at best.

Curbside check in at economy parking lot 4 was a breeze thanks to Blake.  Parking on floors 1-4 was full but there was plenty of parking on the higher floors and the elevators down to the sky tram were speedy. After that,  the wait for the sky tram was one minute.  We breezed through security and their new radio wave body scanner in a little over ten minutes, with the TSA officer being friendly and wishing us " aloha" since our destination was Kauai.  Restrooms were also clean and centrally located. A quick  bite to eat at the Pei Wei, on we were off.

I've done more business travel in 2015.  I really like the new sky train.  It has made things very fast and easy when parking at the east economy lot to get to Terminal 4.  Much less stressful when traveling!

This airport isn't as new and pretty looking as some others. But it's easy to get in and out of (just make sure you are very clear on which side of baggage claim to find your ride at). And there's decent restaurant options. The security lines have always been short and fast. Getting between terminals feels easy. In sum, I don't mind having to fly into or through here. And hey, that's about as much as I can expect from an airport. So we'll say I'm a fan.

The rental car service center is horrible for terminal 3. I watched multiple terminal 4 buses come and go until half an hour later finally a bus for terminal 3 came. Of course this was too late to catch my flight so thanks for that.

Sky Harbor - as an Arizona native I have watched Sky Harbor become what is today.  I can remember only having Terminal 1, the passengers walking across the tarmac to the terminal as we stood on the roof watching; waving.  "Here comes Aunt Mamie!" we'd squeal as they rolled out the red carpet and she'd walk down the stairs wearing her fox stole; in for the winter from New Hampshire.  Always exciting.  In high school that was a good cheap date too - go watch the planes at the airport and steal some kisses under the stars in the dark, thick night.  Then the sprawl and growth of the 70's required a bigger airport and it grew and with each new phase we would be in awe and remember the old times.  It grew and grew and became the rather hodgepodge of an airport.  I love the new train to the terminal and hope to utilize that someday soon but otherwise the airport lacks some character, local flavor and charm and is not the most organized of airports.  I will say the Sky Harbor employees were some of the most courteous that I encountered on our trip. Despite having to work in the blistering heat they were very kind and helpful to us. We had a very pleasant wait at the gate and the boarding was civilized and easy thanks to the ticket agents.  The moving sidewalks are a blessing for having to get to the gates quickly and is highly appreciated.  It does same time and prevents you having to RUN from one end to the other.  As always, the a/c is too cold for comfort.  You are wearing clothes for 100+ degrees outside and they have it chilled down to the high 70's?  Please.  Take a sweater and wear long pants.  The ride to the airport is miserable in long pants but once inside you will be glad you did.  Also take a sweater and thank me next time.  Otherwise the airport is fine.  The cell phone parking used to be really convenient and easy but they have moved it and the signs disappear so it's a bear to find.   Keep that in mind too.
This airport has really nice ppl working for them. The place is really user friendly and the signs are clear. There is no way to get lost

While this airport can get extremely busy, the staff here are pretty helpful and accommodating.  I prefer to fly out of this airport than the one in Tucson since my flights back home to Texas are way cheaper.  I also like that there are many places that are non-stop flights from Phoenix.  I hate having to connect in other places and wait, which is a plus about this airport.  They also have put more outlets to charge your phone while you wait, which is super helpful.  They have some nice restaurants and stores to browse around while you wait.  Just make sure to get there early or you can miss your flight, as the lines can get rather long during holiday season.
It's ok, long walks between terminals.  Often arrive in one terminal and have to fly out the farthest from where I arrived.

Love Sky Harbor! Every time I fly into Phoenix I just think to myself what a really nice airport. Can be a little overwhelming if you're not familiar with it but once you've been a few times you really can appreciate it. One of my favorite airports.

One thing I will say is never underestimate walking briskly or even running in an airport because it can mean the difference between getting to your connecting flight or having to book to the next flight. I was smart and only brought a carry-on bag and was ready to jet as soon as the airplane doors opened as I only had 20 minutes to catch my connecting flight due to some unexpected maintenance in Puerto Vallarta.  I walked very briskly from one of the last B gates hoping in the back of my mind there was not a long line in customs and that I wouldn't have to go through the TSA again to get to my connect terminal. 

First roadblock, customs, alas had minimal lines but I was a little confused by the self checkout passport scanner devices. It did seem to help decrease the lines though. I sauntered through the customs/immigration counter and continued my hustle toward the A gates. I know there is some method to the madness but I think it's kind of silly how you can come out of the international arrival gates go out through customs and have to basically circle back around if you're trying to get to the A gates. Anyway, still going at warp 9 speed I picked up my bag and ran up the steps to the shops area and found a departure board hoping my gate was near. Realizing it was the A gate and there wasn't any signage stating were A was I hollered at one of the people at the customer service desk who pointed me in the right direction. Visually sweating at this point as it was like 90 degrees in the terminal as opposed to the 110 or more outside and with a jacket on mind you, since the plane was a little brisk I got to the A gate. 

"Hay dios mio!", I exclaimed still reeling from my trip to Mexico as I came to roadblock #2, TSA. With no time to waste, I started to disrobe. We all know the drill, coats, shoes, belts, laptops out of laptops, liquids in clear bag outside of your carryon and etc. I threw my coat and shoes and liquids in one tote and put my carryon on the conveyor. I stepped into the body scanner and grabbed my stuff off the belt. Forget about putting yourself back together! I slid into my shoes and wobbled my way onward until the back of my shoes slipped over the back of my heels. 

I see A8 in the distance and the crowd of travelers weaving in and out with several people frozen in confusion as they are unsure where they are or where they should be. Warp 10 kicks in and soon I pass A3, then 4 then 7. There is no one left in the A8 waiting area. The emotions start to override hope. I see a man walking by with an ipad that works for the airport. I ask, "how do I get on this plane? The one that is sitting in the gate." He mumbles some things that show he's confused as to what I'm asking. He checks the ipad and again mumbles information that doesn't help answer my question. Then like a ray of sunshine a woman appears from behind the secure gate door. She asks, "are you coming from Puerto Vallarta? how many more are there? where they close to you?" I mutter while trying to catch my breath, "Yes, there are like 5-7 more but I think they're stuck in the TSA area." She said "the captain knows y'all had some maintenance issues and wanted to try to wait, but I don't think we can wait for anyone else. We had already released y'alls seats." She keyed me back in to the plane and said "Take any seat available" Hope restored!!! I didn't miss my flight and only had a 20 minute layover. So next time you think there is no way you'll make it, walk as fast as you can and have everything ready to get through TSA or customs. You might just make it!

PHX is unexpectedly large- thank goodness for the moving sidewalks! Several stores and dining options in each terminal, and service was decent at the places I stopped during my layover. There aren't too many amenities available here, and there is significantly less seating available than each gate requires so you'll either sit on the floor or stand. Did not see many outlets in my terminal, but I did see several cleaning crews.

Lately I've been traveling a lot and of all the airports I see, the Sky Harbor is among the best. It has good local restaurants. When my ride comes to scoop me up it's effortless and quick. The baggage claim area is comfortable and I've never had to wait very long. 

The employees are great and are a great welcome to the Phoenix area. However, watch out for the police, they give no leeway on parking!

Bright and open, PHX is known as America's Friendliest Airport - not sure how they determine that, but I have to say, it's a pretty accurate tag line! Lots of great shops and places to eat, quick security, and the folks in purple are there to guide you if needed!
Had a two hour layover here and I was very pleased with the airport. It was easy to navigate and it seemed that each terminal had options to eat and CLEAN restrooms! Free wifi! Over all good airport.

I never could get the wifi to work, there aren't enough charging stations for the number of delayed and canceled flights I've had to endure here, and I'm looking forward to the connecting train to Terminal 2 for United because otherwise you have to walk across the face of the sun to get there. Needs more maps posted telling you where you are and where you can go for food.

Sky Harbor is one of the smoothest, easiest airports that I've ever have used, particularly compared to a major airport like LAX, which is a big hassle by comparison.

The security lines are faster and the workers are more relaxed and, frankly, nicer than people at most other airports.

I also like relatively fast check-in process and the free wi-fi.

Our Phoenix airport has made a lot of progress in the last 10 years.  There are a lot of decent food options, a free connection to the light rail and easy access to all airlines due to the spread out across 3 terminals.  The rail connection to east economy parking is much better than the bus too.

They've also added TSA Pre over the last few years but I hope that they will start to actually keep the lines open.  It's a much better airport experience but somehow it has been closed the last few times I was here.

Although Im not crazy about the U shaped airport and the long walk from arriving to departing, this review is on security.  Im not a frequent flyer, but take a trip to see my folks in Dallas every year.  I am a realist, and know I have to be inconvenienced to keep us safe.  I just dont understand why security cant be kinder.  The security personnel here were working the lines, reminding people what they need to do to get through quicker, but the major difference between the 2 other airports I had to go through was their attitude.  They were smiling, chatting with the travelers, being firm, but with a positive attitude.  After traveling for 6 hours at that point, I was extremely tired, and forgot to take my liquids out of my luggage.  I expected to be yelled at, but the tsa employee just smiled and joked a bit about it, and directed me to a corner where I could take the bag out.   At DFW, I was frowned at, and talked to like a child because my thumbs touched my head when being xrayed.  I was so impressed that I found the supervisor and thanked him for their kindness with this weary traveler..  PLEASE keep it up!!  It means a lot.

This airport sucks. I'm on a layover in the A wing and its packed. There must be 3000 people just in this wing alone. And the kicker on top of that is there is one bathroom in this entire wing. With a whopping 3 stalls. There is a line of dudes waiting to take a shit thats coming out the door and straight across the main hallway leading in and out of this wing. And a guy that works here told me they just finished remodeling!! This place is a joke
I love this airport. It's always clean, good food options, friendly staff and volunteers and a friendly and efficient TSA staff and process

Quite possibly one of the best airports I've been to. We had a quick layover here on our way to Cabo but on our way back from Cabo is were I got to see more of this airport. Our flight was delayed to land due to a really bad thunderstorm in AZ so it didn't start off so great. Once we managed to get off the plane, there was airport employees everywhere instructing us where to go. We waited for baggage claim which passed quick quickly. We went through immigration and security really quick. To get to our terminal I felt like I was walking through a mall. There were so many people and stores that you didn't feel like you were in an airport. So many places to shops for small items, snacks, bars and even full blown restaurants. 

There were so many employees around and they were all really kind and all had a smile on their face, even security which is rare to see. We went through security really quickly and on the other side of security there were so many choices to eat at that it was slightly overwhelming. I really enjoyed landing at this airport and having a layover here. There were a lot of people but then again it is an international airport and it is to be expected. Overall very satisfying!

I seem to have a number of layovers here. When I have a layover I tend to want to do one of two things: wander around the airport [maybe there is a spa or an amazing restaurant] or hang out in a lounge.  Some airports have enough stuff going on it is easy to amuse oneself while stretching your legs between flights. This is not really one of them.

While I find that the staff at the shops and restaurants here are generally pretty friendly this is a pretty nondescript, medium sized airport. It is relatively easy to find a place to charge your phone/tablet/laptop/battery pack.  I wouldn't quite say it is forgettable but I will say it gets the job done.  This is the place where you want to get some reading  or phone calls done. It shouldn't be too tough to get some work done either.

But, what if you're traveling to the Grand Canyon? I suggest flying to Vegas and taking a helicopter to the Grand Canyon. Make it that much more exciting.

Things to remember... Give the guy at the rental car shuttle line a snack.  Great guy but he can be a bit on the cranky side at 10 PM.  All rental cars have the same shuttle to the "Rental Terminal"  

It's an airport.. it's busy, it's got a lot of restaurants and gift shops everywhere and of course there's always a little construction inside somewhere.  Nothing here really stood out to me.

We missed our flight after our first one landed late. The lady at the desk only added to the frustration with her bad and unapologetic attitude. Thankfully, customer service was a lot more helpful and friendly, and quickly set up a new flight. He provided us with a map so we could find USO while we waited 6 hours. USO here is incredible! Lots of space, entertainment, and a child's play area!

Love the USO in Terminal 4!  Love the Purple Greeters to help me to where I need to go!  Love the new restaurant and eating options!  Hate that the WiFi is pretty slow.  Love the new SkyTrain!  Keep up the great work, PHX!!!

Phoenix airport, where heat is powerful than your AC and your eyeballs actually sweat. There's a lot of boob sweats to go around especially if you get trap here for more than 2 hrs. There's not much place to sit down. I heard they have a museum but there was no sign of it from concourse B going go A. I would've brought my daughter. Didn't expect this kind of airport in a large city/state.

Small and unclean airport. Not many shops or restaurants to choose from to kill time before your flight. Given that it is a small airport it's expected. I saw on a map that they had a kids play area and it's literally just a small slide and 2-3 big foam blocks. Not  impressive but enough for a small child to be excited. My biggest complaint about this airport is the poor wifi connection and that the water from the fountain is DISGUSTING. Make sure you have bottled water with you!

Horribly designed airport; terminals are all spread out. Uncomfortably hot. Very few "charging stations" to the point that patrons are waiting in line and fighting over them. Tables for them are really small too so people on laptops are taking over the whole table. It's 2015 guys. You don't need a Swedish design team to figure this problem area needs attention.

Worst airport experience ever. I left a detailed Google review, so at this point take my word for it. As a traveler for the last 30 years, I will never connect a flight in PHX under any circumstances. The deck crews are the worst I have ever seen. 45 mins just to de-plane.

PHX musings: 

-Flight was on time, the place was clean but a bit dated. I had immediate Super Bowl jealousy from all the signage. C'mon San Diego, build a stadium and this could be us! 

-There is a bunch of terminals, so if you're calling an Uber driver the app will ask you which terminal and door you'll be at. The door reference refers to the lowest level where the baggage claim is and the doors are numbered. 

-Baggage claim is a little slow and a note. It's 110 Degrees. ONE HUNDRED AND TEN. Not the airports fault but you'd think the air conditioning here would be much more sufficient than it is.

-As far as airports go, the food options are a-ok. Lack of plugs to charge things in general.

Welcome to PHX Sky Harbor, catacombs of bad-Southwest decor, excessively long concourses,  crappy WiFi, and surly US Airways employees. 

I hadn't been through PHX in some time but my last visit was via the Southwest concourse. This latest visit was through the US Airways/American concourses and was a reminder of what a sad airport is like. First, there are very few premium amenities at PHX. The Club at PHX, a lounge, that I have member access to, is only open until 3:30 PM. Really? Planes do depart after 3:30 PM. After 3:30 it becomes the British Airways lounge and only BA passengers may access the lounge. TSA PreCheck was closed on this particular day which didn't improve my mood. 

The WiFi here is "free throughout" but a bit difficult to access after watching 15 minutes of video ads. Power outlets are virtually non-existent in the terminals except a few sprinklings of standing "charge stations" around the terminal. Sorry, but I'm not sitting on the floor in front of the men's restroom with my phone mixed in with 12 strangers to get 5% more battery on my phone while hovering over a trash can. US Airways has dominated this airport for years but don't you dare ask a US Airways gate agent a questions, you might get your hand bitten.

One positive note is there is a lot of variety of restaurants in PHX Sky Harbor. There's something to suit everyone in terms of food options. 

I think it's quite appropriate that US Airways (soon to be in the history books) has it's home base in PHX. They're both relics of bad service and dated equipment.

This airport is very clean and organized. security is relatively efficient and quick so long as it's a domestic flight. I love the parking options, ease of getting to and from the airport and the options for food are fantastic. The only thing that would be helpful is misters outside the ground pickup area for people waiting during summer.

The Good:
+  security generally moves pretty fast
+  moving walkways make catching your flight easier if you're in a rush 

The Not So Good:
-  need layout or map
-  wifi is frustratingly slow
-  power outlets are rare
-  amenities and furnishings look like they are from the 80's

This airport is always packed and i have a hard time finding a seat at my gate more frequently than not. My biggest wish is that the Sauce restaurant was inside of security, man I would eat (literally) that up!

Sky Harbor has upped their restaurant game! So many local and delicious places to eat, I so appreciate that because I don't like eating McDonald's every time I fly. Plus, I don't like getting ripped off just because I'm in an airport. 

I walked from the C Gates to the A Gates (which if you don't know, is freaking far!) but what choice did I have, the beer was in the A Gates! I got my beer fast, with friendly service and what do you know, it was the normal and average price of $4! Me=Happy. But seriously, could we spread some beer love to the other less fortunate gates please?! 

I accidentally went through security with my Bobble (Filtering Water Bottle) filled about 1/3 of the way. Ooops. The TSA Agent was nice and said if I wanted to keep it (which I very much did and a water snob) that he would walk me around and back through the Employee Lane to speed up the process. So I did. The end.

I keep hearing there's Free WiFi and I saw it on my WiFi list when I was there but it didn't didn't seem to work so that was very frustrating. 

I also really hate that the gates are so so crammed together, if you don't like tight spaces, being touched by other human beings or the general feeling of being in an Earthquake Bunker built for 5 filled with 50, then good luck to you sir. Let's just hope you don't need to use the bathroom.

Restroom is important thing in any airports. The restroom in here is very clean which i like. 
There are many choices for food. And there are some open bars. Everything is good in here.

Great little airport! I had a layover here coming back from Cabo over the weekend. My boyfriend always has to be plugged in, so he was thrilled that this is a newer airport with plenty of outlets and charging stations wherever he was. The staff throughout the airport is very friendly and helpful. I'm not sure if it is because the airport is small or what though, but getting through security seemed like it took a really long time for not that big a line. The TSA here could be faster. There are plenty of decent food options throughout this airport as well and the wifi is decent; not great, but decent.

I like this airport. They have a good variety of businesses and it's very easy to get around. Another plus is that a slew of airlines fly in and out of here each day. What keeps me coming back is that it's a major airport ;)

The airport is actually okay, but the TSA team they have working are the biggest bunch of arrogant idiots I've ever had to encounter.  Not friendly at all, no patience with elderly passengers that are hard of hearing and just down right rude.  If they actually used the Pre TSA line they might not have such a backlog of passengers and they might actually see how a real airports works....  Get it fixed, otherwise you can expect me to video record every single time I through the airport so I can document the nightmare that is Sky Harbor TSA

Once again, make sure you book online under internet rates or the promotional rates, as you can save up to 20 bucks a night this way. Easy check-in and the entire place is smoke-free which is great. Most rooms have their own balconies and the AC and internet work great at this place. They only serve free coffee and banannas from 3-7am, which is unusual, but I found the mini-coffee maker in the rooms very handy for coffee and tea. In this case, there is no dirty carafe to deal with, so that makes it cleaner in my mind - cup goes under, water and coffee slides right in, so it's a good arrangement. Also nice touch is the endless shampoo dispenser and two queen bed rooms all come with mini-fridge, so i thought this place was nice to stay in for  afew days.

Hotel was extremely accommodating and the staff was very helpful. The airline lost our tickets after wed checked out and the next flight wasn't for 8 hours. Not only did they send a shuttle to pick us up bit they also let us check back into our room.

Hotel was absolutely accommodating. We had a mix up in travel plans and the hotel went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of. Beautiful pool, clean rooms and the Roadhouse restaurant attached is a nice bonus. Completely happy with my stay here!

I missed my flight in Phoenix and the next available was the following evening. I thought about sleeping in the airport but finally caved and got a room late late Thursday night. For only a last minute booking it still made sense to have a comfortable bed and hot shower. I called the Best Western Inn and she was very polite and professional. Within minutes I was booked in the system and  she sent a shuttle to pick me up late night. When I arrived to the front desk there was another concierge who knew I was arriving so that shows great communication.  The room was clean and the AC was already on, makes sense seeing how it was 90ish degrees at 10pm. The lobby was decorated nice and updated. Great amenities very good service. 
I would definitely stay at that Best Western should I ever miss another flight in Phoenix.

The price cannot be beaten...PERIOD!  That being said, the lot is small, not covered and sketchy.  My car was parked for 5 nights without incident.  But if you've invested a lot of money in a car and you want covered parking during our summer monsoon, look elsewhere.  I would have given this outfit more stars, however, the shuttle service needs some adjusting.  First off they have Green and White Sky Harbor Parking shuttles which are shared with other lots.  Please put a sign on the shuttle as to which lot you're going to.  You've plastered signs all over the darn thing, begging for tips (kind of tacky) so I know someone in the office knows how to make a sign.  The first van arrived, I said I was going to Sundance, he kindly told me the next van would take me to sundance.  Next van comes, I get on....we're not going to Sundance.  VERY VERY frustrating to make the customer constantly ask where the van is going.  The van should have a sign....PERIOD!

Price is great and  I had no issue with security of car.  Instruction card we received instructed us to exit door #5 and go to designated spot.  Designated spot is actually between doors & and 9 causing unnecessary confusion.  Additionally, don't look for a vehicle that says "Sundance Parking" because they don't, and we were not informed of this.  As a result, we had a 30 minute wait in 106-degrees at 9 pm which is not fun.  Driver was very friendly and helpful

Recently used this service when I was on a hiking trip to Havasu.  I needed a inexpensively but reliable way to get from Phoenix to Flagstaff.  The shuttle was great, they even got me on an earlier van when my flight arrived early.  Big Al the driver was very nice, he even had water for the passengers and stopped half way (3 hr trip) so we could have a bathroom break.  The return trip was just as good although that driver wasn't quite as charismatic.  I would definitely use the service again!

I have friends and family in Tucson, but tend to fly into Phoenix due to the significant difference in the cost of airfare.  I've had nothing but good experiences with Arizona Shuttle Service.  It costs me $39, which is less then the airline rates.

The shuttles arrive when they are supposed to, and I've had very little waiting.  The drivers have been nice and helpful with my luggage.  The drive is as pleasant as the I-10 corridor between Phoenix and Tucson can be.  I've used a few of the different pick up/drop off spots in Tucson, and they seem to cover the different areas around Tucson well.

I plan on using Arizona shuttle service in the future anytime I need to do the Tucson/Phoenix run.

I don't like the fact that they keep rising the prices - I mean, I understand that the price of gas has increased over the past couple of years, but $41 for a one-way trip from Phoenix to Flagstaff? Despite this, I've been taking the shuttle on and off for the past three years for its safety and convenience (it picks up and drops off at NAU and the Phoenix airport). The drivers have always been very polite and professional, though I do wish they would automatically turn up the AC for the people in the back of the van who don't have a fan pointed at them. I also appreciate the fact that the shuttles run every other hour at least and that I can book it the night before if needed. Overall, I would definitely recommend this service to anybody who may need to get to Flagstaff or Phoenix on a short notice who don't mind paying the slightly higher fee.

I took a trip in May to Phoenix and used the AZ Shuttle Service from Phoenix to Prescott. 

- Phoenix to Prescott details: 
- The shuttle was a few minutes late, but everything was well communicated. I think we ended up being about 20-30 minutes behind. 
- The van was loaded, but I still had room and was comfortable. 
- They offered water. 
- Van was clean, well maintained and comfortable. 

- Prescott to Phoenix
- On time from start to finish 
- Clean
- Fairly empty (5 people)
- Van was clean, well maintained and comfortable. 

I had a great experience. I think our driver's names were Don and Bill maybe. They were both older gents that drove safely. The customer service was great in terms of flexibility. I asked about moving around my time depending on my stay. They said just give them a call. I did and they were easy to deal with overall.

I'd use again for sure. Great service

Had to reroute from Tucson into Phoenix due to a last minute flight change and found Arizona Shuttle as a viable workaround to get quickly and cheaply to Tucson.

The service itself is about what you would expect with any shuttle service (scheduled pickup time, van trip with people, etc) and is about the same cost as other comparable options in the area, but they do have a few good value adds which is why I'm giving them 4 stars instead of the average 3. For one thing, they use a tow behind trailer to haul the luggage so it keeps the van feeling less cramped. Secondly, they try to keep the ride as comfortable as possible with cold water and a good AC running at full tilt in the vans. Finally, they do try to space people out on the van trips so there is still some room on the shuttle to stretch out after that flight. 

Overall the trip was a good experience and I would recommend using them if you need to go to another airport on short notice in AZ or get between major AZ cities quickly and in an affordable manner.

I just found a ticket to Oregon for $220.  This unbeleiveable price compared the other Phoenix airline options.  I will know be checking Alaska more often when I go out of town.  Looking forward to the trip.  Thanks Alaska for making it more affordable.
Just wanted to give a shout out to the awesome crew on our recent flight from SEA - PHX!

I really like flying Alaska Air, for a few reasons:
1) it's out of Terminal 2, which means a quick walk in/walk out, almost no wait in line, easy bag check-in and easy baggage claim.
2) I have almost always experienced pleasant stewards on all AK flights... for the most part genuinely friendly, prompt, and of good spirits
3) Alaska Air (one of my favorite aspects) is all about recycling and using local or at least AK, HI, or Pacific Northwest-based businesses for their on-board food/drinks for sale - this is such a pleasure to see and it makes me want to continue doing business with them
4) $20 baggage check-in fee... $5 cheaper than USAir.. not bad
5) When I've upgraded to First Class upon check-in in the past, it's costed me $50/leg of my itinerary - score!!

This is why I like Alaskan Air!

I used to hear that Alaska airline was good b/c they are usually on time with schedule. Maybe this is true, but gosh their customer service is horrendous. I mean I've flown a fair amount in my life. Not just in the US, but also overseas with some sketchy airlines. But by far, Alaska airlines had one of the worst customer service and did not help out a passenger. It seems as though, their company motto is "You are on your own" type of mentality. 

The problem started when I arrived 30mins prior to my flight and had already checked in online a day before. I was not checking in any bags, so all I had to do was get a reprint of my boarding pass to go through security. Too bad, nobody was a the counter to help me out and the kiosk would not let me print out my pass. So I was just sitting ducks outside the security line just watching my plane take off while I could not do anything. 

When I eventually got a hold of the customer service agent, there was no remorse. I tried to tell them that I was there 30mins early and had already checked in online a day before. Plus they didn't have ANYONE at the ticket counter. But those facts did not matter to them. They never apologized and never offered for any help. All they were busy doing was to blame me for not showing up an hour earlier. 

Well it's save to say that I will NEVER fly Alaska airlines if I could and I would never recommend this airline. Worst customer service ever.

Congratulations Alaska Airlines. After not allowing me to check in online you denied me a ticket because I was one minute past the cutoff. I fly all over the world and this happens occasionally but I have never been denied. So I will sleep in the airport tonight when a bit of caring by your personnel could have avoided this. I have flown with you whenever possible but never again.
My fault for not knowing the shuttle uses were dedicated to specific terminals

The problem my wife had was she booked a flight to Seattle using her frequent flying points.   Last week she found out she would be unable to fly to Seattle, sloshed tried to cancel her flight and get her points back, unable to do this , but for a charge of $125.00 they would be able to do it......  Such a lame excuse, why not give a credit for our next flight if you wish to keep us flying with Alaska.

We chose to fly Alaska because it is smaller, and we expected that would mean better service. Wrong. Because there is an apostrophe in my last name (think O'Brien or O'Malley) the system couldn't find our information on either end of the flight. 

Seriously? An airline reservations system that is thrown by an apostrophe?

To make matters worse, they were terribly short-staffed in our departure city (Seattle) which meant standing and waiting in a long line while they tried to fix this silly problem. 

Alaska, you can do better.

Well I have not flown Alaska for awhile but I am hoping for the best. I asked about when is the best time to request exit rows and I was told they are considered premium seats so there would be an additional charge that I could pay 24 hours prior to checkin. Really?  I volunteer to help someone in an emergency to exit and you are charging me? I guess other people don't make a fuss about paying it. My husband is tall so we always volunteer to sit there. I was told well there is more room thats why we charge extra.  I asked if I could use my Price guarantee money in the alaskan bank from this flight and was told no but I could use my points. Ok lets see if this gets any better I can only hope!
great selection.  fast check out and easy to check in.
The people, vehicles, equipment, and prices are all reasons to not look any further!

Lots of hate on yelp for this place - come on people and chill-ax. 

Check-in was a breeze, less than 5 minutes and I was on my way to the rental cars. Sure they tried to up sell a few services but a polite "no thank-you" was all it took. BTW, I get the same up sell routine at every major rent-a-car place so they are doing nothing different.

Rental Car was a Nissan Altima for $9 a day, it was clean but had a couple of scratches on it but for $9 a day I can handle the minor cosmetic blemishes. Car worked flawlessly and the AC kicked butt in the hot Arizona Summer sun. I noted the scratches and handed in the form to the check-out person and we were on our way. NOTE: This was probably the FASTEST car rental I have ever done in Phoenix (and I do a lot here)

Returns was another breeze, I didn't even get a chance to remove my luggage and the return girl handed me my receipt and said "have a nice day."

BOTTOM LINE: Super fast check-out, Super CHEAP prices, Super Fast Returns, Cars have a few more miles and some cosmetic damage that goes along with those miles but you save a bundle over the major companies. I WILL RENT AGAIN.

There's a reason this company gets 2 stars. I've rented on many occasions and have always been happy with the service, even when it comes to smaller-named companies. I was extremely upset when I felt duped being triple charged at the airport and talked to three different reps before trying to catch my flight with the first words out of their mouths being "we can't do anything for you." I've never had a car rental company tell me that. I was willing to be charged double the original quoted rate because of taxes and fees, but not triple. They upscale and pressure you like no other car company I've worked with. When I let them know I would never use this company again, they didn't seem to mind, which further shows their lack of customer service.

I would give 0 stars if I could!  I am in the process of relocating from Phoenix to Seattle and due to the last minute notice of the move, I had initially moved out to Seattle with my car a month prior and then flew back to Phoenix to pack all my belongings and officially move to Washington. I knew that I would be needing a car while in Phoenix, and was really excited about the cheap deal I had found to rent a car with advantage. When I arrived at Advantage, I was told that because my driver's license still had an address of Phoenix I needed to provide a copy of my insurance in order to rent the car, which was not possible for me to obtain because it was located in Washington.  The rental reservation had been made two week prior, and no notice of this policy had been communicated to me. I explained my situation and the service attendant apologized and said that there was nothing they could do, which left me carless and having to go to another company and pay over 5x the amount.

Took 45 minutes to rent a car with only 1 person in live ahead of us. They were too busy trying to upsell. Good for their business, bad for customers. Problems checking car back in on return. Will never rent again.

Literally just awful, so we booked this online through Expedia.com because it was the cheapest, we had never used this company before and this was our first time traveling to Colorado. 
When we booked the trip for a 2-4 mid size sedan, there was only 2 of us so there was no need for a huge car and we were taking the car 40 miles away to a wedding so we wanted a car with good gas. 
When we got into the car rental area the guy told us the only car available was a 2015 suburban.....for the 2 of us..... And then on top of it there was going to be a charge of $25 a day because we are 23 which wasn't on their website until you actually checked out. The guy also told us there would be a $200 hold on top of the actual amount. Which is fine, I get it that the $200 hold needs to be there, hotels do the same thing. He also asked if I needed insurance, well since I booked it with Expedia, Expedia asked if I wanted a $9 a day insurance on the car, so I bought it. Well when he asked if I needed insurance I said no because I already bought it. He told me that "that was through Expedia" so if that
Insurance isn't acceptable put it on the disclosure!!!!
Well When we brought back the car though the guy said the funds would be released soon and seemed frustrated with us when we said it was inconvenient  to have a car that big. 
Well we got home later that day and saw that they had charged our account the amount we owes plus the $200 holding fee! We called them to complain and they said that they sent a refund of the $200. I have never ever heard of a company actually charging the $200 "holding fee." If it's not a holding fee then don't call it that! They told us that we should see the refund immediately and that it was our banks fault. Then when we called back with our bank on the line they told us it can take a week. It's just been a ton of misinformation and not caring about customer service at all. 
I would've really appreciated an apology for all the mix ups and not just excuses. I will never use their services again.

-----this review is being posted for Greyhound Bus Lines as an entire company------

IS GREYHOUND TARGETING THE POOR BY REQUIRING GIAGANTIC FEE INCREASES FOR THOSE WHO CANNOT BOOK THEMSELVES??

Let me start by saying that I will NEVER use Greyhound  again. Never.

I had the unfortunate experience of riding Greyhound just after graduating college.  My experience was that the facilities and buses were dirty. The facility lacked adequate security.  Now I find out that they are targeting the very people that keep them in business by charging those who most need their service HUGE service fees.

My latest experience:  It was horrible.

My sister, who is staying with me while she completes testing and assessments in consideration for a liver transplant, needed to return to Yuma immediately to provide care for another family member.

Because my sister does not have checking or lines of credit, she asked me if I could book her ride for her online.  She wanted to make sure that she had a spot reserved.  I went to Greyhound.com to arrange for a ticket and transportation for my sister.  Greyhound quoted a price of $34.32 for a one way ticket. As I completed the forms online and proceeded to checkout, the cost of the ticket had changed to $52.32.  As I researched the change further, I realized that Greyhound has a policy of charging an $18.00 fee if you buy the ticket but are not the person using the ticket.  Greyhound listed the fee as a "Gift Ticket Fee."

I contacted Greyhound customer service. Based upon my conversation and the lack of English spoken by the rep, I am assuming that Greyhound has outsourced its call center function overseas.  The CSR I spoke with explained to me that the fee is a policy of Greyhound and it is charged to cover the additional costs and for convenience.  I asked him to breakdown what additional costs they were incurring?  He was unable or unwilling to justify the fee.  He kept reiterating that "this is our policy and you must pay Gift Ticket Fee."

My feeling here is the Greyhound has instituted a policy that is direct fee on the poor and indigent.  This policy has the DIRECT EFFECT of raising rates on those who can least afford it.  In my sisters case, the cost for me to book her bus fare was an INCREDIBLE 52% INCREASE over the advertised fare.

Greyhound...it is no wonder your ridership is in continual decline.  It is no wonder that your company is on shaky financial grounds.  Wake up.  Take a look at your reviews online.  Read what people are saying about you.   Your organization used to be considered an icon in the American transportation system.  Now you are looked at with despise.

One word sums this place up. GHETTO! The other reviews were right on the money. I'm not gonna lie, I was scarred! So I suggest buying your tickets ahead of time to get the best rate. I also highly suggest paying the extra 5 bucks to get priority seating and sit up front. And watch your seat- if you leave it empty, you will get jacked.
Be forewarned- people stink! Apparently other passengers don't believe in showers or deodorant. A can of Lysol may help.
I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 because the bus did arrive to destination on time both times I used the bus, and the second driver was very cool and funny.

If you don't have a deadline, and you are willing to travel lightly, and you don't mind being stuck in the middle of nowhere in the middle of the night, and are willing to put up with a nonchalant attitude about your travel, and you are given a claim check for your bags but no one actually checks your ticket, and buses are way over-used and under-cleaned, and the terminals have limited options for eating even when there are long delays/layovers, and your bags are just out there where anyone can take them, and Customer Service is at a bare minimum or non-existent and  . . . . I actually can think of nothing good about my last trip on Greyhound. And it will be my last . . . 

Where's the Customer Service that makes a business one that you want to return to time and time again? 

Cheaper than an airline ticket . . . but my advice is stay home or walk to your destination. Definitely not worth the hassle.

I found myself testing the Greyhound Bus system after being unable to catch a flight. Ugh!  Tucson to Phoenix to LA. Here are the highlights. 

Bus departed over an hour late. 
Bus was filthy. 
Entire bus smelled like a porta potty. 
Bathroom door broken. No privacy. Filthy. 
Driver jerked the bus all over the road. No, this isn't a sports car pal. 
Two segments required two coupons. They only gave me one. Then later asked for the other. Charged me an extra $5 because they erred and needed to print a 2nd one.
I'm uploading 2 photos of my view of the graffitied seat-back forward of me. 
Passengers weren't too scary. Borderline/Marginally okay. 
AC worked.
Did I say the bus stunk?  Can't underscore that enough. 

Will I repeat my patronage?  Only if exceedingly desperate.
I will not recommend. I will discourage others. 
I would not allow a loved one on those busses. 
An embarrassment of the Free Enterprise system.

the fist time ever ridding a bus......st Los Angeles statio where i was leaving from was great. But when i arrived to phoenix i had the most horrible experience. The lady name Elsa or some thing like that was ordering  tacos while i was in front of her face. I was tiring to get  to Tucson Arizona i just wanted to buy a ticket and the lady did not listen she was really rude.... not riding grey hound ever in my life again the bus was nasty, smelled bad, to crowded, loud ,GHETTO.

They overbooked and I had to wait hours for the next bus with no ticket voucher. and absolutely no help from Kim the employee in the red shirt. terrible customer service. I strongly encourage all of you to choose different bus companies

If I could give this company a minus -5000 I would.. you can never talk to a real person....you get transferred from automated person to automated person to Pakistan and back..if you call the bus terminal in phoenix...you get a Spanish automated system..then when you press the appropriate  number it just rings and rings and then says goodbye..i even called the bus station in Las Vegas and nobody answered there either....the busses were late causing my daughter to miss her connecting buss.causing her to have to wsit 5 more hours ...just a complete horrible experience....the itinerary on the eticket was wrong...the ticket did not show where she was being let out at...which terminal in phoenix....this company is ridiculous....super cheap..horrible to deal with..impossible to talk to....and when you do get to talk to somebody they have no  clue where is anything in the United states because they've never been here....absolutely a joke...my jack Russell could run this company better than who ever is running it now....they should change the name to old broken down stupid perro....
Greyhound.??????.even their mobile app doesn't work..and God forbid you screw up buying the ticket cause it's gonna cost ya..stay away from this company at all costs.
Worst greyhound yet. Horrid front desk people that feel so negatively they bring it to others
DO NOT USE GREYHOUND!! NOT EVEN AS LAST RESORT.! They will sell you the ticket and the bus will get full and you will have to wait HOURS for the next bus.
My bus is over four hours late and I'm so livid right now. They won't give me a refund because I don't have my receipt even though my name is on my ticket and I have my id.

There are so many negative reviews for this bus line and they are probably justified.  Just keep in mind that these buses are going to be late and the stuff at the bus station will be not helpful. So if you're on a flexible schedule then this might be a good option, if you're expecting a good quality service on time this is not the bus line to go with.

The absolute worst! The busses are always late, and rarely working. The seats are narrow and uncomfortable, and the staff is rude and unprofessional. These busses would be outdated and unacceptable in the 1960's, which incidentally is when they were made. Avoid greyhound if you can. It's a literal shit show, especially if you're near the bathroom on the bus.

Twice now AAA has left me hanging for airport rides. 

The first time their driver showed up 15 minutes early--I asked him to wait while I finished getting ready.  When I came out ten minutes later, he had already left.  I was forced to drive myself and pay for $20/day airport parking.

The second time I get a phone call 40 minutes before my scheduled pick up time.  I told the operator my scheduled pick-up time and was told a cab would be there.   No one shows up.  I call and ask for an ETA, I'm told someone will be there shortly.  Ten minutes later, I call again.  Same thing.  Ten minutes after that, I call a third time.  Same thing.   After another ten minutes, I finally decide to drive myself.  Out of a sense of courtesy I call to cancel the pickup.  The operator tells me the cab is only 10 minutes away!  Only 10 minutes?!  I was already 30 minutes late!  Again, I paid $20/day for airport parking.

Never again.

A couple of weeks ago I needed a ride to the airport from my home.  I called the night before and set it up.  The car was on time at my home, but it was an old dirty cab, looked like the guy lived in there and it smelled like it too.  When I returned home I walked out of terminal four and got a ride again from this company. This time it was a New cab, clean exterior and interior, courteous driver, right price.  It was about $14 to the airport and $16 back home due to the driver thinking I wasn't from here and I had to remind him of a more expedient (cheaper) route.

2 stars for the ride to the airport
3 stars for the ride from the airport

This company is terrible. I called them in the morning and asked them to pick me up at 1:45 pm. They arrived at 1:35 but I was in a meeting so by the time I got outside at 1:45, they had left. I called them to let them know I still needed a cab and they said that someone was 2-3 minutes away. 10 minutes later, the driver called to let me know he was 2-3 minutes away. 15 minutes after that he still hadn't shown up so I managed to hail a different cab and I got to the airport just in time to catch my flight.

This company is not dependable and I would highly recommend using a different one if you want to make sure you're picked up.

Not entirely sure how I end up using AAA Cab. I think one night, I programmed the number into my phone because it was the first number I saw.

Service isn't as bad as everyone says. I've had them take me home from bars or friend's homes. They are usually pretty prompt, and if you find yourself in a condo complex, you can count on the driver to knock on the door, so you don't have to worry about going outside at 2AM in a complex you are unfamiliar with.

I'd never use these guys to go to the airport or anything. SuperShuttle is around for that, but in a pinch, AAA has always been around to give me a ride.

Seems like almost every cab has a credit card machine too. $10 Minimum.

on 8/16/11 at 7:45 PM I took cab 142 from the airport to my residence.  I entered the cab the driver asked where I wanted to go.  I explained to my residence, but that it would be best if I driected him along the way.  I said "best to take 202 off at Priest to Galvin up Galvin to McDowell."  He said, "OH a Short Fare!"  I said "Excuse me? I always make the minimum as stated on your window and if my money is not good in your cab, you can let me out and I will be happy to take another vehicle?"  He mumbled under his breath..I expalined that I take a cab weekly to and from the airport and that I am more than happy to find someone else...He said, "It must cost you a lot of money to take cabs you should drive."  I arrived home, had to get my own bags out of the vehicle and I called your dispatch to complain.  I was told Managers were not in, however that someone would contact me on 8/17/11 in the morning.  I have not received a call.  I called back to dispatch asking to speak with the supervisor and the gentleman on the phone said "If you didn't hear back, its because we are too busy."  I asked to speak to anyone else, he said "They are too busy to talk to you."  I said I would be happy to hold.  He placed me on hold and after a few minutes I found that AAA Cab has a comment section on their website and decided to contact them there instead.  If you have issues with them I highly suggest that you complain as well.  Had I been a visitor to the area this would have been one of my first encounters with a service in the area.  Not a sparkling review by any means.  If you have a chance to take a different cab I would suggest that you do so.  I use Clean Aire Cab frequently and adore them!  Unfortunately, they are not allowed to pick up from the airport which keeps horrible companies like this in business!

Let's see! Where do I start? I work for an Urgent care and am not the customer but here is my story. The doctors office across the way brought the customer over at 5:30pm seeing as the close at 5pm and we are open until 7pm. So the customer is patiently waiting in out lobby. at 5:45 she called  the transportation company to get an updated ETA. She was told 45 min. She continued to patiently wait knowing we were open until 7pm and should have plenty of time. By 7pm, I start talking to her to find out if she had an idea of when AAA cab would arrive. She started talking to me about the whole scenario. She said she called earlier in the day for her ride to her Dr.'s appointment and they were extremely late picking her up. She said she had called around 4:30pm for her ride home and was given a 45 min ETA. So I asked if she wouldn't mind me calling on her behalf. I called the transport company who told us 5 min, that was at 7:22pm. I called the transportation company back 10 min later and by 7:57pm was told that they couldn't give an ETA and that they had lost control. Needless to say the transportation company had to assign another company. Meanwhile the patient has waited as long as she has and because it is 110+ degrees outside my coworkers and I waited with her. After 12 hour shifts and the pt's long day, we are all still waiting for a ride at 8:30 pm. No one should ever have that much run around. Worst service I have ever heard of and experienced in my life!

Should be no stars but had to give something in order to post.

Yes, this is the hotel from those commercials where the guy does something like oh I don't know perform open heart surgery and when asked if he's a real surgeon, says,"no, but I did stay at a Holiday Inn Express last night." Har har! What delightfully witty banter.

That commercial encompasses the vibe you get when you stay here. The HIE is always ready to remind you how Smart you are for staying here. In fact, everything in the room from the pillows to the shower curtain to the bars of soap all incorporate the Smart "theme" in their branding.

Since my company pays for my trips to Phoenix, I can't comment on the value of the hotel, but I can speak to the experience. For such a SmartHotel, the room layouts are inefficient. the bathroom counter (completely covered in little pamphlets advertising the smartness of the various items strewn about the room) is massive while the main room (a combination bedroom, office, lounge, dining room, etc) is an ergonomic nightmare.

For instance, once I removed the 17 pamphlets from the SmartDesk, I realized that the SmartLamp and the SmartPhone left little room for my laptop and mouse.

I then picked up the crusty staticky SmartPhone, ordered SmartRoomService (which comes from the Hilton Garden Inn kitchen next door), and upon the meal's arrival had to remove my laptop from the SmartDesk, since it's the only thing which remotely resembles a SmartTable.

I then turned on the SmartTV, A boxy Zenith CRT circa 1956, and ordered a SmartMovie, presented only in full-screen for $11.99+tax. After several attempts at setting the SmartAlarm, I just called the front desk on the SmartPhone, also circa 1956. Are you noticing a trend here? The same crappy, out-of-date appliance as any other Holiday Inn but with the word 'Smart' slapped across it and a pamphlet resting atop the closest hard surface, boasting how clever the aforementioned appliance is and how Smart you are for staying in a hotel that contains such a Smart appliance.

Okay, on the good side, The SmartStaff was very friendly and accommodating and provided me with complimentary SmartToiletries I has taken from me by airport security. They were also kind enough to remove a SmartMovie charge on my bill from when I accidentally ordered some SmartCrappyMovie on Pay-Per-View.

The complimentary SmartBreakfast provided me with plenty of healthy and tasty options. The SmartCoffee was adequate. If you were Smart enough to read through this entire SmartReview, but you think my constant use of 'Smart' before every other word seems annoying, then you now know what it's like to stay at a HIE.

Great place!  Very comfortable bed, perfect amenities for a quick business trip.  I got in late, was able to eat dinner, use free wifi and get a good nights rest in a very nice bed.  I then woke up, did a quick workout in the gym, continued working, used the business center to print everything out, and helped myself to a very good breakfast and coffee before hitting the road.  

It was EXACTLY what I needed, priced very reasonably.

I stayed here for 2 nights and felt it was not worth the money (over 200 dollars). The breakfast was decent, the room was okay, but like I said, for that kind of money, I expect top notch customer service and unfortunately, that was not the case.

The customer service was okay and the guy at the front desk seemed to be in too much of a hurry to answer my questions properly. I felt I was being brushed off. Secondly, the wi-fi had some problems at this hotel. Although it was supposed to be high speed, it was barely that and on top of that, I had trouble connecting each time I tried to connect and it took a few attempts each time to establish and maintain a steady connection.

Too pricey for the kind of service they offer!

We used the Driver Provider to help transport over 100 of our wedding guests to our rehearsal dinner and it was an absolutely terrific experience. Not only were their rates very affordable but the the customer service was superb and the driver was very personable and accommodating (please forgive me as I forgot his name) We will definitely be sure to use the Driver Provider in the future for any transportation needs we have and I recommend you do so as well.

The staff here were friendly and I received my room in great condition and everything worked fine.  My stay would have been very positive here had it not been for the erroneous charges on my credit card.  After contacting the Area Operations Manager for HSD Tempe Airport-ESA Phoenix Airport Extended Stay about this charge, the problem still wasn't solved.  I later emailed the corporate office on Extended Stay's website.  I never received any type of response back concerning the bogus charge.  To add insult to injury, they signed my email address up to their mailing list, and now I'm receiving spam from Extended Stay in my inbox.  I will never stay at an Extended Stay again, and will tell my friends to stay clear.  Completely disgusted about getting ripped off $24+.

*UPDATE*

I was finally refunded my $24+, but it took an act of congress for it to happen.  Shame on you Extended Stay!
It was decent for the price - it was cheap, but clean and quiet.  Travis at the front desk was quite helpful and understanding of our unique situation.

Disappointed for a Hilton. While room was large and spacious, bathrooms were dated. I can hear every move the people upstairs make since they checked in around 130am and then unpacked for 30 minutes. Air is loud and noisy as well. Just disappointed....

Very nice HGI. We stayed here on two different occasions, and the service, breakfast and rooms were all very pleasing. Very close to the airport, and there's a Waffle House right next door. But try the breakfast here, because Raoul can really make an omelette.

Clean and comfortable. Nice hot breakfast available - eggs, bacon, oatmeal, fruit, pancakes, cinnamon rolls, yogurt, biscuits and gravy. Also has a small (somewhat dated) exercise facility and outdoor pool.

AC made some screeching noises at night that woke me up. Otherwise a nice stay.  

Shuttle to airport was handy.

I stayed here for 2 weeks on business last year, and during that time, I got to know the staff quite well. They really do their best to make your stay comfortable and easy. The breakfast team is really sweet and they're able to start your day off right with an excellent meal and a nice conversation. Only wish the breakfast was complimentary. I think it runs for 12 or 13 dollars. Definitely high for the daily omelette, bowl of fruit, and small bran muffin I chose. When I returned from work around 5:00, I immediately went to the restaurant, where they have truly delicious food, whether it's a steak or a burger. The main bartender, Adam, is a great conversationalist and provides true customer service. Prices are okay. Not great, but not that high either. The front desk staff were also really helpful in giving me directions, holding onto my luggage for the day, and accommodating my late arrival/departure. The shuttle drivers are also really courteous and nice. If I'm ever in the Phoenix area again, I would choose to stay here without question.

Back in January I submitted a survey in regards to the hotel located at 
14245 S 50th St, Phoenix, AZ 85044 (480) 785-0464

the manger Nikki the manager emailed me and requested additional information which I provided and  it turns out that management was just as rude as the rest of the other employees.

She NEVER bother to acknowledge my message and I know for a I fact she got them because I CC me on the original email and I received it. 

The employees there are rude and condescending with the exception of Jason who was very nice to us.



Two employed that I find unprofessional, unfriendly and plain rude. They were snappy, condescending and they have a way to belittle you with their words. 

Iris was one of them. She gave me attitude whenever I requested fresh linen. In one occasion she had the audacity to question me on why was I requesting clean sheets.. She said " didn't you get house keeping yesterday ?" And I had to explain to her that my one year old son have had an accident on them and that they were wet. I had to explain my self in front of other guest and that was so embarrassing. Iris is rather pushy, not a good quality for a customer service job. 
Also during my three week stay twice I had to demand that she sent the house keeper over to my room to clean it ,  Iris kept making excuses on why the maid was not able to make it to my room on my scheduled day etc.. In addition to the above, two different occasions Iris informed me that this establishment had run of toilet paper and Kleenex , which I find impossible to believe as i requested it them in two different weeks and I know you are not going to rent the rooms to new guest with out toiletries. I honestly had to start buying my own as I did not want to deal with her poor attitude, But my discomfort comes mainly from the fact that your website advertises free toiletries and the house keeper did NOT provide me with any the two times she cleaned my room. Also one time she asked me twice to wait a minute because she had to look at her cell phone.. Even  as I was about to check out I called Iris and asked if the front desk would have any empty boxes, Iris promised to check and call me back but I never heard from her. 

The other employee is Stephanie.

Stephanie doesn't not make eye contact and she stares at the computer while you try to communicate with her.. .. She is very unfriendly and She also refused to provide me with toilet paper and further more when I called her to inform her that my toilet was clogged , she told me to come and get a plunger so I can fix the issue my own self . 
Also I asked her if I can have extra shampoo because I was out and she replied that the room should have had some when I checked in... Again I was not aware that this hotel only provides toiletries and shampoo once.. 

I also over heard a personal conversation she was having with one of the maids.. As I stated before.. So unprofessional.

This was the worst experience ever had and therefore I decided to cut short my stay, I  will not be returning to this establishment not I will recommend it. 
This was not a stay away from home for me.. I should not have to argue with the employees for basic things that are included in the price I am paying. 

Lastly , I contacted the front desk four times to notify them that the kitchen sink was not draining properly, and nothing got ever done ....

I don't feel I got my money's worth and I tried to stay as long as I could, but the service was just terrible..

I would like to be contacted by your manager so I can express my distrust action and I truly hope I get another survey so I can provide the names of these rude employees.

Many Holiday inn Express hotels are very similar. After ten years getting a little tired and in need of some updating.  This one has just been through an update and it was nice and the price was right.

Good beds and linens, free Wi Fi, and a really nice well stocked breakfast with OK coffee.

The missing star is for no cold water - plenty of hot water but in my room all the water ran hot.  Is that because Phoenix such a ridiculously hot hell hole?

Mid-June, 2011:  I like to stay at the Holiday Inn Express whenever I can find one.  I appreciate the consistency of the rooms, breakfasts, and wifi.  I've always found the staff helpful and friendly, regardless of the location.

Be aware, however, that price is not one of the consistencies; and the location often dictates what the price will be, which I guess makes sense ; )

I always stay at this location when visiting the Phoenix area. 
It is accessible to the freeways and has a Cracker Barrel within walking distance from the hotel. As well as local eats and entertainment within a couple of minutes. 
The accommodations have always been great. 
The rooms clean, modern, and well kept. 
A breakfast buffet in the mornings and courteous staff. 
The pool is nice as well. 
The price is always reasonable as well.  
It's a main stay until I can relocate back to the area.

Nice hotel with friendly staff. However, the wifi is very unreliable. I've stayed here over 30 days and the wifi frequently just stops working and will not work for hours at a time. The internet has been down all day today and will not be back up until tomorrow supposedly. I will go to another hotel  tomorrow morning as reliable & fast internet is the single most important item when choosing my hotel stays. I have 29 days left on my reservation, this hotel will loose a month of my business due to unreliable internet. I would hope a manager reads this and realizes the importance of reliable internet to their customers...if they even care. 

A small investment in quality networking gear would keep me coming back. I stay at hotels for months at a time but will not be returning to this one even though it's close to where I'm working. I would have given this hotel 5 stars had they maintained their internet properly. So if you don't care about internet, this is a nice hotel.

Great little hotel "Inn" with all you need. Our AC went out and we needed a place to bring the family and pets. They have comfortable beds, new carpeting, flat screen TV, gym, pool and a decent breakfast of cereal, hard boiled eggs, yogurt, muffins, toast, bagels, and a waffle station. Coffee, tea, and juices too. I would have given a 4 stars because the elevator needed a good wipe down or refinish and our bathroom floor looked like it needed a DEEP grout cleaning. The 5th star was earned by the perfect for the price and the friendly staff at the front desk.

I had an excellent experience at this hotel.

After unpacking and settling in, we realized our TV does not work. It's plugged in, power light is on, the remote light comes on when you click a button, but nothing happens. Nada. Called front desk to notify them of the problem, and Chuck at the front desk walked us through the usual diagnostic steps over the phone with no luck.

Chuck offered to come by our room with another remote to help troubleshoot. Still nothing. Mystified, Chuck apologized for the inconvenience and immediately offered us either a discount or to switch rooms. We decided to switch rooms as we really wanted needed a shared screen on one of our laptops. 

Afterwards, we learned that Chuck was actually at the end of his shift and was about to head home for the night when we called, but showed no signs of impatience whatsoever and provided excellent customer service to us throughout. 

I don't expect everything to be perfect, but I certainly appreciate the customer oriented focus and willingness to go above and beyond to make sure our stay is as pleasant as possible.

Keep up the great work!

I spent every minute til check out in my room at this hotel. Taking off a star because of 72 degree preset air conditioning, doesn't quite work for 50 yr old woman in Phoenix! Staff was excellent as all La Quintas have been so far and the bed was amazing! King size and the room was large. Very clean and modern.

I try to always stay at La Quinta when on business trips. Price is great, suites for the cost of standard rooms in other approved hotels. Since these are independently owned they are not always the same quality. This location is one of the best. Staff is nice, rooms are nice, and it is in a good location.

This place is HUGGEEEEEE. You can seriously get lost in this resort.  I think there are about six pools here, and one huge pool area called the Oasis where there is a "moat" leading to a fake beach area. I will probably have to hike a mile to get there (which is fine, I got my pedometer on!) but I don't have the time to check it out yet. Trying to get to ONE of the pools close to you can be quite confusing. Doors are locked, gates are closed, and signs saying "GO THROUGH THE GATE" leaves you walking around the pool area trying to open every gate that has locks that I am not used to. Minus one star for this inconvenience.

Otherwise, this resort is really cool! My suite is big with two sink areas, a living room, two TVs, a nice clean bathroom, and comfortable beds. I am here for school this week so this was a really nice setup. Plus I get free access to the Waterpark the entire week. Haven't checked out the restaurants (probably won't this time around) because I will be hitting up Fleming's and Cowboy Ciao, two of my fav places. Plus, Latitude 30 which is located onsite is an Asian fusion restaurant - my fear? Bland expensive food. And I can't find ratings for the restaurant either. 

Anyway, this place is cool. There is also another grill onsite, and the golf course to the left of it. Huge place!

My husband's company held its annual meeting here this year.  Kind of unfortunate for us considering we live here now but its nice to spend a night away in a resort.  I'm giving it 4 stars but it really should be 3.5.  Its just above average.

And this is quite a resort.  I am personally not a fan of the mega huge family resort; mainly because its so hard to find your way around and it takes forever to get from point A to point B.  When its 115 degrees out these walks are particularly trying.  

Checking into the resort left less than a favorable impression on me.  I was laden with a heavy suitcase, laptop bag, as well as my husband's suit and my dress.  After I helped other guests sort out the line situation (seriously, why would you stand around in a huge crowd? Form a line!)  I asked the desk attendant to call a bell hop to take my bags to my room because it was a considerable walk away.  "Oh, you can just go down that flight of stairs out to where the valet is and find a bell hop."  Hmm, ok, no.  If I wasn't laden down with bags perhaps I could walk down the steps but I have all this heavy stuff which is why I asked for the bell hop in the first place!  How does a front desk not call a bell hop for you?!  As I later found out I was supposed to receive a welcoming package from my husband's company that the front desk failed to give me.  Stellar.

Our room was nice and large; they are all suites.  The room service menu has to be the most reasonably priced room service menu ever.  Some of the items were cheaper via room service than in the restaurants!  Our room overlooked an "adult pool" that had kids swimming in it.  This really grinds my gears...especially when the resort has a waterpark!  The waterpark is an experience....there are kids everywhere, three slides, a lazy river, and a wave pool.  Its all on a small scale.  They have two restaurants at the "Oasis" which both serve the same menu.  At night when the slides close they show a movie over the wave pool area.  

The formal events (dinner and receptions) that we attended were well done, the food was good in all instances.  The bartenders were very nice and quickly learned the drinks we were ordering.  

Would I stay here again?  No, not if it wasn't for a business event.  Would I suggest it to friends visiting?  No.  Its not really in an easy location and with all the options available in the Valley I wouldn't consider this to be at the top.

This place is truly a "compound," with multiple buildings of hotel room suites, 6 pools, a few restaurants, and an entire waterpark.  It takes a lot of walking to get around, but if you can find your way back to the main lobby, they will shuttle or golf cart you wherever you'd like to go.  The staff is friendly  and they have big baskets of lollipops in the lobby, which was cute.

My suite was bigger than some apartments I've lived in for years.  It was clean, quiet, and nicely appointed.  It did smell of smoke, but didn't keep me from sleeping soundly or enjoying my time there.  My work pals tell me that local families stay here sometimes just to use the waterpark.  Sounds like fun to me!

How in the world is this place a preferred property on our corporate travel site?  Two theories: either our company had its sales meeting here within the last 5 years and negotiated the sweet rate (which is possible, since it's our brand of paper products in the bathrooms), or it was August and no one goes to the Arizona resorts in August due to the heat and/or potential for monsoon weather.
