Next we went to the water park.  It was packed as bad as Wet n Wild if not worse.  I was hoping a hotel water park if smaller would be nicer than the local water parks.  After an hour we headed back to the room.

We had planned to order room service and relax but really there was nothing appealing about hanging around the room which was nothing special and had the aforementioned crummy view.  

I was then we decided to go home.  No reason to waste more money and hang around in the room.  We checked in at 4:30 and left at 7:30.

We had a great time...I just wish they had a microwave in the rooms...The food was over priced at the Osasis water park which is attached to the hotel. French fries $8 buffalo wings $19.00 ridiculously priced we ate at restaurants outside of the resort

The staff was pleasant and friendly, the "water park" was just enough for our four kids (ages 4,6,7,8). It's nice to feel as if you're actually on vacation even though you're essentially downtown. We reside in Arizona so this was a decent stay-cation. Having the park right outside our Villa was pleasant and the children enjoyed seeing it from the balconies. The poolside food, while exorbitantly priced, was quick and made everyone happy. It is a resort, you have to expect the high prices. 

The rooms were spacious; even if the decor was dated. I agree with many others, they need a major overhaul and deep cleaning. 

For the downside that will probably prevent us from returning. The first day we arrived, walked into our room and a cockroach was in the master suit. I only wish I had taken a picture. It was 3 inches or so long. Called the person in charge of room service and she sort of laughed about it, but sent someone to spray quickly. Brushing that off, we went to the pools and spent a few hours out. Came back to shower and get ready for dinner, the shower in the master didn't work. I was done after that. $600 a night for a Villa; I shouldn't have ANY issues. I went to the front desk requested the manager. He listened to my complaints and was generally respectable and hospitable to me. He waived the resort fees and gave us a meal voucher, while sending someone to fix the shower right away. We haven't had any issues since. 

While we had the rooms booked through Saturday, we decided that is far to long and are leaving Friday. Two days is plenty. 

Yes, it is insanely expensive; but it is a resort. You are paying for the resort style stay. It is not the hotel down the street with a tiny pool out back.

Came here for the "water park".  3 slides, a lazy river and a wave pool don't count as a "water park" in my book.  Asked for them to remove items from the mini bar to make room for baby food.  They wanted to charge $35 for this "service".  I have never been charged for this and we have stayed in several hotels from 3 to 5 stars.  For the price that they charge and the resort fee, I don't like to get nickel and dimed for every little thing.

Stayed a night at the resort which we purchased through a 3rd party.  Upon spending our time there, I would not have gone if it had not been purchased through a special a 3rd party had given.  I give the three stars for the rooms being nicely furnished and the staff being A+.  

The waterpark was a blast for the kids. But the resort fee for the waterpark I felt would have been too high [had it not been covered the special]. In addition, they will not allow you to bring in any drink or food into the waterpark that was not purchased from their resort.  Not even a bottle of water.  They check your bags before going into the waterpark area, as I witnessed a family entering the waterpark ahead of us and they made them take their bottled waters out of their carrying bag.   Really?  Come on people!  Instead, on their lounge chairs, they have their own menu for you to order from. 

Also, the cost of the food was absolutely outrageous. My husband took our two grandchildren, ages 4 & 7 for breakfast. The breakfast we had consisted of the two grandkids ordering off the kids menu, my husband had a cup of coffee and French toast, and I had a yogurt parfait and a cup of tea.  The tab came to $63.00.  $63.00!!!!  Are you freakin' kidding me?  Do not eat at the hotel unless money is not an issue for you.  Otherwise, there are plenty of nearby restaurants for breakfast [such as the Waffle House] and many nearby restaurants for dinner since a very large mall is just down the street.

I would go back again, but only through a special and just not eat at the resort.

The prices this resort charges are outrageous!  I got the travel zoo voucher for $100 a night and knew we would be paying the extra $47 resort fee per night. This was for off season.  Upon checkout I learned that they charge another $25 suite tax and $5.77 mystery tax so my $150 night stay then became $180 --which I would never had booked if I had known it would be that much.  The resort is nice and the water park fun but I don't think I will ever be going back for another staycation here.  The taxes are way higher than other hotels in the area.

We are extremely disappointed with our stay at AZ grand. Rooms were acceptable but small. Only one TV of the two worked. No microwave and the fridge was stocked with obscenely expensive drinks and snacks.
Checkin was slow but since there was a line it's expected to wait our turn. We were handed a map with brief explanation how to find our room. 20 minutes later we finally found a maid, who apparently didn't speak English, but did direct us to our room. Great! But.......maybe not as one key card didn't work at all and at times it took 3 "Hail Mary's " for the other to work!.
The water park was so crowded it was not enjoyable. Again, expensive drinks and food. Attendants were marginally helpful and unfriendly. Sunset brought poorly lighted areas to walk to or from rooms.
We did get great rates since we were part of a wedding party but the extras made up some of the difference. So.....I can say, never again!

My husband and I got married here it was beautiful customer service was amazing they made our wedding everything we wanted it to be and more gave our guests a great room rate the good was amazing we couldn't be happier!

My second time staying here and had a blast again!  My kids love the water park! It's a little pricey but worth it for the memories,  besides its not an everyday trip kind of place.  

Got here at 12, 1 of our rooms was ready the other wasn't, so they brought the keys to the other room once it was.

The gentleman at the front desk was friendly and helpful, as it seems all their staff is!  My family had a wonderful time and we WILL be returning! 

Cons: Oasis water park is very expensive and you can only bring in water. Also for adults, you cannot have your adult beverages in the water (which if paying 11 dollars for my drink, I should be able to chill in the water with it on a 108 degree day...)

Pros: just about everything else!

Stayed three times.  Water park is great and our most recent room was very clean and remodeled.  The bellman was very professional and well dressed.  He drove us to our room and then to water park.  The only negative was the hotel check in line, it took me 55 minutes to get our room key with only three clerks working the check in desk on a busy summer Saturday??!!  My kids were miserable waiting an hour with no where to sit, stand or hangout.

Stayed here over a recent extended weekend with the family and had a wonderful time.  The property is truly beautiful; the rooms were clean with soundproof walls; the beds were comfy; the Oasis water park and other on-site pools were superfun; and with the exception of a newer (young female) desk employee in the spa, the service we rec'd from everyone on staff was top notch.  

The Oasis water park was so much fun!  Loved the slides and Lazy River. My family had a blast playing water volleyball and basketball in a pool adjacent to the wave pool.  So many pool possibilities.  Not crowded on a Friday and a relief in the 108-115 degree heat.  

We enjoyed breakfasts and a room-service/late night dinner from the lobby restaurant, as well as desserts and drinks in the lobby bar.  All times, we rec'd great quality food and presentation.  The entire wait staff was wonderful, as well. While we didn't get a chance to check out the on-property steakhouse (Rustler's Roost), we did have dinner at the on-property Mexican restaurant (Aunt Chilada's) one evening.  It is similar to an El Torito's or Chevy's franchise restaurant - not bad, but not great either.

The reason I'm not giving full, 5 star status is due to an issue we experienced relating to a lack of time management and customer service at the spa with coordinating multiple spa packages.  While the services themselves were wonderful, there was confusion and a lack of coordination, as well as incorrect times given for our party of 4.  Needless to say, it didn't lend to the stress-free environment we were hoping for.  It also didn't help that a newer female desk employee was terse, snitty, and not exactly customer-friendly to my husband (who was celebrating his birthday that day) over the phone when he called down to verify spa appointments - especially since spa staff never contacted us with verification of our services. 

On-site costs for services, meals, and sundries/goods are understandably pricey (you're paying for convenience), however they were comparable to other resorts we've stayed at.  The overall value for a family of four staying in two separate/adjoining suites - including roundtrip airfare from CA and a rental car - was affordable and reasonable for our middle-class budget.  The $47/day resort fee was expected and also reasonable.  It included passes for the Oasis water park as well as access to all property pools, the spa, the athletic club, and adjacent hiking trails.  It also included on-site parking and WiFi which - contrary to others' experience on here - was decent.

All-in-all, I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a fun family weekend, romantic getaway, 'staycation', or girl's weekend.  We will be back the next time we're in town.
Recently rented a car from Enterprise and had great service.  The car was ready, clean and the staff was great!

You need to make it super clear if you are just a person with bad credit. Lots of drug addicts and hard core alcoholics live here. The people who work here are used to dealing with people like that. If you have any major necessary repairs that need to be made you will probably have to speak with the district manager- or perhaps the better business bureau. Way over priced for such poor quality. I won't even do my laundry in the laundry room because it has no a.c. at all. I go to the cleaners for a wash and fold. They are supposed to do criminal background checks..not sure they actually do that. I'm amazed that the owner has not been fined our sued yet.

Stayed here June 2009. Property was clean and well maintained. The front desk staff was friendly and even called 10 minutes after I got to my room to check to see if I was happy with the room. The room was definitely large and comfortable. The hotel is close to the freeways and it is easy to get around the city.

As a local resident of Chandler, AZ...we had to choose this hotel one night when our A/C went out. We have known about Dobson Ranch Inn for years and always viewed it as a really nice hotel.  

After staying here I would say it's "just okay".  Check in was very fast. I guess it helps if you've already pre-paid via hotels.com.  We were given an upstairs room for just two of us. I would have preferred a downstairs room to save on having to climb the stairs. It seemed like a slow night, so I'm not sure why we got stuck upstairs.  

The room was okay...nothing spectacular. I've seen better in a non-resort room. Oh and why does this hotel claim to be a resort. I didn't find anything resort like about it? Bathroom had a slight funky odor of musty, mildewy, could be urine smell about it. I was not liking that too much.  Central air was just okay....seemed to take a while to cool the room off.

There was no indication in any of the hotel literature that there was any internet access via your room. I ended up having to call the front desk where he informed me that the little box under the alarm is a cable modem and you have to plug it in. Kind of old school I thought, and they should probably upgrade to wireless access.

One thing that I thought was kind of weird is that there was a bag of grocery store bought grapes and a full beer sitting on the steps leading up to our room.  We figured either someone had been sitting there eating/drinking or they dropped them there and forgot about it. At any rate, I had seen several employees walking around both the night of and the morning of our stay and when we got up to go to breakfast around 9:30 am that stuff was still sitting there and attracting bugs and flies. Hmmm. I probably would not book a room here again or tell my family to stay there unless the price was REALLY good.

Stay away!  This place is awful.  We came home from a camping trip to the A/C being out and not being able to stay in our home, so we came here for a night.  The room smelled stale and gross, and was poorly lit.  We could not control the temperature in the room and I doubt it cooled off below 85 degrees in there (not much of an improvement to the house!).  There were 2 queen beds and we requested a roll-away since we were there with our three children.  Knowing that we had 5 people in our party, we were still only provided with 3 towels and 2 washcloths in the room.  The décor, the furniture and the paint are all in SEVERE need of an update.
My husband and I thought we'd go down to the pool to help cool off.  WRONG!  the pool area was filthy dirty.  There were dirty pool towels laying about, but no clean pool towels available for us to use.  The pool had some sort of film over it and the water was filled with all sorts of "floaties."  The bottom of the pool was also filthy.  We tried to stick our feet in the hot tub instead, but that was also equally filthy.  The grounds were poorly kept, the trees and shrubs appear to be dying and no one has swept any of the walkways for what appears to be months.  This morning, the "free" breakfast was burnt, dried out sausage patties, completely undercooked eggs, and stale potatoes.  Went to work this morning hungry, exhausted, and extremely disappointed.  Would never stay here again and would not recommend anyone else say here either.  Filthy, old, unkempt mess.
We checked out as soon as we saw our room. Decided that it wasn't the right place for our family after my 16mo old daughter smashed a bug on the wall.
used to b awesome now just ghetto.. bedbugs.. mold.. IT issues.. no help...stay in your car!

Never ever would I recommend anyone to stay at this filthy, bug ridden, terrible place.
I am not a hotel snob by any stretch but this place is crap, even for $50 a night.
Roaches, crickets and some small black bugs that I did not know what they were.
Had to switch rooms because the a/c went out.
Then the water went out. no water for 6 hours. Then the a/c went out in our new room.
Then the hot water went out and I could not get anyone over to look at it.
The maintenance man was rude to my wife and that was the last straw, we left and I got a refund for the remaining time.
They should not call this a Ramada because it's false advertising.
The place needs to be torn down and new buildings put up.
I will be calling corporate and letting them know!

I have looked over all if the reviews on this property. I had several social events at this property and had worked closely with the catering and management staff. I can understand how most of the reviewers felt about this hotel. I saw it first had and have never witnessed such incompetence as this operation. There is zero customer service. They nearly destroyed one ignore events by making a last minute change to our venue by putting us the bar area and giving away the ballroom to a last minute party. They excuse was they didn't know that the other party was already booked prior to my event. After doing some investigative work found that the group that got he ballroom booked it a week before my event. Even though I had a contract booked 9 months in advance. The rooms were dirty and a lot of the property was need if maintenance. I have watched this  property go from a  beautiful in town  resort over 20 years ago decline into a poor example of a hotel. The management staff appeared to go out if their way to irritate the guests. Until they get a customer oriented staff and clean up up this mess they can be any hotel chain they want it will not change the reviews their getting on Yelp.

Staff was of poor quality. Even manager was of no help.  Brought in two forms of id along with two utility bills.  Was informed that was not sufficient so made a run back home to get a bank statement.    Come back with bank statement, still not enough because it had to be of 30 days or less.  Neither the manager nor the agent I worked with had the forethought to indicate this before I left to go get statement.   

Did not end up renting car nor will I from this location in the future.  Regardless of Enterprise policies (which should be more clearly shown online) the staff at this location were no help and borderline incompetent.  I recommend trying a different location before using these guys.

I had to use this place while my car was being repaired at a local shop. The one young man was very nice and super helpful, drove me to the repair shop when I repaired the car as well. The reason for the low rating is the actual cars. The first car they tried to put me in was a Camry with the front bumper hanging off. The next two cars were extremely dirty: windshield had so many bugs and dirt you could barely see through, stains on the seats, etc. I would recommend going a few miles out and finding a better rental place or even a different Enterprise in nearby Gilbert or Scottsdale, where the cars are actually clean and nice in those areas.

I yelped before I left Los Angeles so as to know what to expect. After a long drive from Los Angeles, I was extremely pleased with this location, except you don't have to make a U-turn to enter.  Very nice helpful staff. Was pleased to see the parking big and bright. Night time desk was quick and helpful. Up to our 2nd floor no-smoking room by elevator,  Walking to our room, I was impressed at how clean everything was.Yet it did smell from cigarette smoke. Just why do these smokers get a floor for no smokers?  Our room was big and clean. Bathroom was fantastically clean; no scum  or mold anywhere. No paint peeling. Shower was awesome. Didn't use the soap dispenser because the labels were all gone and I couldn't tell what was what. But then again, who travels without their soaps? All room amenities worked. Large screen T.V.,fridge,microwave,coffee maker,all were clean and worked perfectly. Even had a iron and a board.  Arizona is known to be hot, and it was 110 (June 1st)  but the room A/C worked great. Bed pillows, for me were too soft...but that's me. I was hoping for a area with fresh eggs and rolls, Got a room with dispensers of OJ and apple juice, waffle maker, some rolls, cereal and yogurt. No eggs. :(  
Best part was the check out, Carol is a doll!!! She is sweet and personable...not the norm for hotels with incense and poor English speaking desk people with bad attitudes from lands that tolerate bad service.  I will have to come back....at least just to say hi to Carol!
The word for this place is CLEAN!

I was here on an overnight trip to Tucson. We stayed here after looking for a couple of hotels in the area. The room we got, 330 was clean and organized. The sheets and pillows were all neat, the tables organized, and the bathroom sparkling clean. The breakfast wasn't bad either. And I left feeling happy.
Rates up there with other Hamptons.
Best car rental experience I've ever had.  Friendly, efficient staff (thanks, Greg!).  And when I requested a last-minute drop-off at my house, they were very accommodating. I'll use them again.

My husband and I went to get our car fix and the insurance suggested this location for us to rent a car, bad idea! Jennifer was the person that helped us and she kept telling us over and over again that if anything happens to the car that we are going to get charge, that she has our credit card number on file. I get it that she has to say or explain that to us, but saying it over and over and over and over and over again...seriously? Like she knew
something was wrong with the car or something, and that we were going to get blame. So we were not comfortable at all and ended up just borrowing a family members car and returning the rental car to them the next day. I would stay away from this location.

Great customer service - even though there was a bit of a wait, the customer service was great and they apologized several times so it was worth it.

The car we rented was AWESOME on gas (Dodge Caravan), and the unlimited mileage really helped since we traveled out of state.

Visited the Queen Creek location first and had a TERRIBLE experience. Really glad Superstition Springs saved the day! Highly recommend.

P.S. Parking is a bit tricky - there are VERY few spots... be prepared for that!
Wow, waiting almost an hour for a car.  Had to clean the car?  I guess they don't stock this location?  This wasn't my choice or I would have gone elsewhere.
Had to call 3 times to ask for a pick up and they still didn't show. Forget their commercials about pick up. I needed a car rental for business frequently but they are not reliable. Won't use again

I've been waiting for about an for my car and no end in sight. And I'm the only person here. There was 1 person here when I got here.  2nd time I've rented from this location and had to wait 45 minutes to an hour for a car. Now they tell me the car they have for me is out of gas.  This is ridiculous.
Pretty good. But they didn't keep my spice bottle from san Diego.  Sad. Everything left in car should be in lost and found.
Every time I come to this location everything is so poorly organized. I never make it out of here in under an hour. Very frustrating

I've been using rental cars for various travels for over the past 15 years. The majority of my business has been through Budget but since I've moved I ventured to try Enterprise. I made sure to call ahead before I picked up the car so that there was no problems when I showed up. Everyone seemed to be in a good mood and welcomed me when I walked in. Picking up the car was a cinch, however the gas tank was on empty, Booooo. The CSR Tyler assured me they'd give me a discount when I brought it back. 

So I brought the car back and at first CSR Jaime wanted to negotiate a lower discount than the $36.00 dollars I paid to fill the gas tank. We were able to agree on an amount and I was super happy with Jaime's assistance. As my wife and I walked out I think just about everyone said have a good day.

This will probably end up long, but worth the read.
The towels are not all alike. Some are white (newer) and some are a really dingy off-white. I don't think that they realize this when they drape the smaller ones in layers over the bigger ones. The really dingy ones really stand out against the newer white towels. The older dingy towels also have frayed edges etc. 
The room was ok. Nothing fancy but had a bed and couch and desk. All cheaper stuff, but the place is safe.
It is located in a super location. It is hard to find at first as it is behind a McDonald's and a Denny's. So they are easy walking distance. In fact if you give your room number at the register at Denny's then you get 20% off your bill and Denny's is open 24 hours so that is a good thing. Also there is a large mall on the other side of it so all kinds of stores in the general vicinity. 
The free breakfast isn't bad. You get cereal, milk, orange juice, danishes, scrambled eggs (always were super dry), sausage links (actually really good!), gravy which I didn't try. Also yogurt and bread for toasting. Oh! and a waffle maker. 
We were gone from our room most of the day. The first day we left the room at 6:30am and returned at 8pm. Well the housekeeper decided to save the hotel money and turned OFF our AC and it was August! ugh! We made sure to leave a note on the AC from then on to leave it where it was set. At midnight the first night the room was still in the 90's as the small AC just couldn't bring it down quickly.
Remember to get your free newspaper at the front desk each morning too.

I would rate it a 3 since the staff was friendly, but the price is way too high for a building this old. Remotes for tv barely worked, must need new batteries, shower took 5 minutes for hot water. I might expect that from a $50/ nite hotel but not $100/nite off season with room overlooking a multi-lane road. Even the wall in shower was uneven & there was an open cut off pipe in the ceiling of shower. This place needs a real renovation to deserve those room charges.

I have stayed at this location several times, the first was back in 2006. We stayed there for 3 days if I remember correctly. It was clean and reasonably priced with our government discount. We had a dbl queen room on the 3rd floor. I don't remember to much more about this stay.

The most recent stay was on August 5th. I stopped here again due to location and rates. I did not have a reservation but they had several rooms available. I opted for a King Deluxe room this time (I have stayed at other La Quintas and stayed in the King suites; if you don't need that separate sitting room and couch the King Deluxe is sufficient). It has a nice desk with office chair, another sitting chair, recliner, dresser with flat screen TV. and to night stands on either side of the bed. It also comes with a mini fridge and microwave. 

The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. I paid $86 for a Friday night (very reasonable- the king suite usually runs you about $100) It is cheaper if you book on-line or have a Government or AAA discount, I believe the accept AARP as well. On-line booking usually saves you about $20.

The best part of it is they accept pets at this location (some of their locations do not). They do not charge extra for pets, they just have you sign an agreement about damages your pet may make and give you a list of rules like having your pet on  a leash at all times (your usual pet policies). 

They have a continental breakfast from 7am - 10am; I did not try it but there were a lot of people partaking in the breakfast. They also have an outdoor pool. 

The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was due to the noise level. You can hear people in the hall when you are in your room and  you can hear people in their rooms when you are in the hall. The other reason is they did not have a vending machine or ice machine on my level (level 2). I am not sure where they are located; I  didn't ask or go looking for it.

Don't question it: stay here. We had to reserve last minute and were pleasantly surprised by the remodeled rooms and friendliness of the front desk clerk. Free breakfast is standard fare seen at any hotel, but overall a great experience. I would definitely stay again!

We stayed here because it was cheap and close to my brother's house.

Were we ever pleasantly surprised!  The people were nice here, the room is huge, there's a 'fridge and microwave in the room too.

I like this place, we'll stay here again.
I highly recommend staying here at the Arizona Golf Resort if you are ever in Mesa Arizona, room is abosulely gorgeous, service is a five star.  Would come back for sure whenever I come back to Mesa.
